The ancients believed that the location of cautery did not matter, but this is not entirely true, for I have found through experience that it does make a difference in some cases. De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Cauterization for head pain caused by cold and wet conditions.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization treats the wetness and cold of the service accident, which has two causes: first, an excess of moisture that can cause headaches, migraines, ear infections, and excessive sleep, toothaches, and dizziness, as well as general illness caused by cold. It is also used to treat paralysis, seizures, apoplexy, and similar conditions. [
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization is as follows: first, the patient must be evacuated with a laxative medicine to cleanse the head and scalp for three or four nights, depending on the severity of their condition, their age, and their lifestyle. This will help to prepare the area for cauterization and ensure that any impurities are removed from the body.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then you should instruct the patient to shave their head with a razor, and have them lean back on a slanted bench with their feet raised and placed on a stool. This will help to improve blood flow to the head and make it easier to perform the cauterization. It is important to ensure that the patient is comfortable and relaxed throughout the procedure, as this can help to reduce anxiety and promote healing.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then you should place the edge of your palm on the bridge of the patient's nose, between their eyes. This is a common position for cauterization of the head and scalp, as it allows for easy access to the affected area while also providing support and stability for the patient.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the desired location for cauterization has been reached, mark that spot with a pen or other marker. Then, ignite the olive-shaped cautery tool, which has the following form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place the olive-shaped cautery tool over the marked location on the patient's head, applying gentle downward pressure so that the skin is slowly constricted. As you do this, rotate the tool slowly to ensure even application of heat and prevent burning or other complications.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then gently lift your hand away and check the location of the cauterization. If you see that any amount of skull has been exposed, such as the size of a grain of barley, then raise your hand and apply more pressure with the cautery tool until you can see the bone clearly, as I have described.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it over the cauterized area, leaving it in place for three days. This will help to promote healing and prevent infection.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place a piece of clean, dry cloth over the wound and leave it in place until the scab from the cauterization has been completely destroyed by the heat. This will help to protect the wound from infection and promote healing.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the wound with a tetrafarmed ointment until it is healed. This will help to soothe any pain or discomfort and promote healing, ensuring the best possible outcome for the patient.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it has been said that when the wound remains open for a longer period of time, it heals better and is more beneficial, as it allows for greater exposure to air and improved healing. However, this is not always the case, and in some situations, it may be necessary to close the wound more quickly to prevent infection or other complications.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some have said that the coccyx, or tailbone, should be cauterized all the way down to the bone, and that the cautery tool should be left in place until it becomes attached to a portion of the bone. This is a more extreme form of cauterization that is typically reserved for severe or chronic conditions that have not responded to other forms of treatment.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then the area that has become attached to the bone should be shaved and treated. This may involve removing any remaining cautery tool or other foreign material, as well as cleaning and dressing the wound to promote healing and prevent infection.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others have said that the cautery tool should be applied to the very end, so that it penetrates deeply into the bone and causes significant damage. This is known as alphecatia, and it is a more extreme form of cauterization that is typically reserved for severe or chronic conditions that have not responded to other forms of treatment.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they consider that vapors from the head escape from that place.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And keep the wound open for a long time, and let it be healed until it is solidified.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I do not advise the use of these two types of cautery in all cases, but only in certain ones and according to my judgment; and it is better for you, while you are healthy, to leave it alone; because the head is uncovered by a solution of its continuity, just as we have testified in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of a hot nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and with that one, do the work while being safe.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	On cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting pain occurs throughout the head of a patient and it has persisted for a long time, and various treatments such as cuppings, coctions, cataplasms, emplasters, lotions, potions, pills, and similar remedies have been used, and especially if the patient has already been cauterized with one cautery but it has not helped with any of those causes, then consider that if the patient's head is of a strong constitution in its nature and is not hot, and a great cold is found, then cauterize that area again with another cautery, but only slightly.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And cauterize the area above the patient's ear with a cautery while the vein is still open.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the vein and expose the bone to the extent that we have determined, and then cauterize the area behind the patient's head at the location called "vas", which is where a cupping glass is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And move your hand gently in this process, without exposing the bone, because the patient will experience a great deal of pain that is different from the pain caused by other cauteries on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say that this cautery should be used in its place, because it is necessary that the cautery used to cauterize the corners of the head and the occiput is more subtle than the one used to cauterize the middle of the head; and this is the method for doing so.
Capitol ters.	Third chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On cauterization of new migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When pain occurs in a part of the head, either as a sudden pain or a continuous pain extending to the eye, then evacuate the head with purgative medicines and administer another treatment, which I have mentioned for other illnesses; and if that does not work, then cauterization is necessary in two ways: either with a burning and acrid medicine or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cauterization with a burning medicine is done by taking a piece of aloe wood and charring it, and then applying the hot ends to both ends of the area to be cauterized.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then make an incision in the area of pain in the temple with a sharp lancet until you reach the bone and it is hidden from view.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then apply pressure to the area with a piece of cloth to reduce constriction and leave it for three hours; and then remove the aloe wood and let the wound remain open for two or three days, and then place a compress soaked in warm water over the area until the bone is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with an ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do so with some burning medicines which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But cauterization with iron is done in this way: heat the iron for cautery, and it should be shaped as follows:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called "clavis claviculae", because its shape resembles a key with a slight curvature in the middle.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place the iron on the area of pain and hold it there firmly so that it does not slip, while rotating it slowly at a moderate speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of tissue that is burnt by the tip of the iron reaches the bone, lift your hand slightly so that the artery below is not burnt and there is no bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a compress soaked in salt water to the area and leave it for three days; and then place a compress soaked in warm water over the wound, and treat it with an ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the tip of a knife as in cautery, and be careful not to cut an artery in this new type of migraine.
Capitol quart.	Fourth chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On cauterization of old migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat migraines with what we have said in the previous treatment, and what we have said in the divisions of illnesses, and it is not helpful, and sometimes due to the severity of the illness, what we have said about the first cautery with medicine or with fire is not sufficient, then it is necessary to heat the knife-shaped cautery until it turns white, because this means that you should place it on the area of pain with a line as long as your finger, or even longer; and then place your hand firmly over it and press down so that you can cut through the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is important for you to be careful not to damage the jaw joint due to chewing, and not to burn the tendons or nerves that move it, and not to cause spasms.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And regarding the precautions and caution to be taken in case of bleeding from the cut artery, there is fear because cutting it is dangerous, especially for those who are not knowledgeable about what they are doing and lack experience; and so leave the operation to a more experienced practitioner at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come back with a reminder of the treatment for bleeding from an artery, according to its type, in its appropriate place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this type of cautery is not sufficient for this illness and the patient's body can tolerate it, then cauterize the area in the middle of the head as we have described, and heal the wound until it is fully healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, use the cautery that we described in the chapter on stretching an artery with two knives, as this is better and more effective.
Capitol .v.	Fifth chapter.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On cauterization of ear pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is ear pain due to cold and it is treated with purgative medicines and other treatments that I have mentioned, but the pain does not go away, then heat the needle-shaped cautery, which is called "puncta". The shape of this cautery is as follows: [image of a needle-shaped cautery].
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then heat the needle-shaped cautery and move it around the entire ear in a circular motion, or in the circumference of each part if the pain is in one specific area.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Guide the needle-shaped cautery along the ridge of the ear, a little at a time, after marking the area with a probe.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if you use a cautery with ten points on the entire ear, and place it there firmly so that it does not slip, while rotating it slowly at a moderate speed. After cauterization, apply a compress soaked in salt water to each of the burnt areas, and leave them for three days. And then place a compress soaked in warm water over the wound, and treat it with an ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .vi.	Sixth chapter.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of the cauterization of swelling.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Swelling, which is cured and cauterization of which is only of the kinds that come through vein-flecking, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the kind that occurs through drying or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that kind of swelling with jerras and capipurgi and guarguarismes, and you don't find the cure effective, then it is necessary to cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first at the tip of the ear, the second a little below its temperature, and the third at the junction of two labia.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, because softening will not occur in the part that appears sick.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is that you cauterize with the cautery on the right side of the highest point of the ear, rising slightly above the top of the head, and in temperature another, the length of which should be according to the length of the finger, and then place your hand with the heated cautery until it has burned the amount corresponding to the thickness of the swelling.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is the specialty of the cutler, the shape of which is in front of the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle that what you see, and it is necessary for the knife to be slightly less thick than superfluous thickness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then heal the area with what is prepared beforehand until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Capital VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of the cauterization of old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you cure it with what we have said and do not find the remedy effective and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize them with four cauteries: primarily on all the corners of their head; and with a cautery in the middle of their head, as we have said; and with a cautery on the nape.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of cauterization is done as previously stated.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach, and further back; then let it be healed with what is prepared beforehand.
Capitol .viii.	Capital VIII. [https://www.poemhunter.com/best-poems/arthur-clough/](https://www.poemhunter.com/best-poems/arthur-clugh/)
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of the cauterization for forgetfulness made through flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	It is necessary that at the beginning, large jerras (enemas) and serving pills be given to the patient for softening.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave all of the patient's head and place on their nape an ointment described in the treatise of ointments.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And place that a few times, because that is a method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do it in the same order as I have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And therefore, if they heal well through those methods; but if not, then make three cauteries in the back of their head, which should descend from the highest point of the head to the lowest point of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place between each cautery the width of the finger, and then heal the cautery with what has been prepared beforehand.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you wish to add more and the patient can tolerate it, then do so in the middle of the head; but if you wish to add more, then cauterize them on both corners (of the forehead).
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then heal it until it is healed; and let the cauteries be olive-shaped as previously described.
Capitol .ix.	Capital IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of the cauterization for paralysis and softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	It is necessary to proceed with cleansing of the head through enemas and what has been said; and then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize them in the middle of the head with a heated cautery, and on all the corners of the head, and on the back of their neck, and with three heated cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the disease of body softening for many and tolerant patients with severe illness, then cauterize them with four heated cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and deliberately on the spine until it has burned deeply into the patient's flesh, and raise your hand. (Note: this translation is unsure about "aleva la tieua ma" as it can mean several things in medieval medical texts)
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then heal it until it is healed; and let this cautery be olive-shaped.
Capitol .x.	Capital X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of the cauterization for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	An epileptic should not be cauterized unless the epilepsy is through vein-flecking (blood vessels).
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore, it is necessary to cleanse the brain of the patient at the beginning with jerras (enemas) and with other remedies that have been mentioned in the division when the patient's illness is severe and they are intolerant to exceptional medical treatments.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate medications, then administer laxatives and chewing remedies for several days beforehand, along with improvement of their diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head and cauterize them in the middle of the head with a heated cautery using the previous method, and on the back of their neck, and on each corner of their head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then cauterize them with heated cauteries as I have said, having paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let it be olive-shaped as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then place a subtle cautery in this manner. (Note: the text does not provide further information about "this manner")
Capitol .xi.	Capital XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of the cauterization for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted wetness and thick flame, then cauterize them with the heated cauteries that I mentioned in the case of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is superfluity inclined towards melancholy and the patient's body is wet, then give them to drink something that cleanses their brain according to what has been previously stated in the division (section).
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And approach the patient's head, and place a well-made touret (an instrument used to calm restless patients) on their forehead, and then place it in the middle of their head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be sixty years old and held firmly from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply a liniment; and it is preferable to use an antidote made from sheep's wool.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that (liniment) over the fire for a moderate warmth, which will relieve the suffering when it is applied to the affected area.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then apply that (liniment) in the middle of their forehead on the "touret," and let it remain until they are refreshed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this to the patient once a week, along with other beneficial treatments until they are healed; or if you prefer, cauterize the affected area with small points as needed, but make sure your hand is equipped with a cautery tool in this manner: This is a type of cautery that moistens the brain with evenness.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then place a piece of linen soaked in a mixture of bread or wool grease.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Chapter 12: On cauterization of water that descends to the joint.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have determined the onset of water in the joint by the signs that I have mentioned in the division, then begin (the treatment) and give the patient to drink something that will purify their head, and keep them away from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And have them sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And order the patient to shave their head, and cauterize that area in the middle of their head with a cautery tool; and furthermore, cauterize that area with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of water descending into two joints, or on one temple if it is the beginning of water in one joint.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut with a cautery tool all the veins and arteries that are located below the temples; and let the cauteries be in that line at the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful not to cause bleeding when cauterizing; and if you see any bleeding, stop it with some medicine that is within your means.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And bring with you skill in the extraction of arteries and in the incision of those (blood vessels) and caution regarding bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is necessary to cauterize in the back of the neck, between two bones, with two well-made cauteries.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Chapter 13: On cauterization of old tears (eye styes).
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes have become old and hardened due to veins and arteries in the visible part of the head outside and it is confirmed that this is a superfluous, fleck-like accumulation, then cauterize with a cautery tool as described in the chapter on water descending into the joints. Cauterize in the middle of the forehead, between two temples, and between two bones in the back of the neck with two well-made cauteries each time.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if necessary, also cauterize in the corner of the eye, on the outside edge of the eyebrow, with a small cautery tool.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Chapter 14: On cauterization of foul odor of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that with what we have mentioned in the division and your treatment does not improve, then prepare (a remedy) and give the patient to drink the juice of cochineal for three nights; and furthermore, approach the patient's head and cauterize it with a medium-sized olive-shaped cautery tool.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And furthermore, cauterize that with a carnation-shaped cautery tool with two well-made cauteries just below the eyebrows, on both sides of the hairline.

E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the shape of the carnation-shaped cautery tool.

Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Chapter 16: On cauterization of the eyelid when the hair has turned inward towards the inner corner and knotted the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the eyelashes have turned inward towards the inner corner and knotted the eye, cauterization is necessary in two ways: either through burning or through a combustible medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If it is done with a fire-based cautery tool, order the patient to read their eyelashes in the same way as those who clean (them), until they are elongated and curled; and if the hairs knot or tangle, then you should strengthen the patient's eyes with a bandage so that they do not suffer any harm while the lashes grow back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Once they have grown and curled, then place the patient's head in your lap and make a sign on their eyelids with your thumb, using a symbol resembling a myrtle leaf, and let the beginning of the symbol be near the lashes.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And furthermore, place a piece of linen soaked in egg white or mucilage made from powdered pith on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And furthermore, ignite the cautery tool of this shape:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And furthermore, cauterize that area of the eyelids which you have marked with your symbol, little by little, in several sessions, until the surface of the affected skin, which is similar to a myrtle leaf, is completely burned and appears evenly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of health from this medical procedure is that you will see the eyelid of the eye contracted and the lashes lifted upwards towards the inner corner of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And therefore, lift up your hand and leave it for three days, and furthermore place a piece of linen soaked in bread poultice on the area until the scar has healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And furthermore, care for that area with ointment until it has healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament. Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh. E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And it is not hidden from those who study this art (the art of medicine) how important it is to keep the rectum clear.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	About the cauterization of a fistula in the lacrimal gland of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap. E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then heat up the cautery, which has this shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is concave and shaped like a reed or the beak of a vulture, with one end used to make the cautery.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it can be sharp at the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, it can also be round like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the one that is concave is better for this type of work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press on the fistula if it is open, and draw out any pus and dry up the area.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then make an incision and remove the purulence from it.

Then place the heated cautery over it and hold it there with your hand, but be careful not to touch the eyelid or cause discomfort to the patient by letting the cautery stray too close to the nose. Once you have positioned the cautery, apply it firmly to the glands of the eye and destroy any infected tissue.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of your cauterization you notice that it has reached the bone, that is good; but if not, then repeat the process once or twice more as necessary, and leave it alone for three days. Here is another method of cauterization for a fistula that was mentioned earlier: find the location of the fistula and open it up. Then apply a very fine, thin rod-shaped cautery to the opening with the following form: make it one ounce of molten lead; hold it firmly with forceps, being careful not to harm the patient or allow the molten lead to touch their eye. It is important to place a piece of cloth soaked in egg white or water over the patient's eye, as the lead will adhere to the opening and heal it through miraculous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula has been healed with the cauterization and treatment that we have mentioned, then it is good. Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	About the cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.

When an abscess forms on the roof of the mouth or in the gums around the teeth and becomes inflamed, ruptured, old, and then a fistula is formed, and you treat it but your treatment does not help, then you must cauterize it according to the size of the fistula. After cauterization, cure the area with the remedies that we have mentioned earlier until it heals completely.

Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	About the cauterization of teeth and softening of gums.

When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicines but do not see improvement, then have the patient place their head in your lap, and heat up the cautery tool to this shape: [insert image of a small, thin, pointed cautery tool]. E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then remove your hand and repeat the cautery several times as desired.

Then have the patient rinse their mouth with saltwater and hold it there for an hour, then spit it out. This will strengthen the damaged tooth and firm up the softened gums, while also drying out any excess moisture that may be contributing to the problem.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	About the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by cold or if there is a worm or swelling in the tooth, and you do not see improvement with medicine, then cauterization can be done in two ways: either with an ox bladder or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery is done by taking a rod of cow and bull's horn, heating it in fire, then quickly wrapping it with a cloth at the end of a stick. Then, plunge the hot cauterizing iron into water and place it on the painful tooth immediately until it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this process several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish to do so, wrap some wool or cloth around the hot iron and place it on the painful tooth until the heat of the iron reaches the nerve of the socket of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, when cauterizing with fire, you should pay attention to the size of the room or iron, and if there is any swelling in the area, make sure that the intensity of the fire does not reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then, heat the cautery iron to its appropriate shape and place it on the tooth while keeping your hand over it until the cautery cools down. Repeat this process several times, either that day or the next day, until the pain subsides.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	It is necessary that during the application of the cautery, the patient fills their mouth with good saliva and keeps it there for an hour while rinsing their mouth. This is the method for using the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize with whatever you wish, at whichever end that is possible for you to do so.

Capitol .xxii.	Capital Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the Cautery of Exophthalmoses (or Bulging Eyes).
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When the exophthalmos is due to phlegm and cold humors and does not respond to digestive medications, and you wish to perform a gentle digestion on it, then heat the cannula-shaped cautery with two pointed ends so that smoke comes out from one end of the cautery while you pass it over the other end. Place the lit cautery over the swelling once, and if necessary, repeat until the cautery reaches the root of the swelling.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the swelling is small, then place the cautery according to its size, and leave it on for three days and place a cloth soaked in saline over it until the burned matter has been absorbed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with ointment, bandages, and cloths until it is healed.

Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the Cautery of Hoarseness of Voice and Constriction of the Neck.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humors come to the lung's throat, especially when this is accompanied by a cold complexion, it is necessary for the patient to be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medications, and then cauterize the area at the root of the throat in the depressed location.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful not to reach the cautery to the throat or burn the windpipe, but only slightly.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And then cauterize with another cautery at the joint of the neck at the last vertebra of the spine.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And let the cautery be a needle in the manner described previously.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with what is described earlier until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the Cautery of Lung Disease and Cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are due to cold humors, the patient does not have fever or consumption, and the illness is chronic, then cauterize it with two cauteries on the collarbones in the depressed areas near the breastbone and ribs; and with another cautery between the nipples on the chest. Let the cauteries be needle-shaped according to the previous description.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, make the cautery punctate with the cautery that is called "puncta," whose shape is described earlier in the section on ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And make holes with those punctures, and then cure it with what is described earlier until it is healed.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And let the cautery have three prongs, for cauterization is done with this: with one pass you can make three cauteries according to this form.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the Cautery of Titillicus, which is the Head of the Auxiliary.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the auxiliary is dislocated due to slippery humors and does not return in its time, then you must wait until it returns to its usual position before attempting any treatment. And if it becomes dislocated again with a small movement, as we have observed, then it is necessary to first reduce the dislocation by gently moving it back into place. The patient should be turned onto their side or stomach, and the neck should be lifted with the fingers of your left hand on the inner part of the cervical spine if the joint is dislocated inward.

E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And repeat this process several times according to this count, and there will be eight cauteries in total.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then place the cautery on the wound with salt, and have the patient rest quietly and avoid moving the affected limb for some time until it is healed.
