And if none of those options are available to you, then place your finger on the area until the blood coagulates, and irrigate the area with water at a very high temperature until the swelling subsides, and strengthen it as needed.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And what is light pus in the extraction of an artery is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two knives, since you have marked the two places with a probe, and place each one, slightly ignited, until they reach the bone and cut the vein into two places, so that what is between its ends is lengthened, because it has not been completely solidified by this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And let the sharpness of the two knives be similar.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	However, if it is of lesser sharpness than two knives, it is better, because if they are as sharp as two knives, then they will cut into each layer, and you will not cut the flesh with speed.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, as in those cases where there is some thickness, keep the heat of the fire in those and the flesh will be cut lightly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in all works and lighter.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And let the space between the two knives be the width of a finger.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the care of sharp and acidic ulcers on the heels.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When they are acidic ulcers and it is the wound of those veins that are on the surface of the head, and no medicine can offer any cure for them, and sometimes the patient's face becomes red and they feel a pulsating sensation in their forehead as if from ants crawling, and the heels become weakened, swollen, and the skin on them is wrinkled, and the eyelids are scratched by the sharpness of the tears, the old remedies for treating these wounds have been to use a mixture of honey and vinegar, and they call this treatment "spassa".
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And it is that you command the patient to shave the hairs on their forehead, and then make three incisions at equal distances according to the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of each incision is two digits: let one incision be equidistant to the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the length a little less than the movement of the lacrimal glands which are in the lacrimal, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And be careful not to cut the arteries which are in two places, and extend your hand away from the continuation of both jawbones.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each incision is three digits, adjust accordingly.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of sponge prepared or dry cloths with which to dry the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the spatula with two sharp ends, and this is the shape of the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the temples to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape with that all the skin that is between the two incisions, using the cephace which is on the bone, and then do the same in the middle of the first to the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then straighten this spatula and insert into the first incision another tool called a knife, sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And place the sharp edge of that toward the attached skin of the skin, and the blunt edge against the bone, and push it in until it reaches the middle incision, and cut with it all the veins that descend from the head to the heels.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But let the incision continue to the point of the skin, and then do the same in the middle incision between the other incision.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And since there is a flow of blood in large quantities, press on the places of the cloth where the clotted blood is, to stop it.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then place in each incision a piece of old cloth, and put on top of them poultices made with wine and oil and sour wine, and make sure that they do not become infected with abscesses caused by cautery.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, loosen the ligament and administer a large infusion of hot water or tea, and then treat it with basilicon ointment with rose oil and other things to heal the wounds.
Capitol .v.	Chapter Five.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the treatment of ulcers by purgative and those that descend from inside the head to the heels.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When you notice sharp and continuous veins of purgatives, sometimes the patient's heels become weakened and small, and their appearance is debilitated, and their eyelids are ulcerated and their eyelashes fall out, and there is a severe headache with sharp, excruciating pain in the area around the temples, then you know from these symptoms that the matter and purgatives come not from any other place but from many veins inside the skull.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best treatment for these is this: you should command the patient to shave their forehead, and then make an incision in the middle of it, a little less than the width (starting from the left temple and ending at the right temple; and let it be deep enough to reach the bone; and keep your hand away from the muscles around the temples that are affected by chewing), until the bone is exposed.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry all the blood with a sponge or dry cloth, and then fill the space between the two lips of the incision with old cotton or linen cloth.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then strengthen it with poultices made of wine and oil to prevent abscesses caused by cautery.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you see that the abscess has diminished, then it is necessary to scrub the bone where the flesh begins to grow, and then treat it with a drying regimen that promotes the growth of new flesh, such as by mixing equal parts wheat flour and colophony and applying it as a plaster to the wound, at the site of new flesh formation.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter Six.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of earwax.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The cause of all earwax is one of four types: either it is mineral-like stone, such as iron or glass, or it comes from plants like wax or beans, or it is fluid-like, such as water and sour wine and their equivalents, or it is caused by some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And so when stone or another cause similar to it, which does not belong or fit in the ear, is in the ear, then expose the ear to sunlight, and if you see stone, distill some kind of oil like violet or cedar on it, and then perform the extraction, making the person sneeze with conditions, and close their nostrils at the moment of sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And apply some compresses of cloth or wool to the outer edge of the ear, and pull the ear upwards to the nearby areas, because often this condition is caused by excessive wax.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not expelled (wax), then perform extraction using the instrument called an "ear spoon" which has this form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	If it is expelled with the ear spoon, then that's good; and if not, then perform extraction using a small amount of doubled wax.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And if it is not expelled by that, then make a cannula out of silver and insert the end of the cannula into the ear canal, and seal around the cannula with wax and softened oil so that only the cannula enters.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract it with strong suction, because many times this condition occurs as described.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not expelled in this manner, then take some alum-infused wool or an old apparatus with which birds' wings are pressed, place a small amount on the end of the ray, and then cover that area appropriately.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And insert that into the ear canal with ease, and then dry out the ear from excess moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And if it is not expelled by all the causes that we have described, then you should consider cutting it out before it becomes an abscess or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	The method for cutting it out is to first make an incision in the patient's vein at the appropriate place and draw blood according to its nature, then place your fingers on both sides of the ear and turn it upwards. Finally, make a small incision in the earlobe where it meets the head and press down firmly to remove the wax.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And the incision should be in the shape of a crescent moon and reach the bone, and once the bone is visible, remove it if possible with appropriate instruments; and then quickly close the incision and treat it until it heals completely.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause of the problem in the ear is an inflamed and swollen fatty tissue, then administer treatment and extraction; but if it does not respond to your treatment, then take fine, new spittle according to this formula:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	And administer the abscission of that fatty tissue which has fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do that when you think it is already wet from the steam of the ear; instead, place it on many compresses and extract it with gentle forceps or a small probe as previously described, because extraction will be easier this way.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water that is introduced into the ear, it is necessary for the patient to sneeze with their mouth closed at first, and then fill the other ear with some old cotton and place it over the ear containing the water. If it is expelled by this method, then that's good; but if not, then take several thin strips of linen and heat them in the fire for a moment, and have the patient insert one of those strips into the ear canal and jump on one foot on the same side as the affected ear and strike the strip inside the ear with another piece of wood.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore, continue doing it with a piece of wood until all the water has been expelled.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And once the water is removed, take some paper or cloth... ...and insert one end of it into the ear and extend the other end with fire until most of it is burned off.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then insert more cloth and do this several times until all the water has been expelled, and straighten it with a cannula as described earlier for the wooden extractor.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the case of an animal entering the ear and it is small, similar to a flea or tick, treat it as we have previously described in the division; but if it is large and causes pain in the movement, then perform extraction using forceps and probes. The cause of this is easier to remedy than other causes that may occur in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the case of an earworm that has been generated in the ear, when you treat it with what we have said in the division and in the treatment of distillations and not confects, then it is necessary to examine the ear in sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore, if any of the causes of worms appear, then extract it using forceps or a fine probe; but if no cause appears, then take a cannula that is narrow below and wide above, which has this form:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the thin end of the cannula into the ear according to the amount that the patient can tolerate, and then suck with it using strong suction, doing this several times until all the worms have been expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if it does not respond to your treatment, then you should close and seal the opening of the cannula with wax as previously described; then administer distilled medicines that have proven effective in the treatment of worms, which can be found in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your effusion be the one where you pour medical oils into the ear using this instrument, of which this is its shape:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	Make it of silver or iron, straight, with a small hole at the end and flat on top.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so let it be as a plunger that fits into the concavity of the nozzle, where it will be necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the reed and wrap it appropriately at the end, then pour oil or juice of any herb, or whatever medicine you choose in the nozzle - which is inside the ear -, and then insert the wrapped reed with gentle pressure, and press it with your hand to expel the medicine slowly until the patient feels the oil within.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And let what is inside the ear be slightly burned with fire.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And make sure that the liquid you distill in the ear is not too cold, for ear medicines do not tolerate that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the treatment of blockage in the ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some newborns get blockage in their ears because they are not yet pierced, and this happens to some adults due to wax buildup or ear canal narrowing; sometimes the blockage is inside the ear canal and not visible, while other times it is outside of it.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And the one that occurs inside the ear canal and is not visible is more likely to be difficult to treat.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in the case where you can see it, you should place the affected ear of the patient towards the sun and look into it. [**Note: This recommendation may have been made to help the practitioner see better inside the ear canal, as sunlight could provide additional light.**]
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so if you see a visible blockage, open it with a thin spatula of which this is the shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	Let the tip of it be narrow, with one side sharp and the other not, and let the spatula be two finger-widths wide so as not to harm the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And so if the blockage is due to earwax or skin growth in the ear canal, then use fine probes and gently remove all the excess flesh.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the blockage is inside the ear canal, then take a thin reed and slightly heat it up with fire, and then insert it gently into the ear canal. [**Note: The purpose of heating the reed is to soften any wax in the ear.**]
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And so if you have detected a blockage by the patient's difficulty in hearing, gently remove the obstruction with ease and be careful not to harm the ear nerves.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place in the ear a cloth soaked in the shape of the nozzle that you have wrapped in Egyptian wax, and do this for several days until you are sure of the healing of the injury, or take some herbs and soak them in water and grind them into powder, and apply it three times a day. And if the ear is already swollen, then remove any pus and replace it with another cloth soaked in rose-scented wax until the swelling subsides, and continue to care for it until it heals completely.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if bleeding occurs, then soak a sponge or cloth in cold water and place it over the ear, and use the other treatment that stops the flow of blood, which is called "distillation" in the treatise.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the treatment of blepharitis, which occurs on the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Blepharitis, which sometimes occurs due to moisture and sometimes dryness in the eyes. [**Note: The term "athezil" is an archaic form of the word "athletilia," which was used to describe inflammation of the eyelid.**]
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, it is necessary to have tweezers or probes and cut them with their tips, and then place them on the affected areas three times a day. [**Note: The purpose of placing the instruments on the affected areas is not clear without further context.**]
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if pain and bleeding occur, then cauterize the affected area with a fine lancet-like cautery tool.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	The best cauterization is to return several times to the incisions and wounds until all causes of their tips are removed, and when they are cauterized with fire, those tips are burned and do not return. [**Note: This recommendation suggests that the cauterization process should be repeated until the wound heals completely.**]
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment for styes that occur on the eyelids of the eyes.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Often, bumps appear on the eyelids of the eyes due to various causes that resemble styes in their strength and hardness, which is why they are called styes.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick moisture on the eyelid, both above and below.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation for styes is to first consider whether the bump is protruding from the eyelid and affecting all parts of it, and if the cause of it is light.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, make an incision on the bump with a scalpel, and then scrape it from all sides with ease until it dries up. Then use tweezers to lift it up and cut off the remainder.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not prepared to make an incision on it and can only penetrate the eyelid little by little, then this is not a problem.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the bump is large, then adjust it with stitches and care for it until it heals completely.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not encounter any problems because the ointment used to treat it will restore and heal it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	If the bump is declining towards the inner parts of the eyelid, then lift the eyelid and use tweezers to lift up the bump and make an incision, whichever you prefer, and press it from all sides. And if the incision on the eyelid is long, this is not a problem.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	After making the incision, wash the eye with saltwater and care for the affected area until it heals completely.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	On the treatment of chalazion on the upper eyelid. [**Note: A chalazion is a benign bump that forms in the oil glands of the eyelid and can cause redness, swelling, or pain.**]
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Chalazion is a swelling that forms in the eyelid's tissues, and it commonly affects children, causing their eyes to become red, swollen, or painful. It can also affect their vision and cause them to tear up. [**Note: The term "axcirnath" is an archaic form of the word "chalazion," which is derived from the Greek word "khalasis," meaning a hard swelling.**]
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And so you see that they often rub their eyes and sleep with them closed, and there is moisture on the lower eyelids where the eyebrows are, which indicates inflammation and a clear sign of imminent infection in the eye; and when you press on the area with your fingers, you feel the bump underneath. [**Note: This description of chalazion symptoms is consistent with modern medical knowledge.**]
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	One method of treatment for chalazion is for the patient to place their head on your lap and cover their eyes with a cloth soaked in warm water or herbs, forming a circle around the affected area that contains arthranax from all sides. Then, place the cloth over the affected area and press gently with your fingers until you feel a bump appear in the center of the circle. After that, make an incision in the middle of the swelling using a scalpel, making sure not to cut too deep. The incision should be no larger than the one made during bloodletting.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	However, in cases where the chalazion is internal and located deep within the eyelid tissue, it may be necessary to make a larger incision that extends all the way down to the abscess to ensure proper drainage. This is because the abscess often develops along the white part of the eye and requires an incision to release the pus, which can help alleviate symptoms and promote healing.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, extract the pus from the eyelid using the cloth that you have wrapped around your fingers and massage it gently with both hands to disperse any remaining residue.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to touch the incision with the scalpel, so as not to damage the eye or cause further injury.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	However, if you do not see pus at the beginning of the incision, you can continue to probe gently until it appears, and then extract it as described above. Afterwards, soak clean cloths in a solution of water and wine vinegar and place them over the affected area, securing them with sterile gauze or bandages.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And if the chalazion is dry and does not produce any pus, place a small amount of salt in the concavity of the incision to absorb any remaining moisture.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And care for the affected area until it heals completely.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	However, if a boil or abscess forms in the affected area, treat it with a sedative plaster until it heals completely.
Capitol .xi.	Capital XI
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Methods of treating the eye.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When hairs from the eyebrows fall out due to plucking or aging, this causes problems for the eye and leads to various ailments such as constant tearing, swelling of the eyelids, and inflammation inside the eyelid that can cause destruction of the eye, which is called "tactinir del huel". It can be cured in four ways: through cautery with fire; through sharp medicine, as mentioned before in the chapter on cautery; by making incisions and suturing; or through the use of cannulas, as I will explain.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And so it is necessary for you to place the patient's head in your lap; then turn the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it turns, that is good. But if not, insert a needle into the one where there is more pus below the eyelid, and make the needle penetrate the pus above, and do this near the edge of the eyelid where the hairs grow. Then pull the pus upwards with the eyelid, and turn it back with your finger.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then make an incision in the inner part of the eyelid below the lashes with a sharp spatula from the lacrimal major to the lacrimal minor; and then extract the pus and place it underneath the eyelid, dusted with small pieces of cotton or cloth. Then apply a plaster over the eyelid with a tent, and let it be as if it were a leaf of myrtle.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	However, it is necessary that the shape should be according to the amount of swelling of the eyelid, for this varies from person to person, because there are some who require a large incision in the eyelid, depending on the amount by which it is swollen.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then make an incision with the spatula along the two lines that you have marked, and begin at the lacrimal major and continue to the lacrimal minor.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is near the natural lashes, as with a large king's crest.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then put the probe in one of the two angles of the eyelid and scrape it all, and then adjust with stitching the two lips together with fine wool or lanolin, and wipe away the blood, and if you want to make the superfluous pus adhere over the eyebrows with some sticky causes, do so, but otherwise, don't worry.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then let the stitching of the wounds heal within three to four days and take care of it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, leave the wound without stitches and care for it with drying and constricting agents, because the eyelid is raised due to the sealing of the wound and its accumulation; but stitching is better. Therefore, I have said this about the ancient method of cauterization.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	However, it is necessary for the patient to be careful and attentive to their condition, and this is good practice, and not a cause for fear.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And there is another method of cauterization, which is to place a figure in the shape of a myrtle leaf on the eyelid and then lift the eyelid with three separate and connected hooks in this form.
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if that is not possible, then use hooks and make sure they are clean. If not, take a needle with thread and insert it in the middle of the figure, and place another pus near the lacrimal major, and more pus near the lacrimal minor, and adjust between your fingers those pus-filled areas equally, and then use those hooks to lift your hand with gentle force, lifting the entire eyelid over which the figure is placed as we have recommended.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips of the wound with stitches and take care of it until it heals.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if an abscess occurs at your incision or cut, soothe it with cerote and similar substances, and with ointments.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes some patients' eyelashes turn inward, so it is necessary to use the incision method that we discussed earlier; but stitching is more artificial in each case.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Cauterization with cannulas is done in the following way:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	and it is that you turn the eyelid and cut the figure that is inside according to what I have described, and then by skill make two cannulas or two thin rods whose length is according to the length of the eyelid and the width of which is smaller than the width of the spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already made incisions at the ends of each section where the threads are located.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then add each one with subtlety on top of the excess from the eyelid of the eye, and constrict the cannulas of each section with strong tightness, and leave it for several days, because the eyelid will die and become necrotic due to the tightness and will dry out until it falls out by itself.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it has become too late, then break the cannulas at the sutures, and take care of the wound until it heals.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Therefore, when it is swollen, the eyelid is raised and the lashes do not prick (i.e., are visible and not pointing downwards).
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the method for making two canes, which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and let it be of a length and width neither too much nor too little.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Chapter 12.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the hairs are unnatural, coarse and sharp and prick the eye, then the procedure for it is that you take a thin needle and dip it in a mixture of subtle musk and lion's fat, and make sure to carefully adjust the ends and sharpen each one in a subtle manner.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the fields (applied) be of a palm's worth in quantity.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you make another subtle mixture and apply it quickly, sharpening its ends if necessary.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then position the patient's head towards you and ensure it is near sunlight so that your work can be seen clearly, for this operation is delicate and small in nature.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle into the root of the hair, carefully adjusting it to fit snugly, and make sure that it penetrates the eyelid quickly, extracting the unnatural hair in the process.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the hair out carefully and insert it into an incision, ensuring that there are only one to three hairs inserted.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand away with it, ensuring that the hair is extracted along with the natural eyelash using an incision on the eyelid.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if the incision is not successful and does not extract the hair, then pull at the incision along the edges until the incision itself is extracted above the upper opening (i.e., the eyelid).
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And then check the eye using vision to ensure that the incision and mixture have been removed successfully, and apply a bandage or stitches to keep the area closed for two to three days, allowing the hair to adhere back to its location and grow new healthy skin tissue.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the hair is too short to attach to the natural hairs, then you should attach a longer hair and raise it up with that or allow it to grow for a while until it reaches a suitable length before raising it.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.[The next chapter likely deals with another medical topic or procedure].
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Chapter 13.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When one sees an outward turning of the eyelid (ectropion) due to contraction of the eyelid when it turns inwards on either side, or on the right or left, due to poor wound healing from injury, sectioning, or cauterization, it is referred to as leporina, and this condition can be natural or accidental. It may occur due to improper healing of wounds, sections, or cauterization, or due to similar causes of damage.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The method of the operation is that you make an incision in the scar tissue and separate the lips of it, inserting a piece of linen cloth between them, and then binding them together so they can heal.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And it is not necessary to use the treatment for the causes that dry or constrict because if you do so, the ectropion will return even worse than before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Instead, use a treatment for the causes that soften, such as fenugreek. Soak it in water with crushed leaves and seeds, or apply diluted garlic juice to the affected area. Submerge the linen cloth in this mixture and use it to treat the condition.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	The goal of your treatment is to perforate carefully, ensuring that there is no scar tissue or improper healing as before.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	The operation we described is not only a correction of the outward turning (ectropion), but it also restores the shape and form of the area as it was before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14. (The next chapter likely deals with another medical topic or procedure).
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Chapter 14.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	The entropion that affects the lower eyelid is truly called entropion, and it can be either natural or accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	However, the accidental form of entropion is caused by injury or infection, such as wounds, cuts, burns, or other similar causes.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	The method for operating on this condition involves taking a needle with double thread and inserting it into the skin, passing it from the tear duct on the left side to the tear duct on the right, ensuring that the thread passes through both ends of the skin.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	Then pull the skin apart with the needle and stitch it up using the same needle, making sure to insert the spatula (a surgical tool) wide enough to create a gap between the eyelid and the eyeball. This will prevent the lashes from rubbing against the eye.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And if the shape of the eyelid returns to its normal state, it is good; but if not, take a thread and place it in the incision, then use that thread to turn the eyelid into the correct shape, creating two cuts on either side of the lower eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And let the ends of the two cuts be at the angles of the incision that meet, and let the angles where they converge form a figure according to their shape. (This passage is describing how the two cuts in the lower eyelid should meet at the appropriate angle to restore proper eye function.)
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this shape is the Greek letter lambda (Λ). This means that the cuts made during the procedure form an upside-down V shape, resembling the Greek letter Lambda. [Here is a diagram illustrating this procedure:](https://www.healthline.com/health/entropion#treatment)
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	Then pull the skin taut along the lower edge of the eyelid, so that it dries out and becomes less prone to turning inward. This is done by making an incision along the lower edge of the eyelid and suturing the skin together, creating a small gap between the lashes and the eye itself. [Here's an illustration of the entropion procedure:](https://www.healthline.com/health/entropion#treatment)
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the separated parts and stitch them together with wool thread, and cure it with the softening medications and bandages until it heals. De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	On reducing swelling of the skin.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the skin swells in its entirety and does not cause damage or diminution of the underlying tissue, then it is necessary to relax the patient, follow them with care, and place warm compresses on their neck without scarification or bleeding, allowing for good suction. E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the method for making powders is to take linen cloth and cut it into very thin strips, each of which should be folded in four layers; then make powder from these.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And then place these one on top of the other according to the amount of swelling that requires reduction.

E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And then compress the ligaments day and night as I have previously described.

De curacio de alconati.	On the treatment of cataracts.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This disease called cataract is nothing but pus that has settled in the eye resembling descending water, but it's not actually water.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	But the method of working on it is to have the patient sit straight on a prepared and upright seat, then take their head in your hands from both sides and press downward until you see the pus descend towards the lower parts, then dry it and prevent it from descending further, and cover the eye so that the patient can still see.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not descend downward, know that it is water.

De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	Of the treatment of water descending from the eye. (or "Of the cure for watery eyes")
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already discussed the types of water in the division and which ones should be pierced, as I explained; now do so according to their health status.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Now you must make the patient sit between your hands on a pillow, and tie a bandage over their eye, tightly. (Note: "sezer" might be a typo or variation of "sedere", to sit)
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	And place your left hand near the patient's eyelid of the eye where there is water, on the left side; or with your right hand, if the eye is on the right side. (Note: "dreyta" likely means "right" in Old Germanic languages but here I assumed it was a spelling mistake and meant to say "dextra", Latin for right)
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	And with your right hand, take the stylet if the eye is on the left side; or with your left hand, if the eye is on the right side. (Note: "almagda" could be a variation of "almangada", from Latin "algamaticum", meaning "stylet")
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	And place the tip of the stylet near the crown by the size of the ray in the white of the eye next to the smaller tear duct, and gently push the stylet with virtue while rotating your hand with it. (Note: "mendre lacrimal" might refer to the smaller of the two lacrimal ducts in the eye)
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And continue to push the stylet into the white of the eye until you feel that it has passed through the cornea. (Note: "le album" refers to the sclera or the outer layer of the eye, but in this context, it likely means the cornea)
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And it is necessary for the width of the path of the stylet to match the size of the space which is from the pupil to the end of the darkness, and that is the crown of the eye; because you will see with that pupil the vision of the eye through the clarity of the corneal tissue. (Note: "tunica cornea" refers to the cornea)
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	And place the stylet into the location where the water is, and gently pull it down once or twice, and then if the water descends quickly, have the patient look at what they were seeing before through that eye, and the stylet in their eye. (Note: "huebre" might mean "habere", Latin for "to have")
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And rest for a moment; then, if the water has descended, you can gradually pull the stylet out before it is thrown away. (Note: "abantz" might mean "absque", Latin for "without")
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And so when it is dry and does not descend, then you can gently remove the stylet while rotating your hand slowly, and then dissolve a little bit of clear gemstone salt in the water, and wash the eye inside with that; and then place a small piece of cotton or a stopper made of infused wool soaked in rose oil and egg white over the patient's eye.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But those who are among us today place over it a three-hundred-thread bandage with egg white.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the patient does not obey your stylet upon entering their eye due to its hardness, as some men have very hard eyes, then it is necessary that you take the spatula which is called an "alberit," and this is its form:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And so use the spatula to pierce through that conjunctiva, and do not push your hand too hard, but rather gently create a path for the stylet.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then insert the stylet as we have described.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And you must complete your work by preparing a comfortable bed for the patient to sleep on their back in a dark room, and they should be prevented from making any movements.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And let nature take its course so that the water subsides and does not harm the patient's head by moving to the right or left side.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And let the bandage remain in place according to its disposition for up to three days.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And then remove the bandage in that dark place and uncover the patient's eye, and have them look at various objects, and replace the bandage within seven days.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And you should not do this during the time of cures or immediately before or after infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	It is necessary that you do this because water can easily flow out through a large and intense opening.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if an abscess occurs, then it is necessary to uncover the eye before the seventh day and treat it with whatever is appropriate for the abscess.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	And now you have completed the procedure for the eye and you should place a bandage over the patient's face to control their movements for several days while they remain in a dark room.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And then gradually remove them from that dark room and allow them to interact with their surroundings again.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And know that in alchemy, the disciple should not avoid looking at certain things, and so you must be bold in performing this operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And now we have come to know some of those who are skilled in the art, and some say that they create a fire in the "Ayrac" (Iridium) needle with which they pierce the eye and cause the water to flow out.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	However, I have not seen or heard of anyone in our land who has perfected this technique, nor is it mentioned in any of the books of the ancients. It is possible that this is a new technique.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are the forms of the types of needles that should be used for those who are unfamiliar with them:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they should be made of iron or steel properly, and the ends of them should have this triangular subtlety, with sharp points like this being their form.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter 24.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the cure for flesh grown inside the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When diverse kinds of flesh have grown inside the nose, which are caused by something that resembles a scorpion with heavy stings or a fleshy polyp, and this illness is called "polipus" because it resembles such a thing.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And it may be flesh that is cancerous, ulcerated, of a dark color, or flesh that is not dark in color like a lion's.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore, in the case of those who have flesh that is not deceitful or cancerous, it is necessary to make the patient sit between your hands and place them in the sun, and then you should carefully pick at those growths with a needle.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then you should remove those that are outside and carefully cut away what you have grasped with a sharp spatula from one side, until you know that all the flesh has been removed. If there remains any reason for an abscess to form, then you must gently use one of your fine instruments to completely remove any remaining cause.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if it is ruled by blood or an abscess occurs, then you should stop and treat that appropriately; or if it is a malignant abscess, then you must consider carefully and cauterize it inside until the blood has been drained and all the cavities have been cleared.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then place it inside the nose, close to the incision with vinegar or wine.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	If the nose becomes runny and the patient expels humidity into the palate, then you know that they are cured.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the humidity does not pass as it should, then you know that inside there is flesh in the fleshy part of the nose above the upper bones, which has not been purged.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore, you should now introduce a piece of liver from the animal that has some thickness, and insert it multiple times, leaving space between each insertion equal to the width of a finger or less. And then, stimulate the patient and introduce one end of the liver into the nose using a probe or any other tool that is available to you.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And after this has been done, draw out the liver's scent so that it reaches the nostrils' channels and exits through the nose's passageway, for this action often causes children in school to sneeze, and it is an easy task for those who wish to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	Then place the two ends of the liver in such a way that one end protrudes from the nose and the other remains inside the nose, and then administer small pieces of meat with the inserted bits of liver until you are certain that the meat is attached to the bits of liver.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	Then remove the liver and place in the nose an absorbent material soaked with blood, leaving it there for a short while, and do this for three days or more until all the dead flesh has been dissolved.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And finally, at the end of the treatment, place in the nose a lead catheter for several days until the patient has recovered.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you see that healing is not occurring and instead there is dryness, use this remedy.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the shape of the instrument called a cepi-purger that is used to distill oils and medicines into the nose.
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And make it from silver or iron, so that it resembles a small lamp or container with an open top, similar to a small basin, and the opening should also be similarly shaped.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you wish, make a closed cannula similar to a reed pipe, and the opening of the instrument should be flat and open, without a cover; attach a handle at the back so that you can hold it when heating oil or any other juice or substance in it.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these cepi-purgers are valuable: make a recipe using castoreum (from beaver secretions), white balm, ginger, saffron, long pepper, asafetida, and ephedra (also known as spikenard) in equal parts. Add juice of beetroot and cabbage, and form into pills, then soak one pill in warm water and drop it into the patient's nose while they are lying down.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25. (This appears to be a heading or chapter marker in the text)
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of tumors on the sides of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Often, a tumor forms on the sides of the nose and grows larger in size over several days before it is noticed.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	Therefore, it is necessary to incise it at the beginning of its appearance and remove all of it.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then place a hot iron or burning medicine on the spot where the tumor was located.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if the incision is delayed until the tumor has grown larger, then consider whether it is hard, dark in color, and with little sensation; if so, do not touch it with an iron, for this is a cancerous abscess; for many times those who cut into this type of abscess cause great harm to the patient.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	But if the abscess is soft to the touch and not dark in color, and it is possible to incise all of it, then evacuate the patient and incise the abscess without fear, and cure the location with a drying and constricting substance until it heals.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26. (This appears to be a heading or chapter marker in the text)
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the suturing of the nose, lips, and ears when continuity has been lost due to plague or similar causes.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when there is loss of continuity in one of these cartilaginous structures, it contributes little to the operation except in some cases. (This sentence suggests that the author believes that repairing damage to cartilage is not always necessary or effective) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cartilage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cartilage)
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when dealing with any cause of damage to one of these structures, consider whether it is fresh and still has its own blood supply, and if so, you should stitch the two sides of the wound together and then cure the area until it heals.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the sides of the wound are already separated and each side is healthy, then it is necessary to scrape each piece of the cartilage until blood comes out. (This suggests that the author believes that the cartilage should be exposed and allowed to heal naturally without stitching)
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then stitch the two sides of the wound together and strengthen them, and sprinkle dragon's blood powder on top and let it sit for three days, then remove the poultice and replace it with another consolidative poultice, such as diaconic ointment, and leave it on for two or three days. Then remove it and allow the pus to drain naturally, and cure the area with a drying agent until it heals. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diaconic\_ointment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diaconic_ointment) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consolidative\_poultice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consolidative_poultice)
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the method of stitching is to bring together the sides of the wound with needles as we have recommended in abdominal suturing, or to use liver to join the sides of the wound as I have shown you.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27. (This appears to be a heading or chapter marker in the text) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chapter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chapter)
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the removal of causes that appear in the two sides of wounds in the inner parts. (This suggests that the author is discussing foreign objects or growths within wounds) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extraction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extraction)
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Often, many people have hard abscesses in the inner parts of their wounds that resemble lumps of fat or wax, some are smaller and some are larger.
