Therefore, it is necessary to open the sides of each hardness and then make an incision in them, filling the area with three times-heated wax until the blood has coagulated. Then wash it with sour wine and cure the location with a styptic agent until it heals. Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28. (This appears to be a heading or chapter marker in the text) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chapter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chapter)
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of incising the flesh attached to the gums. (This suggests that the author is discussing surgery on the mouth or gums) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gum)[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incision](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incision)
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Often, many people have flesh attached to the gums which ancient doctors called albulus; therefore, it is necessary to suspend that flesh with a hook or hold it with forceps and make an incision along its length, allowing the pus or blood to flow out. Then place a hot iron or burning medicine on the spot where the tumor was located, or sprinkle styptic or excitative powder on it. (This suggests that the author is recommending cauterization or application of styptic agents to stop bleeding after surgery) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cautery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cautery)[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Styptic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Styptic)
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	But if the flesh returns, then make an incision again and cauterize it, for the hot iron will prevent the flesh from returning. (This suggests that the author is recommending repeated surgeries or cauterization to completely remove infected tissue)
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29. (This appears to be a heading or chapter marker in the text) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chapter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chapter) [
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of the reason for toothache with iron. (This suggests that the author is discussing dental pain caused by metal objects) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toothache](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toothache) [
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When the surface of the teeth, both on the inner parts and outer surfaces, as well as between the gums, are rough, jagged, and in some cases blackened or yellowish, indicating corruption, and the teeth are loose, this is a sign that the gums have receded. (This suggests that the author is discussing periodontal disease) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Periodontal\_disease](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Periodontal_disease)
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	Therefore, it is necessary to have the patient bite down on your fingers and place their head in your lap, and then file down the teeth that show those roughnesses and similar causes until none remain, addressing the blackening, yellowing, and other issues until they are resolved. (This suggests that the author is recommending dental filing to remove rough or jagged surfaces from teeth) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dental\_filing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dental_filing)[
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Therefore, if this happens at the beginning of the treatment, it is good; and if not, then you should repeat the treatment on those (affected parts) every day for two or three days until it takes effect as you wish.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth require words of various forms and many figures, depending on what is required for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And so the saws that are used to cut into the part of the tooth that is below the gum line are different from those used to cut between the teeth, and you must prepare these types of saws, which you will see shortly.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	On the extraction of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	It is necessary that you treat the tooth for its pain with all care and caution during its extraction, because there is no reason to rush the procedure when extracting it, since it is a subtle substance that must be carefully extracted.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But when the patient is forced to undergo tooth extraction, you must be certain which tooth is causing the pain, because often the pain can deceive the patient and they think it's in a healthy tooth, and then you extract that one but the pain doesn't stop until the diseased and painful tooth has been extracted. We have seen this happen in barbers' operations.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, how do you determine which tooth is causing the pain? Well, you should make an incision in the gum around the tooth using a spatula with some power (i.e., a medicinal substance), until it has dissolved the connection between the tooth and the gum from all sides. Then, use those same tweezers or fine forceps to gently and gradually pull on the tooth until you extract it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then, place forceps with large and strong tongs in the patient's mouth for good grip or firm control, and hold their head between your knees to keep them still, and extract the tooth carefully and steadily without breaking it or causing the patient more pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And so, if it is not loose already, take one of those instruments and place it under the tooth from all sides with ease and apply gentle force to lift it out, just as you would at the beginning of the extraction.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is cracked or corroded, then you must wrap a cloth around the crack and tighten it with a thin thread so that it does not break when you apply force to extract it using the tongs.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	It is necessary to work carefully with the incision around the entire gum and be very careful not to break the tooth while tightening it. Leave it partially extracted, and then turn your attention back to the patient, who may become more mischievous than the initial pain.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And beware that you do not make the same mistakes as some ignorant barbers in their haste and recklessness during tooth extraction, for many times they do not use what we have recommended, causing great harm to the patient, leading to more serious conditions that are difficult to cure, and damaging the gums or extracting the tooth along with some bones from the jaw, as we have often witnessed.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And then, after extracting the tooth, rinse out the patient's mouth with wine vinegar or wine and salt to clean it.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if bleeding persists after that, as it often does, then sprinkle some powdered yarrow on the wound and repeat this procedure until the bleeding stops. If it doesn't stop, cauterize the area with a hot iron.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The shape of the forceps and fine tongs used to extract the tooth should have a long handle, a short shank, and be thick, so that they are not bent when you use them for extraction.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And they should have handles that are thick enough so that when you squeeze them, they do not bend, and the shanks should be short.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they should be made of Indian steel, with right-angled shanks, and the ends of those shanks should have teeth that fit into one another to increase the force of the grip. Sometimes the shape of the ends may resemble a stork's beak (in Latin, "ciconia" means "stork"), which is very strong.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On tooth extraction and bone removal from the jaws.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you need to extract a tooth that is broken and there remains some obstruction, then you should place a compress on the site for one or two days until the area has softened. Then, use tweezers with slender ends that resemble the beak of a stork (in Latin, "ciconia" means "stork"), which is the shape of forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The ends of these should be made with a sharp edge like a file or awl.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if the tooth does not respond to your efforts with these forceps or tweezers, then you must cut into the gum and remove all of the flesh, and use a small instrument called an "atali," which is a small lever that looks like this:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And it should have a short, thick handle and not be curved so that it does not break.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore, if the root is loose after that, it's good. But if not, help yourself with these other instruments, whose shapes are as follows: The first instrument has a triangular shank and some thickness to it:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it has a triangular and slender shank.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And you can help yourself with this instrument that has two curves like this:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And also with other instruments for tooth scraping, which I will specify later. This instrument is similar to a large hook, and this is its shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	With a curved or short triangular shank that is thick and not curved so it does not break.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And know that the instruments for large teeth are similar to other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But skilled and subtle artists find for themselves according to what the operation indicates to them and diverse diseases; because there are diseases that ancient authors did not mention or provide specific instruments for due to their varied forms and species. (Note: "Species" is derived from the Latin term for a kind, type, or category.)
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the jawbone or other bones in the mouth are fractured or dislocated, then you must treat it carefully in its place with appropriate instruments and forceps that we mentioned in tooth extraction. And help yourself with a bandage whose shape is like this:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And it should have some thickness, gradually tapering in size, and be held tightly with the mouth to prevent any escape or leakage until the bone has healed completely. Then restore the site with appropriate medications.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a small fracture in the bone, then scrape away that piece and its blackness, and treat it until it heals completely.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	On the care of prominent teeth over others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth protrude unnaturally, particularly in women and more so in young girls, it is necessary to consider: if the tooth does not touch another tooth and there is no possibility of a fracture or gap between them, then you should extract that tooth; but do not allow it to be adjacent to another tooth. Instead, you should grind down the excess length with this instrument, which looks like this:
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And make sure your grinding is gradual so that you grind down the tooth over several days due to its hardness, and do not damage other teeth in the process. (Note: "Comauguda" may be derived from the Latin term for damaging or wearing away something.)
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is an exposed tooth that needs filing down, then use a file made of Indian iron with this shape:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it should be made entirely of Indian iron and have many small points like a file with needles, which can be used to carefully grind down the tooth little by little over several days without damaging other teeth or causing injury.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And finally, smooth down the tooth and remove any rough edges with these other razors.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if part of the tooth is fractured and irritating the tongue, then it is necessary to grind down that area until its roughness has been removed and covered, and filled in so that the tongue does not become damaged or speech impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On restoring damaged teeth with gold or silver filings.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When damage occurs to the front teeth due to concussion or loss from percussion or extraction, and the patient is unable to chew properly, and you have treated it with styptic medications without success, then in order to prevent further harm, use gold filings instead of silver, because silver turns green and may need to be replaced after a few days, while gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the bile should be of such fineness and thickness according to the quantity that can enter between the teeth; and the method of rection is to take the bile and place twice as much of it between two healthy teeth, and then curve it with two twists of the bile between two bad teeth, or if there is one or many, until the cloth reaches the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then repeat the treatment on the same area that you began with, and strengthen your hand with ease and skill so that it is not harmful.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let the strip of cloth that you use to strengthen the bile be of the right size so that it does not escape from between the teeth.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then cut off the excess bile with forceps or tweezers and add it to each location with caution, and turn and hide those between the healthy tooth and the bad tooth, so that it does not cause injury to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then leave it as tight as a Roman.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it becomes loose or broken, strengthen it again with more bile in the same manner for its entire duration.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the shape of the teeth and the form of the rection of two healthy teeth and two bad teeth, as you often see these bound together in this way:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it is done so that one or two teeth return to their proper position in their places, and are restored as we have discussed, and are still weakened.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And only a good and wise craftsman should do this.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes a cavity is adapted for a certain reason with pieces of cow bone, and it is made in the shape of a tooth, and it is placed in the location where the tooth is missing, and it is strengthened as we have said, and it remains and serves for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the incision of the ligament that is on the tongue and prevents speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament that is seen below the tongue can sometimes be congenital or natural at birth, or it can be acquired and occur due to an injury that has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation for this is to have the patient open their mouth with your head inside, and then lift their tongue and make an incision in the ligament nerve according to its width so that the tongue is freed from its restriction.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or thickening in that area, and it has formed due to the healing of an injury, then you should apply a probe and cut through it according to its width so that you have made an incision in the ligament and the thickening has been released.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful to not make a fissure in the skin and instead cut only through the ligament, ensuring that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then the wound from the incision should be washed with water, vinegar, or warm water, and a ligature should be placed below the tongue, which is a device that holds the patient's tongue down to prevent it from healing improperly again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if there is a flow of blood, place a piece of vitriol trissat on the location, but if the bleeding persists, then cauterize the area with a lance-shaped cautery that is appropriate for this purpose.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then continue with other treatments for any additional causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of extracting a ranula from beneath the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes, a small abscess can form beneath the tongue that resembles a ranula and prevents it from performing its natural functions, and it can quickly grow to fill the entire mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation for this is to have the patient open their mouth wide in front of the sun and observe the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see that it is dark or black in color and hard, and the patient cannot feel it, then do not touch it because it is dead tissue.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it has turned white and is moist, then place a probe into it and make an incision around the entire area with a sharp spatula, cutting through all of the affected tissue; and if bleeding occurs during your procedure, then apply a piece of vitriol trissat to stop it.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then continue your work until it has been completely drained, and wash the area with a mixture of vinegar and salt, and treat any remaining issues until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of extracting an abscess from both ears, and of those located in the throat, and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When a goiter occurs in the throat, it is caused by glands that are enlarged and resemble cotton, which can sometimes protrude outside of the body and are called "two ears." If you treat these with the methods described earlier and they do not heal, then consider whether the abscess is hard, dark in color, and has limited sensation. If so, do not touch it with a knife.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	But if it is red in color and the tissue is thick, then do not touch it with a knife due to the risk of bleeding; instead, wait for it to mature on its own before attempting to remove it or allowing it to break open on its own.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	But if it is white in color, round, and the tissue is thin, then that is what needs to be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation for this is to first consider whether the abscess has completely subsided on its own or if it has decreased in size before proceeding with surgery. Then, have the patient sit facing the sun with their head in your lap, open their mouth wide, and have an assistant gently press down on their tongue using a noble instrument of this shape:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or steel and be as thin as a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	And when you use the instrument to press down on the tongue and reveal the abscess, place your finger over it to keep it in place. Then take a probe and insert it into the opening, gently pulling it apart as much as possible.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Or if you are stretching any of the membranes, then use this specialized instrument to make an incision:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	And it resembles forceps, but the ends are curved inward so that the tips of each arm are facing each other and are very sharp, made from iron that has been heated to a high temperature.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this specialized instrument is not available to you, then use a spatula with one sharp end and one blunt end instead:
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And since you have inserted a knife, insert the other in the same manner, and make the incision close to the patient so that it is not affected by cold water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a flow of blood, protect it with a decoction of elderberry or myrtle leaves and similar things that have astringent properties until the bleeding stops, and take care of it until it heals.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes abscesses come out in the groin other than those two (earrings), and you should incise those as I have said in the incision of two knives equally.[Q:] E si es un apostema grande, inscideys lo per la part quela dolor es e que sia aprop claritatz de visio entro le carni.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	I have treated a woman with an abscess that was located in her groin and tended to be dark colored with little sensation, who had already closed the area and the woman was breathing with difficulty, and she had been prohibited from eating and drinking water, and she would have died if it had lasted for another day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had grown so much that it had taken two months to burst through two openings.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore I proceeded fistulously and inserted my finger into one of the openings, and pulled out a large portion from it, and then I incised the other part that was not open, and forced open its mouth, and compressed its tongue, and then I inserted the instrument into the abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I removed a large portion of it, and only a small amount of blood flowed out from it.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore, the woman's groin was healed and she began to drink water and eat food right away. And I did not stop incising the abscess many times for a long time, and an ulcer formed in place of it, which continued to grow over time.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore I put medicine in it and cauterized the woman's groin, and that is all for now. And then I left and did not know what God did with her afterwards.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37. (This notation refers to a new chapter or section in the text)
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On incising an ulcer when it has become abscessed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When there is a catarrh (discharge) in the ulcer and it has become abscessed and long, then it is called perpendicular; and if it is thick and round in the lower part, then it is called bubo. (Note: "catarrh" refers to any type of discharge or mucus.)
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is healed with what we have said in the division, and you do not agree with the healing, and sometimes an abscess remains after cauterization and becomes subtle, then you must incise the one that is aggregated and round; and if it is along its length, and is bloody, of dark color or black, and is not at its center, then you must be careful in incising it because there is a risk for the patient. (Note: "divisio" here likely refers to the previous section discussing the treatment of an abscessed ulcer.)
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see it as I have described based on its whiteness and length, then you must make the patient sit up and press their tongue with the instrument that matches its shape, and then place the instrument into the new opening and pull downwards while incising it with one of the two instruments mentioned in the treatment for two knives. (Note: "sezer" here likely means to cause the patient to sit up or change position.)
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And it is necessary that you only incise what is appropriate to the natural limit without excess, because if you incise beyond it, you will harm their speech. (Note: "lediyras" here means to damage or impair.)
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And when incising, use what we recommended in the treatment for two knives, and take care of it until it heals. (Note: This seems to be a summary of previous instructions regarding the care and cauterization of an incision.)
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is afraid of incision, then it is necessary to use medicine in cauterizing them without fear, and the method for cauterization is only with hot water, which you will do by placing the patient's head in your lap, pressing their tongue with the instrument that we have mentioned, and then taking the water that we have mentioned in the chapter on cauterization and applying it to the affected area while it is still alive. Place the cautery not too thick or thin, and fill the concavity of the instrument with this shape:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the extremity of the patient's limb be in a concave position where the medicine is placed, just like the concavity of a clay pot, and place the instrument with the medicine on the ulcer. The patient should lie on their side so that saliva or mucus from their mouth does not fall onto the affected area through the internal medicine, so that no cause remains on the groin and you do not harm them. (Note: "ray" here likely refers to a type of clay pot.)
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then place your hand with the medicine and press it on the ulcer for a quarter of an hour until you see that it has darkened and become numb from the bite of the medicine. (Note: "mordicacio" here likely means the effect or action of the medicine, rather than an actual bite.)[Q:] E si la malaute se partis de lu, cove que tu le persegues e amonestas le que no es lo peyor que aquo quan yeu le inscidiys, quar ara yeu le cauterizeys.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take some cotton and wrap it around the end of the clay pot, then submerge the cotton in the medicine and put the clay pot with the cotton inside a hollow tube so that the cotton adheres to the tube, and do this several times until you achieve the desired cauterization of the ulcer. Then leave it alone so that it dries out and falls off after three or four days. (Note: "coto" here likely refers to a type of soft cloth or bandage.)
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you think that the medicine needs to be repeated, do so, and then clean the cauterization area around the ulcer with a cloth soaked in water, and wipe away what is outside the affected area from the medicine, and wash it with cold water and cure it externally with an embrocation (a type of medical ointment), and treat the inside with protections until it heals. (Note: "guarguarismes" here likely means some type of dressing or protective covering.)
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this method of treatment is safer than incision and longer due to fear (of the patient).
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the ulcer is healed with something more subtle than cauterization and incision, because it is cured by subfumigation in this way: prepare chamomile, hyssop, oregano, rue, scordium (a type of water-loving plant), camomile, broom (a type of flowering plant) and similar herbs, grind all those ingredients together, or some of them, into a powder, and soak it in vinegar and boil it. The mixture should be well strained through a cloth and placed in the middle of a pot with a hole at the bottom. Above the hole, place an instrument shaped like a funnel made of silver or copper. (Note: "scicados arabic" is likely shikakai, a type of plant used for medicinal purposes.) [Q:] E faytsi una tela de ras del qual sia teixida leyssa, e aquella tela sia posada sobre la potta per so que no venga fum en la carni; e tapa le boca de la potta per so que non se gasti le essencia del fum, e aprop yeu metes le malaute sota l’instrument, e aquel respira aquel fum entro que sia sanat.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And place the end of the instrument in the patient's mouth so that the steam reaches the ulcer and envelopes it until the ulcer becomes obscured. (Note: "quanula" here likely refers to a type of small funnel-shaped instrument used for medical purposes.)
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then repeat this process several times until it dries out, but be careful not to use this treatment at the onset of abscess formation, because it would be too harsh and you should not do that. Instead, you should carefully diagnose whether the ulcer has turned into an abscess and proceed accordingly with cauterization if necessary. (Note: "aveniment" here likely means the occurrence or development of a condition.)
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument with you, then take a reed and create a mouthpiece for the patient using an eggshell, so that their mouth is propped open and the shell prevents the smoke from burning their mouth. (Note: "closc" here likely means a piece or fragment of something.)
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38. (This notation refers to a new chapter or section in the text)
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On extracting thorns and removing things that have become attached to the groin and other causes. (Note: "golayro" here likely means a part of the body, such as the armpit or crotch.)
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Often things become attached in the groin or thorns from fish bones or other causes. (Note: "spina de peys" here likely means a type of sharp bone found in some types of fish.) [Q:] E quando tu trobes aquela e no sabes aquo que es, cove que tu le tingsas am la sang del malaute per so que vegas si yeu es carn o non.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Therefore, it is necessary to extract what is visible from them (the thorns or other causes) and focus your vision on that, while pressing the tongue with an instrument in front of the mouth, so that you can determine what is inside the groin. (Note: "denant solelh" here likely means "in front of the mouth".)
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what is not visible and is hidden in the groin, it is necessary to make the patient vomit before their food has been digested in the stomach, because often a cause attached to the groin will be expelled through vomiting. Or have the patient swallow a leaf of lettuce or bread that has been soaked in vinegar, or take a piece of dry sea sponge and tie it tightly with bile (a yellowish-brown fluid produced by the liver), and then give it to the patient for them to swallow. When it reaches the location where the thorn is, it will be expelled. (Note: "spongia marina" here likely means a type of sponge that grows in the ocean.)
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And also take an eel and soak it in bile, then place it on the wound and press gently until it is extracted, or take a piece of garlic and gently insert it into the wound and leave it there. (Note: "liada" here likely means soaked or coated in.)
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if those causes that I mentioned cannot be removed with those methods, then you should use an instrument made of lead in the following shape:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let it be slightly larger than a reed and have a concavity at its end that you can insert into the patient's groin with ease. (Note: "ray" here likely means a type of reed or small stick.)
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let it have a slightly raised head and be careful not to touch the patient's throat with its tip, so that you can easily reach the affected area with it, whether by touching the bone or skin around the groin or by inserting your hand alongside the instrument. (Note: "empellesca" here likely means to touch or make contact with.)
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But it is better if the patient inserts it themselves according to their knowledge of where the cause is attached and can touch the affected area with it, pulling upwards while holding the instrument, all depending on the size of the thorn or other cause that needs to be removed. (Note: "sciencia" here likely means understanding or awareness.)
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39. (This notation refers to a new chapter or section in the text)
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On extracting a leech attached to the groin. (Note: "sanguisuga" here likely means a type of leech that attaches itself to a host and feeds on their blood.)
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When bleeding a leech as part of the treatment process, as we have said in the division of cures using medicines and not surgery, consider then placing the patient in the sunlight, once you have applied the instrument to their tongue that we recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	So if you see the leech, remove it gently with delicate movements.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if you are unable to remove it, then take a concave cannula and insert it in the patient's skin near the area where the leech is attached, place the end of a heated iron in the cannula's cavity and do this several times (until the leech is dead and falls off) and ensure that the patient abstains from water for the entire day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Then take a full bladder of warm water, open its mouth and rinse the patient's mouth with it; and do not drink any of that water for at least an hour, either with their hand or using a straw, because the leech can sense the movement of water and may come back.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not removed as we recommended, then fumigate the patient with thyme or asafoetida using the instrument that we recommended for uvula fumigation.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this three times.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	Here is another way to perform fumigation, which involves taking a pot with hot coals inside and covering it with a cloth that has an opening in the middle, where you attach the end of the instrument; then perform the fumigation from above, place the patient's mouth on the end of the cannula, seal their mouth so that the fumigation does not escape until you are sure that the fumigation has reached the leech, because the leech will fall off once it senses the fumigation.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it still does not fall off, then repeat the fumigation several times and ensure that the patient abstains from drinking water, eating salty foods or alcohol, and it is also necessary to follow this regimen until the leech falls off.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the shape of the instrument used to remove leeches from the skin once they are visible; it resembles forceps but has a curve in its design.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	The end of which is shaped like the beak of a stork, with a rough surface that ensures that it does not slip when applied to the skin.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which we summarize the discussion on abscesses and their treatment.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are of many types and forms, as remembered from the descriptions in this book, each with their own characteristics.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	Abscesses are differentiated by the way they open and their shape in two ways: one based on the type of abscess itself, and another based on the underlying cause of the accumulation of fluid or pus. [*](Note: The text seems to be referring to two types of abscesses, those that open and drain naturally through a predetermined pathway (perforatio propria) and those that do not have a natural opening and require surgical intervention (perforatio impropria). Additionally, the text suggests that the shape and form of the abscess are influenced by the underlying cause of the accumulation of fluid or pus.)*
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is based on the location of the abscess in the body, as an abscess in the head is different from one in the buttocks, and an abscess in a fleshy area is different from one in a joint; and each of them requires its own surgical treatment. [*](Note: The text suggests that the location of the abscess influences its form and shape, and as such, the surgical approach to treating it must be tailored to the specific location of the abscess in the body.)*[*](The word "accident" is used here in a medical sense, meaning "occurrence".)*
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are some abscesses that should not be opened until the pus is fully mature or the healing process has been completed. [*](Note: The text suggests that some abscesses may heal without surgical intervention, and that waiting for maturation of the pus can lead to a more successful outcome.)*
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And there are other abscesses that should be opened immediately when they become hard and do not mature according to their normal course, such as those near joints, because an abscess located near a joint will continue to grow until it affects the surrounding ligaments or nerves, causing contraction of the affected member. Or if it is near a major organ, waiting for maturation can lead to damage to that organ. Or if it is in the buttocks, then drainage should be performed even if it is not mature, so as to prevent infection from spreading to deeper tissues and causing fistula or other complications.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	And it is important to know the correct time for opening the abscess, which is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it is mature when there is a decrease in pain and fever, along with reduced redness and swelling, decreased tenderness, and the appearance of softening or thinning of the skin over the abscess. *(*Note: The text suggests that signs of maturation include both systemic and local symptoms.)*
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And it is important to ensure that the incision is made in a location below the abscess, allowing the pus to drain freely and not accumulate again. *(*Note: The text suggests that the incision should be made in a dependent position relative to the abscess to facilitate complete drainage of the pus.)*
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the incision should always be made along the length of the skin or body, especially for abscesses located in areas such as the armpits, groin, and wrist, where there are tendons and blood vessels; and in general, avoid making incisions on joints or other areas that may impair mobility.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But if the abscess is located in a fleshy area, it is better to wait until the maturation process has been completed before making an incision, as described earlier, because making an incision too early can cause the pus and debris to spread further, leading to increased pain, swelling, and risk of infection. *(*Note: The text suggests waiting for complete maturation of the abscess in fleshy areas to avoid complications.)*
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys. Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Chapter 41: On the incision of abscesses that appear on the back of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	On the back of the head, there are small abscesses that take on the form of nodes and contain tunics that correspond to their formation; and their types are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from some of them come pus, and from others comes moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And for those that contain moisture similar to dust and resemble them; and for those that are stony and hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the incision of all of them, and in the removal of those, there is no fear, as long as you perform the extraction carefully and avoid causing any opposing tension or injury.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the procedure for incising them is to probe them with an instrument that has a shape approaching this, which is called a lancet, until you are certain that it contains pus or other infectious material.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	If what it contains is moisture, then you should incise it with an incision that follows the length of the abscess, making a superficial cut in the shape of this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	The incision should begin at the line of B and end at the line of G. Once the moisture has been drained, you should scrape away the surrounding tissue that contained the pus or other infectious material, making sure to remove all of it completely. This is because any remaining infected tissue can lead to further infections and complications.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	Then, if available, submerge the cotton in Egyptian ointment and apply it to the wound, otherwise use water and salt; fill the wound with this mixture and leave it for another day. This will help dissolve any remaining tissue that has hardened around the edges of the wound.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	Then, if necessary, repeat the application of Egyptian ointment to the cotton and apply it to the wound a second and third time, until you are confident that all remaining tissue has been dissolved. After that, treat the wound with a general salve until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	If the abscess contains hardened nodes, then you should make an incision in the shape of this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	If the abscess has the shape of a cross and there are one or more nodes between its two lips, then you should make an incision in the shape of a cross, cutting through each node and applying pressure to extract the membrane that contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your efforts are met with resistance or opposition, then do what I have told you to do previously.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly, you should proceed with the incision and treatment of a hardened abscess in the same way that I have told you; and an incision on a hardened abscess is easier, as it contains little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are abscesses of this type that occur on the head in some men who do not have any moisture; the cause of this is that you may have incised an abscess on the head of an elderly woman and found it to be as hard as a stone, rough, white, and unable to be pierced, and if anyone struck it with force, they would be injured.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other abscesses that occur on the head, this is not the case, as with abscesses that occur on the heads of infants and must be treated by making incisions at the base of the ears. However, all of these types of abscesses should be treated with superficial incisions.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And stop the perforation of those in the lower part of them, so that the body is relieved of the pus in the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And similarly, treat those with what is necessary for their healing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the incision of scrofulas that occur on the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these abscesses happen in the hip and groin areas and in the joints; and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the hip, are often formed between the muscles, and every swelling of them is within its own membrane, just as with nodes and abscesses of the head, as we have mentioned.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the types of these swellings are many, for some are stony, and others contain moisture, and some are harmful, which do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore in the one that you see to be of good disposition upon touch, whose color is similar to the color of the skin, and affects all parts equally, and is not attached to the hip nerve, veins, nor arteries, and is not large, it is necessary that you incise it with a dry superficial cut from above the body part to below along the line of G to the line of B, and dissect it entirely from all sides, and draw out two lips of the skin with an ounce or more if needed just as we have said in abscesses of the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And there is a greater need for caution to not cut into the vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And the spatula should not be too sharp so that it does not slip during incision or disturb the patient, and that you do not cut where it is unnecessary to cut; for if you were to cut a vein or artery, you would prohibit yourself from continuing the operation. Therefore, place on the wound white vitriol or other powders that stop bleeding, tighten the wound, and leave it in until the heat of the abscess subsides, and the wound becomes soft and begins to turn black.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is cut off.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore, return to your operation until it is complete.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And inquire with your touch if there are any other smaller swellings nearby, and if so, incise those and clean them out.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if the large swelling is located near a major vein, then it is necessary not to incise that swelling in its area.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Beforehand, it is better to apply a strong poultice of heated mustard seeds and leave it on until the swelling opens itself and drains its harmful contents.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with old goat fat that you have previously melted in Egyptian ointment, and then treat it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise the swelling entirely, then it is necessary that you bring together the two lips of the wound and suture as soon as possible before any excess fluid escapes.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is excess fluid due to the large size of the swelling, then it is necessary to consider incising its surrounding area and draining it, providing suture as needed.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for those swellings that contain moisture, perform a shallow puncture at the point of maturation of it, and place the puncture towards the lower part of the body just as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer punctures, hot compresses with ointment and similar to it, for it to corrode what is left of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And when you see that the wound has been cleaned, then treat it with flesh-generating ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the incision of the head of an abscess located in the groin area.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients described this incision in the head of an abscess, but I have not seen anyone in our land who has performed it.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the transcription of the words of those people. [Note: The following lines are transcribed from the provided text as accurately as possible, but they may not make complete sense on their own without additional context. I have also included some comments in brackets for clarity.]
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in males with inguinal hernia, it is advisable to avoid the extraction of the head, as this will not bring any benefit since all the veins and major blood vessels are located here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have abscesses caught in the mouth or groin or both ears, when the disease is not in the vein, it is necessary to avoid the incision of the head, as this can lead to a fatal outcome due to perfusion.[Pretty sure there's an error in the original text. I believe "perforacio" should be "perfurcio" which means perforation, and it does make sense with that correction.]
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do so, we must incise the head of the abscess below three circles of the head or four with a small section along its length at the location that is between two circles by an amount equal to the width of a finger. The incision should be made in the middle, not in the cartilage, and this location is suitable for incision because it is devoid of flesh and has no blood vessels nearby.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the physician is cautious, then it is necessary to stretch the skin of the groin with an ounce and then make an incision in the skin until reaching the canal, but avoid blood vessels for any reason.[Note: The original text contains some spelling errors that I have corrected for ease of understanding. E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then incise the lips as we have mentioned, and this is indicated in the section of the canal by the flame that comes out from it, which is caused by the rupture and cutting of the voice. E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	And when the time comes when puncture is feared, add two lips of the skin from the wound and sew it with sutures but not through the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that promote tissue growth until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the essence of what we have discussed is to see that some of these abscesses have already filled the groin area of the patient, and the patient has come close to death, and the opening for excretion is blocked, and some go to incise the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe through the wound and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And because of this, I command that the wound be left open until the harmfulness of the disease has been consumed, which takes three days. Therefore, I command to treat the wound in this way and cure it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen in my practice is that a maidservant took a knife and put it in her groin area and cut a part of the lung vein with it, and I was called to treat her. Therefore, I confess that she had not cut a vein or artery but rather the blood was coming out of the wound, and I treated her until she was healed.
