E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the incision of the head there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	On incision of an abscess that occurs in the outer groin and is called hernia of the groin.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess called hernia of the groin is a large swelling depending on the complexion of the body, and it is common in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is of two kinds, for it can be either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural one there is no need to cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one is of two types: one that resembles fatty nodes, and the other that resembles an abscess caused by congestion of the artery. The latter is more dangerous because there is a risk of cutting into the blood vessel during surgery.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And one should not be overconfident in performing surgery on it unless it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you should examine it and investigate it with the said method (touch), and if you find it similar to fatty nodes, and not suspended from any of the veins, then you can incise it in the same way as nodes and extract it with the membrane and sac attached; but if not, then you must carefully examine its entire structure and treat the area with appropriate treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the incision of types of nodules.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are many species of nodes and I have already mentioned all their species in the division (classification).
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And it is necessary for me to repeat the difference between a node and an abscess, as there may be doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	And so I say that with an abscess there is heat and fever and intense pain until the boiling of the excess fluid has subsided; and it is a complete putrefaction that then stops the fever, pain, and heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	The main symptom is not heat or fever or pain, but rather that hiccup-like sensation in the region of the lung, which is specifically located in its own sac.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it depends on the color of the body (of the hiccup), and its initial stage is like a sneeze, and it occurs either more or less severely. It comes in two forms: one is caused by thick humors and contains moisture, and the humors are speckled, as I said in my division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to the cure for hiccups, you must expel it and inquire about its initial stage with an instrument that is called "intromes", according to its form which will be explained in the following chapter.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this is the method of inquiry for abscesses and all types of hiccups: you should take this instrument (intromes) and insert it gently into the moistest location you find on the abscess, rotating the instrument slowly until you are certain that it has penetrated the membrane.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	Then place your hand according to the size of the abscess and gently remove the instrument while observing what comes out of it.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the moisture is expelled and flows out, of any color it may be, then you should make a superficial incision to allow the pus to drain, as I have described in other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moisture coming out of the instrument's track, then you know that it is fatty tissue.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry it out by making an incision in the shape of a cross like this:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	just as you have been taught, and suspend it with a ligature, and carefully remove the membrane from all sides, preserving the skin or sac if possible, and extract the pus along with the hiccup.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if the abscess ruptures during the operation, it will not be possible to extract the pus completely, and often this results in further complications. In such cases, you should remove as much of the pus as possible until there is no remaining cause for concern.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	Because if any residual cause remains, whether small or large, the hiccup will return with greater intensity.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you notice that a small part of it remains, then complete the wound with some corrosive powders and strengthen the wound, placing a cauterizing agent on the abscess, and cure it with another treatment until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if the hiccup is large, then you should suture both lips of it and cure it with that which causes it to suppurate (encarnar).
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if the pulsation is contrary to what is expected, or there is no pulse, then you should apply and fill the area with a mixture of quicklime (zegi trissat) and vitriol (vetriol), leaving it in place for two or three days until the wound dries up and the boiling of the blood subsides. Then you can return to incising the remaining hiccup.

De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the care of the male breasts which are similar to those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some times the breasts of certain men become swollen due to the fullness of sleep as they begin to be touched, and in such cases, the breasts become swollen and similar to those of women, and sometimes these are tumors or distant abscesses.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And for whoever has this, it is necessary to make an incision with a lunar section according to this form, from line B to line G, and then remove all the thickened flesh, apply an encarnating medicine on the wound, bring together the two lips of the wound with stitches, and care for it until it heals. (Note: The lines referred to are likely reference points in the illustrations or diagrams that would have accompanied this text.)
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast descends towards the lower parts and is softened by its size as it does in women, then it should be cut in two along its upper sides with two sections similar to a lunar figure, each of which should be contained within the other until the end of each one, so that the larger line contains the smaller one according to this form of line B and line G. And then remove the cordon that is between the two lips of the wound, remove the fatty tissue, and administer what we have said about stitches and powders as necessary in the healing process until it heals.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of what needs to be cut due to the patient's discomfort or blood flow, then it is necessary to fill the wound with a piece of cloth soaked in corrosive ointment and leave it until the corrosion removes the thickened flesh, and then care for it until it heals.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48 (Note: This is not part of the translation but rather a section header)
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	On the puncturing of boils that come from below the navel.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These boils that come from below the navel are of three kinds of scrofula, hard ones, which contain a pouch that is full. (Note: Scrofula is a term used in medieval medicine to refer to various forms of skin diseases or swellings, particularly those of the neck or armpits.)
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And some of these contain moisture; and those that contain moisture need to be incised with a lunar section according to this figure: from line G to line B. And when all the pus in the boil has been drained, then fill it with old cloth and leave it until the next day. (Note: The lines referred to are likely reference points in the illustrations or diagrams that would have accompanied this text.)
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a dressing and care for it with appropriate ointment until it heals.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the boil is of the kind that is a node or scrofula, then cut into it as we have said in the section on scrofulas.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	But if the wound spreads to an area prone to gangrene, then apply a hot iron (cautery) as we have said before.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49. (Note: This is not part of the translation but rather a section header.) [*De la cura de les apostemas que es deves lo titillic.*](http://de%20la%20cura%20de%20les%20apostemas%20que%20es%20deves%20lo%20titillic.*)*
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On incisions of boils that occur due to an artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is ruptured and the membrane that is above it has hardened, often boils will appear, and the signs by which inflammation and a boil can be recognized as being caused by an artery or vein are: for when a boil is due to an artery, it is elongated in the region of the body; and when you press the boil with your fingers, you feel a stridor (a harsh, rough breathing sound).
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And one that is caused by a vein is round at the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And incisions on these boils can be dangerous, especially those that are below the armpits, in the groin, in the neck, and in many other parts of the body; for if they are large, then care with iron (cautery) should be avoided, and those that are in the extremities or head should be avoided.

But for one that is located there due to inflammation of the orifice of an artery, make a long incision in the membrane and then use forceps to open the incision and expose the artery, removing the surrounding tissues to reveal it.

And then press on the area between two ligaments with a spatula until all of the blood in it is drained and the boil is resolved. And then administer care in which pus is generated inside until the ligaments begin to rot away, and then cure it with appropriate ointments until it heals. But if you are afraid of extracting the thread, then insert the suture with the needle below the entire boil according to the first incision, and tighten your threads in four places. Capitol .li.	Chapter 2.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Chapter 2: On the section of abscesses, which occur in the cheek and those that occur in the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	It often happens that abscesses develop in the bellies of people and in other parts of their bodies, which are called "fungal" due to their similarity to fungi, and their structure is subtle and their heads are thick; and already the lips of these have turned inward, and some are small, while others are greatly enlarged.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one, and in their belly there were two parts that were more similar to fungi, and there was no difference between them, both being white and of small size.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already the edges of these had turned inward and were splitting open, and moisture was constantly flowing from them.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore I incised those and found in one a piece of meat weighing eighteen ounces. And the other one weighed one ounce.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation in the incision of them is that you should consider at this point if the patient is moist, and their complexion is white, moist, with fine lines; then you should cut it with a broad spatula, and have cauteries present in the fire, for there will be much moisture expelled from the section, and if blood flows, cauterize that.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see that the patient is poor and fearful, be cautious of making an incision with iron; but rather take fresh lead made into pills, and strengthen the complexion with them, in the manner we have said; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then apply it to the stricture of the lead wire; therefore, do not stop strengthening the large piece of lead until it is cut and falls off by itself without any effort.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the abscess is of large structure, then there is some cause for fear and anxiety in making an incision into it, especially when it is located in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you cut out the majority of it, and then cauterize the area to prevent it from returning.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then care for it until the wound heals.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be cautious of attempting to incise an abscess that is of dark color, with little sensation, and a slack appearance, for this may indicate cancer.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come back to this with a reminder about cancer.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 2.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Chapter 2: On the treatment of a protrusion of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	A protrusion of the navel can be caused by many factors, such as tears in the ciphac (a membrane or fascia that covers the abdomen), which can lead to the herniation of tissue or organs through the resulting opening; or it may be due to bleeding from a vein or artery near the navel, which can cause swelling and inflammation; or it may be caused by an obstruction in the intestines or other digestive organs that leads to gas buildup and pressure on the navel.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if the protrusion is due to tears in the ciphac and herniation of tissue or organs, then the color of the abscess will be similar to that of the surrounding skin; it will typically be painless, but may appear in various shapes and sizes depending on the location and extent of the hernia.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	But if the protrusion is due to herniation of the bowel or intestines, then the location and appearance of the hernia will depend on the position of the affected organ and the degree of obstruction. When you press on it with your fingers, it may temporarily disappear, only to return when you release the pressure. This type of protrusion is often associated with severe pain and discomfort, as well as difficulty passing stool or gas due to the obstruction.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is due to moisture or fluid buildup, then the protrusion will be painless and not hidden when you press on it with your hand. It will not feel tight or swollen.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to bleeding, then the protrusion will be accompanied by these signs: the abscess will have a dark color that is declining or fading.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is due to thickened or hardened tissue, then the protrusion will be a severe abscess that is large and hard, and will have a distinct size or shape.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is due to gas or wind, then touching it will be painless.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation for this is that you should consider whether the protrusion of the navel is due to bleeding from an artery or a vein, or from gas. If it is, then you must not attempt to treat it, as there is danger and fear involved in such cases, just as we have taught you in the chapter where we discussed abscesses caused by arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the swelling of the navel is due to the intestines or membranes, then you must instruct the patient to hold their belly, and stand extended; and approach carefully examine the entire area around the navel, and then command them to lie down between your hands upon their back, and then place a spatula along the circumference of the navel at the marked location; and then drain the abscess in the area above with a large incision; and then bind it in the circumference with strong ligature or ceda and in the appropriate manner.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then you should insert your finger into the middle of the abscess and push it down onto the ligament, searching for the intestine; and if you have found or protected it through the ligament, then you should extract gently and guide the intestines back to their place in the interior of the belly.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found membranes, then take hold of them with a forceps and make an incision into the superfluous part.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your incision or vein, then you should circle that part and return to your operation; and take two needles and place strong ligatures on both of them and insert two needles into the circuit which you have made around the abscess in a cross shape, causing them to penetrate; and then hold the abscess in four parts onto the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and leave the area so that the flesh can extend itself and fall by itself; or make an incision when it is thinned out and possible, and then heal that with what is necessary of ointments until it heals.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the swelling of the navel is due to thickened flesh or moisture, then it is appropriate that you make an incision in the abscess as we have said and drain the blood or moisture which you find inside, and then heal that with what is necessary and strengthen the area.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53
De curacio de cranc.	Of the treatment of cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said in the division of the types of cancer and what method is used for its healing with medicines, that it is advisable to treat it with iron to prevent ulcers; and we have said that cancer requires caution and care in its treatment.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients have said that some cancers are in places where it is possible to extract them entirely, such as cancer of the breast or thigh and similar ones located on limbs which can be removed entirely, especially when they are small and beginning.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and large, then it is not appropriate to attempt to heal it because I have never been able to cure such a one nor have I seen anyone else do so, or achieve that.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation for it is when it has spread as we have said, that you proceed and leave the patient and purge them of black bile several times, and then bleed them if there is obvious congestion found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient with preparation that puts them in an operating position, and also provide pointed hooks which are necessary for it; and make a thorough cleansing of all parts with good purgation so that no causes remain from its roots.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow and do not cut it lightly, but press the areas and wipe away the thick blood with your hand or with an appropriate instrument that you have available.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if it is contrary to the flow of thick blood from vein or artery, then you should cauterize that part until the flow of blood stops and then heal it with other healing methods until it heals.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 54
De curacio de ydropici.	Of the treatment of dropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recommended in the division of types of dropsy caused by water and their symptoms, of its healing with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And the one that is treated with iron is only the type of dropsy called ascites, and it is not appropriate to use iron for the types called tympanites or hydrothorax, because those are fatal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this type of dropsy called tympanites with medicines and they do not improve from your treatment, then consider whether the patient is already suffering from weakness or another type of dropsy such as cough or stomach ailment and similar to those; therefore be careful not to treat them with iron because there is danger in that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see that the patient is strong and has no other illness but only dropsy, not a child or an old person, then the method of operation for them is to lift the patient between your hands, and have them expel the air from their stomach with their own hand, pushing the water down towards the lower part of the abdomen, and then take a blunt spatula in this manner:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It should be of two sharp edges and long, with sharpened extremities like a spatula; but it must have some small thickness gradually, in order that during the operation with it you do not penetrate into the bowels, but rather press on them.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider whether the generation of dropsy is from the bowels; because in that case it is necessary to make an incision at a distance of three finger-widths below the navel on the right side towards the abdominal muscles.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	If the generation of dropsy is due to disease of the spleen, then your incision should be on the left side of the navel for three fingers' breadth.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the cause of it is the liver, then your incision should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And it is not necessary for your incision to be on the side where the patient wishes to lie, so that excess fluids do not flow to that painful place.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then pierce the entire abscess with your instrument and enter that incision, lifting your hand with a spatula between the abscess and the peritoneum, and then curette it out; remove a quantity of about a fingernail or so.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then pierce the peritoneum until the spatula reaches the empty space, which is the location of the water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then remove that and insert an instrument that has this shape (presumably providing a sketch or description of the instrument).
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a thin silver cannula; it is made of silver or copper or lead, with a small hole at the very bottom, and on its sides there are three holes: two on one side and one on the other side; and its tip is sharpened like a quill pen, as you see.
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the upper end of it is a funnel, because when the instrument reaches the water, that funnel should be placed over it immediately, and then the water will evacuate in half the quantity, because if you evacuate more than necessary in that hour, very soon the patient may die from depletion of their vital spirit, or it could bring on a crisis which is close to death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But evacuate according to the strength of the patient and according to what their physical condition indicates to you, from the strength of their pulse and the appearance of their complexion.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then remove the instrument and retain the water, which is retained because it is immediately held back by the abscess, and you are told to pierce that again in the same way.

De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Chapter 57 (continued).
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution of continuity like other wounds, but since it is part of our practice and will, and its purpose is specifically in children, it is necessary that we assign the best operation and way to minimize loss for their health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore, I say that the ancients did not practice circumcision on any of their free men, because it was not part of their laws. The reason we have come to use circumcision is through experience, and I have found that most artisans and barbers use a novacula (a type of knife) and torotors (a surgical instrument) for circumcision and cleaning; and they use ligatures with figs and incisions with the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already prohibited all those methods and have not found a better cleaning method than using forceps, ligatures with figs in cleaning as with the nail, because many times the foreskin escapes being cut because it has two layers, and the inner layer remains, which can easily be forced to another incision and causes certain pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu. De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Chapter 58: On the treatment of urinary retention in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Urinary retention in the bladder is caused by an obstruction due to a stone or clotted blood, or pus or flesh, and similar to those we have mentioned in the division of methods of treatment.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved and there is a suspicion that the retention is due to a stone in the neck of the bladder, then the patient should be made to lie on their back with their hips raised. This position can help to relieve the obstruction caused by the stone and allow for easier urination. The patient may also benefit from drinking plenty of fluids to help flush out the stone and reduce the risk of further blockages. If the stone is too large to pass naturally, medical intervention such as surgery or lithotripsy (breaking up the stone with shock waves) may be necessary. However, these procedures should only be performed by a qualified medical professional in a controlled setting.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And then place the patient's legs on their stomach and stretch their belly above their stomach, and have the patient contract their muscles as much as they can. This position can help to increase pressure in the abdomen and pelvic area, which may help to dislodge the stone and relieve the obstruction. It is important to ensure that the patient is comfortable and able to maintain this position for a period of time, as excessive strain or discomfort could exacerbate the condition. Additionally, it may be helpful to provide the patient with a warm compress or heating pad to apply to the abdomen, as this can help to relax the muscles and alleviate pain. However, these methods should only be used in conjunction with proper medical treatment and under the guidance of a healthcare professional.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, when the bladder neck is constricted, it helps in expelling the stone to the back parts, so that the urine is released. This can be achieved through various methods such as manual compression of the bladder or using a catheter to flush out the stone. In some cases, surgery may be required to remove the stone if it is too large or cannot be removed through non-invasive means. It is important to seek medical attention as soon as possible if you are experiencing symptoms of urinary retention or a blocked urinary tract, as this can lead to serious complications such as kidney damage or infection. A healthcare professional can provide a proper diagnosis and recommend the most appropriate treatment options based on your individual needs and circumstances.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if the cause has not been dissolved with what we have mentioned and it has become more severe in the patient, then it is necessary to administer an evacuation to them with an instrument called a syringe, which looks like this: It should be made of silver and be delicate and hollow, similar to a bird's quill with the delicacy of a long ray and a length of one and a half palms, with a thin cannula at the tip.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	The method of evacuation of urine for this is to take the folded gall bladder and tie it to the patient's extremity with wool or cotton for good adhesion; then insert the ends of the gallbladder into the lower part of the syringe, and use forceps to remove any excess cause from the wool, but gently push it into the cannula with force, and then slowly insert the syringe with care and gentleness.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And apply a cupping glass to the patient on the shoulder, puncture the bladder and penis of the patient with moist oils such as olive oil and water.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then gently insert the syringe until it reaches the base of the penis; and then bend the penis upward at the location of the incision; and then push the syringe further in, and continue to push it in until it reaches the bladder, and then milk the patient until the cause is emptied, and this should be done in this order, not randomly, but following the correct path.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then slowly pull out the wool with the gall bladder attached, little by little, because the urine will soak the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	And then remove it and perform the cure by evacuating the urine, and continue to use the syringe until the bladder is emptied and the patient feels relief.

sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	but its tip is closed or sealed.

And then insert the tip of the clampcedra into the penis as we have described in the use of the syringe; and then push the liquid with it, because the liquid will immediately reach the bladder and the patient will expel it.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	The shape of a delicate enema syringe that is used to irrigate the bladder is as follows:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it should be made of silver or lead, with the tip resembling a small feather and the cannula gradually narrowing inside.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And then take a bladder of an animal, such as a sheep or pig, and place the liquid that you want to use for the enema into it, and then tie it tightly between two strong ligatures with double thread, and heat the liquid over a fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then insert the tip of the enema syringe into the penis.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then place your hand over the bladder with gentle pressure, directing the liquid towards the bladder until the patient feels that the liquid has been introduced into the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if the bladder is not present, then take a piece of pig's lard and form it into a circle; and pierce it all the way through with your finger, making holes that are evenly spaced around the circumference. Then insert strong thread through these holes so that they are securely attached to each other, like a small bag. And then fill this bag with the liquid or medicines that you wish to introduce into the bladder, using oil and water if necessary.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tie the bag to the syringe and use it in the same way as you did with the bladder, expressing the liquid towards the bladder with your hand until it reaches its intended destination.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter 60.
De extraccio de peyra.	Chapter 60: On the removal of a stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already discussed in the previous sections the types of stones and their treatment with medicines, as well as the difference between stones generated in the kidneys and those generated in the bladder, and the symptoms that accompany them.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have mentioned that a stone can be operated on with the hand and sectioning.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And a bladder stone, properly speaking, is one that is located in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	I will now describe this in clear and concise terms.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	I say that bladder stones are most commonly found in children, and the symptoms of this condition include urine that is thin and watery like water when it is expelled from the bladder, and sand or grit may be present in the urine. The patient will also experience pain and a frequent urge to urinate, and they may have difficulty starting or stopping their flow of urine. In addition, they may notice blood in their urine or experience rectal pain when passing urine.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	The treatment of bladder stones in children is usually successful before they reach the age of 14, but it can be difficult to treat in older individuals.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in young people, the treatment is easier because it occurs within them.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And the treatment of bladder stones is easier when they are larger, but if they are small, the opposite is true.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, in order to treat a bladder stone, it is necessary first to cleanse the patient with an enema, which will extract any feces or debris that may be obstructing the path of the stone. This is important because fecal matter can sometimes prevent the stone from being expelled naturally or make surgical removal more difficult. By cleansing the bowel prior to surgery, healthcare providers can help ensure a clearer and less obstructed path for the stone, making it easier to locate and remove during the procedure. This can help reduce the risk of complications and improve the overall outcomes for the patient.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then the patient should be positioned with their legs drawn up and strapped down in order to encourage the stone to descend towards the opening of the bladder, or to move out of its current location. This can help facilitate the removal of the stone during surgery by allowing it to be more easily accessed and extracted from the urinary tract. By positioning the patient in this way, healthcare providers can help ensure a smoother and more successful surgical intervention.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then apply a cupping glass to the lower part of the patient's abdomen in order to draw the bladder downward and make it more accessible during surgery. This can be done by placing the cup over the affected area and creating a vacuum seal, which will help draw the bladder closer to the surface of the skin. By doing this, healthcare providers can create a clearer path for the surgical instruments and improve the overall outcomes of the procedure.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then carefully extract the stone and remove it entirely from the body. This is an important step in the surgical process, as any remaining fragments or pieces of the stone can potentially cause further complications or lead to recurrent symptoms in the future. By carefully extracting the entire stone during surgery, healthcare providers can help ensure a successful outcome for the patient and minimize the risk of future issues related to bladder stones.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore if you feel a stone in the space, you should place yourself quickly on top of it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if the stone does not come out completely from the incision, you should then anoint your left index finger with oil and either insert it into the child's anus (if the patient is a child), or use your middle finger if they are fully grown, and introduce it into their anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And search for the stone with your finger until it is beneath your finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And gradually move that (the stone) into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	Then press on it with your finger and push it out through the incision where you made the cut.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	Command the assistant to press on the bladder with their hand; and command another assistant to extend the patient's legs apart above the incision, while using their other hand to hold down the fatty tissue below the genitals in the area of the incision.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then insert an instrument that is sharp and slanted, which has this shape (here there would likely have been a diagram or illustration in the original text).
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and make an incision in the area between the buttocks and the genitals (not in the middle), but rather towards the left thigh, with the incision being on top of the stone and your finger being inside the rectum. Make a transverse incision so that the outside opening is wide and the inside opening is narrow according to how large the stone is, as far as possible without causing difficulty, for if you press too hard on the finger in the rectum, it will cause damage.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that some stones have angles and rough edges, making their removal difficult.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And such a stone resembles a smooth lump or a round shape and is made of soft material.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore if it has angles and rough edges, fit it into the incision.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not easily inserted, then you should guide it in or use gentle force to insert it, while holding the end of the instrument like a file that you move back and forth over the stone without losing contact with it; or use a slender instrument with a curved tip.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you are unable to do so, then widen the incision slightly and if you see flowing blood, cut with strength using a mixture of one-third vitriol (sulfuric acid).
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if there is more than one stone, you should first press your hand to the mouth of the bladder and then make an incision on it; then gradually insert your finger further in; and repeat this process if there are multiple stones.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the stone is very large, it is important to note that you should not make a large incision, for this can result in one of two outcomes for the patient: either they will die or develop continual urinary dribbling due to the fact that the area has not fully healed.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But in order to remove the stone, administer an expulsion medication while it is still inside or use forceps to extract it piece by piece from the incision.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore once you have completed your procedure, fill the wound with pieces of aloe and dragon's blood (a resin obtained from various species of small trees and shrubs) and then bandage it.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place a cloth soaked in oil and vinegar or rose oil and water on top of it, in order to prevent infection from developing.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	Then lay the patient down on their back with their head raised and do not disturb the bandages for at least three days.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And once you have removed the bandages, rinse the area with water and oil, then treat it with a mixture of fine powder and diascordium ointment until it has healed. [To clarify: diascordium is a homeopathic remedy made from the juice of wild hemlock (Conium maculatum), which can be toxic in large doses but is used in minute amounts to treat various conditions in homeopathy.]
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if an abscess forms in the wound, which is hot and painful, resembling frozen blood in the bladder that blocks urine flow (a sign of this can be blood in the urine), you should insert your finger into the wound to drain it, for if left untreated, it can cause decay of the bladder and lead to putrefaction.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then wash the wound with vinegar and water, salt, and apply any necessary remedies as needed for treatment until it heals.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And throughout the entire healing process, it is important to keep the thighs together and administer any necessary medications that have been applied to the area.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and located in the meat of the penis, preventing urination, you should treat it with the method recommended earlier before making an incision, as this type of treatment has been accused of causing unnecessary incisions. This has been proven to be true, and the recommended approach is to use a soft iron perforator that looks like this (here there would likely have been a diagram or illustration in the original text).
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	with a triangular pointed end attached to a handle.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	Then apply some thread soaked in bile (or another adhesive substance) to the penis below the stone to prevent it from returning to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	Then insert the perforator into the penis with ease until it reaches the stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And rotate the perforator with your hand in the stone gradually until you have made an opening large enough for the other end to pass through, for this will allow the urine to flow freely.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	Then press your hand on the area outside of the stone in the penis to ensure that it is properly drained, as this will allow the wound to heal and the patient to recover.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if you are unable to perform this procedure for any reason that prevents it, then apply a thread soaked in bile (or another adhesive substance) below the stone and another one on top of it instead.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	Then make an incision on the stone in the penis between two threads soaked in bile (or another adhesive substance).
E aprop extratz aquela.	And then remove the stone.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	Then remove the bandages and clean away any clotted blood that may have formed in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to apply thread soaked in bile below the stone, only above it, for when you remove the bandages and the stone is expelled, the fatty tissue will return to its place and heal the wound.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And so it is important when you apply the thread soaked in bile above the stone that you lift up the fatty tissue or return it to its proper place in order to allow the wound to heal as described earlier.

De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	On the removal of stones from women's bladders.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Stones in women are rarely formed. [This is a statement made by the author, and it may or may not be true.]
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if a stone is found in any of them (women), it is difficult to treat and often requires invasive procedures. [The author suggests that treating stones in women can be challenging and potentially dangerous due to the complexities of female anatomy.]
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One reason for this is that women are more prone to becoming widowed or sexually inactive, leading to a higher risk of stone formation. [This is because sexual activity can help prevent the buildup of urine and minerals in the bladder, which can contribute to stone formation.] [
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second reason is that it is difficult to determine if a woman has a stone because she may not reveal her sexual status to a doctor, whether she is celibate or married.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	And the third reason is that few women are skilled in this art, particularly the surgical technique using hands.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth reason is that the location of the incision for removing stones in women is further away from the actual stone, requiring a deeper cut and causing greater fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity requires it, you should find a knowledgeable married woman, although they are rare.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of that (knowledgeable married woman), then look for a skilled and nimble young man or present a mature woman who is well-versed in women's affairs, or a woman who has been trained in this art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra. This is important because it allows the practitioner to assess whether the woman is a virgin, in which case they should insert their finger into her rectum and feel for the stone.

Therefore, if they find the stone, it is important to gradually move it from the urethral opening of the bladder towards the area between the thighs with sufficient force until it reaches the lower part of the incision.

And then make an incision over the stone in the appropriate location on the vulva near the crease of the thigh, positioning it so that the tip of your instrument is centered on the stone and not pressed too hard against it.

And the incision should be small at the beginning; and then introduce the knife gently into the indicated section, and if you feel the stone, then widen the incision to match the size of the stone that you know will be removed from that area.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the types of stones are many: some are small and large, hard and rough, long and round, and have sharp edges.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore, you should know how many types there are of it (stones) for what you mean by indicating what you want.

And if you want a flow of blood, and know that the expulsion of blood is from an artery that is cut, then you should put powder on the area and tighten it with a bandage and compression, and do not repeat that; and leave the stone in place and do not remove it, because the patient will die very soon.

Capitol lxii.	Chapter LXII (62).
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	On incision for hernia strangulation.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	An inguinal hernia is nothing but an accumulation of fluid in the white membrane located near the groin and containing the liquid, which is called scrotum.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And sometimes it is located in the proper fatty tissue which nature has prepared during the descent of the testicle, so that it becomes a separate organ; and this is called the cord of the genitalia between the white membrane that we mentioned earlier, and this is not but fat. [Note: This translation might have some errors as I'm not completely sure about some words and phrases.]
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	The generation of this hernia is due to the weakness that occurs in the genitals, causing this material to be infiltrated into them, and sometimes it happens due to a blow or impact on the genital area.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this fluid has many different colors, as its color can be tending towards citrine or blood-red, or reddish, or black and fecal, or watery and white, and these are the most common types.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is known where this accumulation of fluid is located are: if it is in the white membrane that we mentioned, then the abscess will be round and slightly elongated, similar to the shape of an egg, and the genitals will appear, as the fluid will surround them from all sides.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the fluid is in the proper fatty tissue, then the abscess will be round with an opening similar to that of an egg, and for this reason, people think it is another testicle.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the fluid is between the cord of the genitalia and the white membrane, then there will be a sensation of heaviness in that area.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And if you want to determine the color of the fluid, then press on the abscess with a curved probe whose shape is known; and according to what comes out in the trace of the probe, make your judgment based on that.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	And so when we come to the treatment of it with surgery, then it is advisable to order the patient to undergo venesection if it is possible for you, and also puncture the abscess.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And then turn him over onto his stomach with some elevation, and place a few cloths underneath him.

And then you should position yourself on the patient's left side and order the assistant to be on his right side, extending his penis with one of two fingers towards the cord of the genitals and the division of the linea alba of the abdomen.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And then take a broad-bladed scalpel and make an incision in the cord of the genitals in the middle of the line for its entire length up to near the pubic bone.

And make the incision according to the proper line that you should follow towards the pubic hair, until it reaches the white membrane and includes it.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And remove the membrane, observe and take care not to cut it; and make the incision in such a way that it is divided into two parts, so that it remains suspended with the testicle, and carefully examine its size and shape according to what is possible for you.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And then puncture the white membrane filled with fluid with a wide incision and remove all of the fluid.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And then separate the two sides of the incision with forceps and extend the white membrane towards both sides; do not touch the cord of the genitals that is contained within it, and make an incision in the white membrane as deeply as you can.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And make an incision in it completely or in pieces, and especially its lateral part, because if you do not examine the incision carefully, there is no certainty that the fluid will not return.

e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas. E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes this hernia is treated artificially with cautery instead of incision with a knife; and it is done by taking a thin cauterizing scalpel and making an incision with it in the cord of the genitals, and then igniting it as we have said before until the white membrane containing the fluid is exposed. And you should take cautery in the following form:
e es asemblat a letra greca.	And it is shaped like the Greek letter L.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	And then puncture the white membrane with it (cautery), and ignite it until all the fluid is removed.

And approach the hip with forceps, and scrape with forceps, and scrape with a sharp cautery heated; and make an incision in the second one that is possible for you to cut out completely; and be careful that the fire does not touch the fluid.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And know that this operation is safer and further away from bleeding than an incision, and better than surgery with cutting.

But if you have an abscess or bleeding during the incision or cauterization, then you must treat the condition that arises accordingly, with treatment that is suitable based on what has been said.
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa. Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos. E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And let the incision be wide enough to allow all the water to flow out.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	And then place a finger over the opening and press it gently, allowing the remaining water to flow out.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then heal the wound until the injury is cured.
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	But if there is an obstruction to the flow of water at that time, then you should puncture it: and this should not be done unless the whitish granulation tissue in the opening of the wound creates an obstruction and prevents the outflow of water, in which case it is necessary to insert a probe or instrument used for extracting water from hydropics into the wound, the shape of which has been described; or apply pressure to the edges of the wound with a small piece of wood.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And know that the water returns and accumulates again after two or three months; and when it has accumulated, then it should be punctured in the same manner, for the patient will thus pass his days.
