De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Of incision on a fatty hernia and its healing.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Know that in the incision of this hernia there is fear of danger, even in the best circumstances; therefore, I recommend avoiding it and choosing the safest option instead.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And I remember the operation on that one and the types of abscesses.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, I say that an abscess is formed in the parts of the body where the veins are congested and this happens for many reasons: either due to sudden and severe congestion, which spreads to the veins, or due to trauma.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And the color of an abscess is similar to that of the body part where it forms, and pain is not present in it, and it is a serious abscess.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	And a hard abscess is one that is filled with pus, whose color is dark and there is no sensation in it.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	And sometimes abscesses are formed by congestion of the arteries, and this is noticeable because there is a memory of it, or due to inflammation of veins.
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	But abscesses caused by inflammation of the arteries can be recognized by the spreading of the abscess when you press it with your fingers, and it is not advisable to touch it.
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	But an abscess caused by inflammation of a vein does not spread when you press it with your fingers due to the compression of the vein.
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	And it is possible to make an incision on this type of abscess and on other parts of the body: that is, you should cut into the skin of the groin, pull the skin upwards, extract the whitish pus from the cavity, release the suspensory ligament of the veins, tie them off, and incise the suspensory ligament more than you have released it from all parts of the cavity of the veins.
Donc si l’huou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	Therefore, if the fluid has already solidified with the surrounding flesh, then it is necessary to extract the fluid and make an incision into that area.
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	And if there is an adhesion between the flesh for some reason, or between what is between the veins, then it is necessary to release all of that adhesion and make a round incision into it.
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	But if there is a growth of flesh in the place of the adhesion which is behind it, then it is necessary to cut into all of that, and extract the fluid as I have said.
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when the operation is complete, fill the wound with wool soaked in rose oil and wine, and take care of it with the other treatment until it heals.
Capitol .lxiv.	Chapter 64
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	Chapter 64
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.	A hernia (vit) is an abscess enclosed by a membrane similar to a blister, accompanied by swelling of the testicles, making movement and walking difficult for the patient.
E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	And in the treatment of this condition, caution is advised due to the risk associated with its onset.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	However, we must also discuss surgery as a second option after the first has been attempted.
E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	And I say that the patient should be laid on an elevated table, and the surgeon should carefully lift up the scrotum and tie off the spermatic cord near the inguinal canal using a ligature that has been tested on a piece of string. The other assistants should also hold the patient's limbs firmly in place, stretching them as needed.
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	And then make an incision with a narrow, sharp scalpel along the length of the vessels until they are exposed.
E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	And then remove the outer layer of tissue from all parts of the area, just as we described in the extraction of abscesses in the temples.
E aprop fica en aquelas un’agulha en la qual sia fiel doble, e lia aquel en le primier del locs en les quals accideys vit, e lia aquel autra veguada en le derier de lor.	And then place a needle with double thread into the area, and tie it at the first point where the hernia occurs, and tie the other end at the back of the area.
E aprop inscideys aquels en le mieg loc per seccio dreyta segon la longuesa del cos, e extratz aquo que es agreguat de las humiditatz fetulentas e corruptas.	And then make a straight incision along the length of the body in the middle area, and remove any material that has accumulated due to putrefied and corrupted fluids.
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	And then treat the wound as you would any other wound where infection is likely to occur, in order to prevent any damage to the vessels that supply blood to one or both of the testicles, as this could lead to serious complications.
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que·ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	However, if the hernia has affected all of the blood vessels, then it is necessary to remove the testicles entirely or to allow them to atrophy due to lack of nutrients from the severed blood vessels. This will prevent any further damage and ensure that they do not interfere with the healing process.
Capitol .lxv.	Chapter 65.
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	Chapter 65: On the treatment of intestinal hernia.
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	The occurrence of this hernia is due to a rupture in the fascia, which extends over the abdomen from the inguinal region of the pelvis. When the intestines protrude through this weakened area, they can become trapped and cause obstruction or strangulation.
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	This rupture can be caused by either the ciphac or a weakness in it, and it can occur for various reasons such as impact, strain, loud noises, heavy lifting, or similar causes.
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	The sign of this type of hernia, when it is caused by the extension of the fascia, is that it develops gradually over a long period of time and does not occur suddenly. It may also be accompanied by a swelling or abscess near the inguinal region, which occurs because the fascia is compressing the intestines.
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	The sign of this type of hernia, when it is caused by a rupture in the fascia, is that it initially causes sudden and severe pain, accompanied by a swelling or abscess that appears differently than a typical inguinal hernia. This occurs because the intestine is protruding through the damaged fascial tissue and becoming inflamed.
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	In some cases, the intestine may protrude through a hole in the abdominal wall along with a portion of the peritoneum (the lining of the abdominal cavity), which is known as a Richter's hernia or zirbal hernia.
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	In some cases, the hernia may be caused by gas in the intestine, and in other cases it may occur when a portion of the intestine becomes trapped in a tear or fissure. This can lead to serious complications such as intestinal obstruction or strangulation, which can be life-threatening if not treated promptly.
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	And in the treatment of this condition with iron (i.e., surgery), there is a risk of complications, which is why it is important to avoid injury or damage to surrounding tissues during the procedure.
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	The method of surgery for this condition involves instructing the patient to manually reduce the intestine back into their abdominal cavity using their own hand, while the surgeon applies gentle pressure to assist in the process. The patient is then positioned on their side with a pillow or other support beneath their pelvis to maintain proper alignment and prevent further herniation.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	The surgeon should then carefully dissect the tissue surrounding the inguinal canal, isolating and cutting the spermatic cord with sharp scissors. They should then create two small incisions on either side of the incision, inserting curved needles or forceps to gently separate the edges of the incision and facilitate closure.
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	If the incision is larger than necessary, or if there is a risk of tissue herniation through the surgical site, the surgeon may choose to use a mesh reinforcement to strengthen the abdominal wall and prevent future hernias from developing.
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	The surgeon should then carefully remove any excess fascial tissue or adhesions from the inguinal canal, exposing the underlying white, fibrous tissue of the transversalis fascia. This will allow for precise identification and repair of any defects in the abdominal wall that may be contributing to the hernia.
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	After this, the surgeon should carefully dissect the tissue surrounding the spermatic cord and testicle, isolating and dividing any adhesions or attachments between the transversalis fascia and the surrounding structures. This will allow for careful mobilization of the testicle and repair of the hernia defect without tension or undue strain on the surrounding tissues.
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	The surgeon should then place their hand over the testicle, gently guiding it back into its normal position outside of the abdominal wall. They should use their other hand to carefully stretch and retract the transversalis fascia laterally, creating more space for the hernia repair. Once sufficient space has been created, they can elevate the testicle and hernia sac back up to the level of the incision, using gentle traction to align everything properly. The assistant should then apply downward pressure on the testicle, holding it in place while the surgeon carefully dissects and divides any remaining adhesions or attachments between the transversalis fascia and the surrounding structures, using a combination of blunt and sharp dissection as needed.
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And ask with your words if there is any cause for the intestine being wrapped in the hard white diaphragm.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you find any cause in him, then you should push it down to his belly.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And then take a needle with a thick groove made for ten pieces of bile, and insert it in the following way: directly under the diaphragm, which is below the kidneys, in the section where the liver meets the diaphragm; and then insert the ends that protrude from the bile into the liver so that there are four pieces of bile; and then arrange them in some shape on top of it, in the form of a cross; and attach it to the diaphragm, which we said is below the kidneys, with great force from both sides.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And then wrap the ends of the bile and attach them with strong ligatures, so that none of the veins that nourish it can transmit any cause, in order to prevent an abscess from developing here.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And then attach another ligature according to the size of the first one, at least three finger-widths away from it; and leave a space on the diaphragm, which is below the kidneys, the length of a finger; and cut through the remaining tissue, following its rounded shape, and remove the fluid.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And then make an incision below the kidneys, in the section where blood and pus flow, as we have said before.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And then apply wool soaked in oil to the wound and place it on the incision; and apply the ligature that we mentioned (and sometimes the white diaphragm is cauterized, which we said before should be feared for the risk of bleeding during the incision, because this happens frequently); and leave the ligature in place until it falls off by itself.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if the scab is slow to form, then apply hot water and place it on top, as we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And then care for the wound with the same treatment used for other wounds until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvi.	Chapter 66.
De hernia ventosa.	On hernia ventosa (or "windy hernia").
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this type of hernia, I have not seen anyone who has been bold enough to attempt a cure using iron.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	And the first [doctors] said that it should be treated in the same way as we have described for hernia that is alive; that is, you should tie off the veins near the incision with ease, and dry up the surrounding area around the abscess using a substance that causes it to shrink, until the veins fall away.
E cura la plagua segon que havem dit entro que sia sanada.	And care for the wound in the way that we have described until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter 67.
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	On the disruption (or "dislocation" or "disruption of continuity") that occurs in the sinews (or "tendons" or "ligaments").
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Sometimes there is a rupture in the tendons or ligaments, as we have said, and they protrude from the affected area.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And one should not allow any cause of the intestines to reach the groin; and if it does, it is only a little; and it always returns.
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	But if this condition persists for a long time, then a fissure forms in the diaphragm, allowing the intestines to protrude into the thoracic cavity; and this happens because of the stretching of the diaphragm that occurs in the tendons or ligaments, as we have said. The cause of this is that the diaphragm is stretched out, making it weak and thin, and the area becomes abscessed and protrudes.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And the treatment for this condition is with a hot iron, as we have described earlier.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And sometimes this condition is treated with iron in the following way: the patient lies on their back with their legs extended and open, and the area of the rupture or protrusion of the abscess is dried using a hot iron along its length, equivalent to three finger-widths.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And then strengthen the white diaphragm that is below the kidney so that it is exposed.
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And then take a rod and place it on the protruding area of the diaphragm, and press it against the pressure point of the abdomen.
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And then sew together the two protruding areas on either end of the rod that is placed on the diaphragm, using a suture to join them.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then remove the end of the rod, but do not make a complete incision in the diaphragm, and do not release any fluid or cause any other damage, as you know in the treatment of intestinal hernia.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then care for this condition with the same treatment used for wounds, and when you make incisions in the abscess, clean it and restore the wound until it is consolidated; because the diaphragm is contracted and the protrusion of the rupture is not adjusted.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cauterization is better in this location, because it is closer to health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter 68.
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	On the softening of the kidney of the testicles.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Much observation has shown that the spermatic cord in some men is softened because the flesh between them is softened, and this requires careful monitoring.
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Therefore, it is necessary for the one treating the patient to have them lie on their back and to secure the entire spermatic cord that has become softened onto the natural spermatic cord; and then carefully stitch together the two labia (of the scrotum).
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if desired, in the beginning, excessively softened parts of the spermatic cord can be excised with three or four sutures and firm stitches.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	Then insert between the sutures; and then take care of healing any other wounds inside until it is healed and pus disappears.
Capitol .lxix.	Chapter 69.
De castracio.	On castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Know that castration is forbidden in our religion, but it is appropriate for me to mention it in this book; and there are two reasons why I should bring it up: the first is so that a doctor, when questioned about it, would have knowledge of its treatment; and the second reason is that we often need castration of other animals for our livestock, such as horses, oxen, pigs, and similar animals.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And so I say that castration is performed in two ways: either by crushing or by cutting in half.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	But in that which is performed by crushing, the method of operation is to submerge the animal in hot water until its genitals become soft and limp and hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	Then hold those in your hand until they are drained and do not show through the covering.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in castration performed by cutting and splitting, it is necessary to hold the animal and press down on the spermatic cord of its testicles with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	Then tie up the suspensory ligament and make a cut into each one of them between two protrusions.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	Then remove any excess skin that you have excised.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not leave anything on the outside of it, but make a subtle incision that is above the veins.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this method of castration performed by crushing is better because it leaves some parts of the testicles intact, which makes the animal still have a desire to mate.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	Then take care of the wound until it heals.
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter 70.
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	On the treatment of hermaphroditism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphroditism in men occurs in two ways: the first is when there is a space between the scrotum and the testicles, where there appears to be a woman's vulva between the two testicles.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And sometimes, the person's urine comes out from the space between the testicles.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	But in women, there is a different type: and that is when the vulva above the pubic bone appears to be like two male testicles, slightly protruding outside as if they were a man's penis and scrotum.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the treatment is of three types: two for males and one for females.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And it is necessary to cut the swollen flesh and return it inside so that it heals, and then take care of any other wounds.
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And in the second type of males, where urine comes out from the space between the testicles, there is no cure or treatment for them.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 71.
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	On leanness and protruding flesh due to causes in women.
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	Leanness is easily corrected due to natural causes when it becomes prominent and requires careful attention; sometimes, it can become so extreme in some women that it spreads as much as in men and even prevents sexual intercourse.
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	Then it is necessary to hold the excess leanness with your hand or a tool and remove it by cutting.
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	And do not cut too deeply, especially near the navel, to avoid causing bleeding.
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	Then heal that wound as you would any other wound until it is healed.
Mays carn nascuda es carn que nays en le horrifici de la mayre entro que umple aquel, e fort leu es eyssit a las partidas deforo segon semblansa de coa (e per aquo alscus primiers appelero aquo “malautia caudada”); donc cove que nos inscidam ayssi cum inscidem lentinge, e curem aquela entro que sia sanada.	But flesh that is born is flesh that grows inside the womb until it fills it up, and it easily protrudes outside in the shape of a tail (and for this reason, I will call this condition "caudal disease" for now); therefore, it is necessary to cut it like we would leanness, and heal the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxii.	Chapter 72.
De curacio de alratica.	On the treatment of hernia.
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	Hernia refers to when a woman's vulva is not perforated or has a small perforation.
E es o natural o accidental.	And it can be either natural or accidental.
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	An accidental hernia is caused by an underlying illness and can occur due to loose flesh or thin or thick skin.
E es fayt o en le preon de la mayre, o en les costatz de lu, o en le pus sobira de lu, o en le pus bas de lu, e prohibeys de cuoyt e de enprenguacio e de enfantament, e fort leu prohibeys las mestruas.	An accidental hernia can occur in the navel of the mother, near the ribs, or above or below it, and it prevents sexual intercourse, pregnancy, and menstruation.
E la cognicio de aquela es fayta per reguardament de la metrona, si la oppilacio es apparent, propdana; mays si no es apparent, lahoras tu cerqua aquela am les tieus ditz o am le ray.	The diagnosis of a hernia is made by examining the mother's belly button and determining if it is prominent; but if it is not visible, then use your fingers or an instrument to examine it.
Mays si oppilacio es per ciphac subtil, e es propda a las doas labias, lahoras tu coyta e disromp aquela.	But if the hernia is caused by thin skin and appears near the two labia, then you should press down on it and break it open.
E es que pauses sobre las doas labias pulvils, e aprop pausa les tieus ditz indicz de amdoas las mas encemps.	And place your fingers on the two labia and then press both of your index fingers firmly against them.
E la femna sia sobre le sieu dos, las sieuas coyssas extendudas, e aprop exten las doas labias am forsa entro que aquel ciphac subtil sia romput e la oppilacio sia uberta.	And the woman should be lying on her back with her thighs extended and use force to open up the two labia until that thin skin is broken and the opening is visible.
E aprop pren lana e enbeu le4 en oli e pausa aquela sobre·l loc, e jagua am home le dia per so que·l loc inscis no sia consolidat.	Then take some wool and soak it in oil and place it over the wound to prevent the cut from becoming solidified; and have someone stay with her for several days to ensure that the wound does not become infected.
Mays si le ciphac es gros e espes, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel am spatum lat o am fuelha de mirta.	But if the skin is thick and hard, then it is necessary to cut into it with a scalpel or myrtle leaf.
Mays si la oppilacio es per carnada, lahoras suspen aquela am unci, e inscideys aquela.	But if the hernia is caused by loose flesh, then use forceps to lift up the flesh and cut into it.
E sian am tu las medicinas que fan cessar flux de sanc ses mordicacio, ayssi cum ahacatia, e sanc de drago, e enses, ajustat am album de huou.	And use the following medicines to stop bleeding without causing pain, such as henbane, dragon's blood, and alum boiled in egg white.
E aprop aministra una canulha de plom ampla per so que la plagua no sia consolidada leugierament.	And then administer a wide leaden cannula so that the wound does not heal lightly.
E tengua aquela per alcus jorns e aministra calgua de li sec.	And leave it there for several days and apply heat to it.
E aprop sia curada am l’autra curacio de consolidacio entro que sia sanada.	And then it should be cured with another method of solidification until it is healed.
E alcunas vetz accideys en la mayre nativitat de autres carns, e lahoras cove que inscidas segon aquesta manieyra.	And sometimes it happens that during the birth of other animals, (it) is necessary to proceed in this manner.
Mays si aysso es per apostema crancos, a l’apostema crancos le qual es en la mayre no sia fayta contrarietat am ferr en deguna manieyra.	But if this is due to a hard abscess, in the case of a hard abscess in the mother, it should not be treated with iron in any way.
Capitol .lxxiii.	Chapter 73.
De la cura de emorroydas e de tayl e de botor roja que accideysso en le conh de las femnas.	On the treatment of hemorrhoids, piles, and red botches that occur in the female genital area.
Emorroydas so apprecio dels orificis de motas venas entro que de aquelas corro mot sanc continuadament; e cum so antiquadas emorroydas e son fayts theyls.	Hemorrhoids are the swelling of the orifices of many veins, from which a large amount of blood flows continuously; and when hemorrhoids become old and form lumps.
E ja yeu he dit en la divisio las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e diyre ayssi aquelas que recebo curacio e aquelas que no recebo curacio.	And I have already said in the division the species of these and the signs of these, and I will also say those that receive treatment and those that do not receive treatment.
Donc dic que emorroydas e theyls quan so en le preon de la mayre e no apparo al sentiment, lahoras en aquelas no sia fayta curacio am ferr.	Therefore I say that hemorrhoids and lumps when they are inside the mother's womb and do not appear to sensation, in those there should be no treatment with iron.
Mays aquelas las quals so en le orrifici de la mayre sobre las quals catz sentiment, so aquelas que so curadas.	But those that are in the opening of the mother's womb, over which a sensation can be felt, those are the ones that are cured.
E cove que tu metas la femna en mayso frega e aprop exten atheyl am les forfexs, o am drap aspre, e inscideys aquelas am las razitz.	And it is necessary to place the woman in a warm bath and then extend her legs with forceps or with rough cloth and incise those with scissors.
E aprop pulveriza sobre aquelas deves le fluxs del sanc de una de las polveras insciscivas ses mordicacio, ayssi cum acassia e semblant ad aquels.	And then powder is sprinkled on those with the flow of blood from one of the incising powders, similar to that of a wound and resembling it.
E aprop enpellesca les sieus pes per una hora, e aprop pausa aquela en aygua freja.	And then wrap her legs with bandages for an hour and then place her in cold water.
E si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras fay aquela sezer en decoccio de sumat e de scorsas de milgranas e de gualas e de semblantz.	And if there is persistent bleeding, then make a sitz bath with sumac and corn silk and acorns and similar things.
E aprop pren farina de ordi e comfiys aquela am miel e vi agre e fay emplastre am aquo sobre le dos de lu.	And then take barley flour and mix it with honey, vinegar, and wine and make a plaster of that on his back.
E si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, fay adherir am dos ventozas, e a las mamilhas ses escarificatio.	And if blood is separated, it's good; and if not, make it stick with two suction cups, and on the nipples, make scars.
E aprop pren lana e submergeys aquela am suc de coliandre o am suc de arnagloza o am suc de guarravier am vi pentit e fay adherir al loc; e aprop cura le loc am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then take wool and soak it in juice of coltsfoot or juice of arnica or juice of houseleek with wine and attach it to the place; and then cure the place with ointment until it is healed.
Mays athyl rog le qual es de aspre reguardament, cove que tu inscidas aquo que a tu appar de aquel segon que he dit en theyl engualment.	But if the rough part is difficult to reach, it is necessary that you incise what appears appropriate to you according to what I have said in the previous ointment.
E cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxiv.	Chapter 74.
De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	On the rupture or accidental injury in the mother.
Motas specias de apostemas accideysso en la mayre, ayssi cum cranc e apostema lapident e ulceracios e adhubelat e erpetromens e fistulas emorroyas e raguarrias e thyl e autres apostemas.	Many types of abscesses that occur in the mother, such as hard and stony abscesses, ulcers, abscesses with pus, herpes, fistulous hemorrhoids, fissures, tumors, and other abscesses.
E yeu ja he dit aquestas malautias e las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e las curacios de lor en la divisio.	And I have already said these illnesses and the types of them and their signs, and their cures, in the division.
E cove que yeu digua en aquest tractat de apostema caut le qual ve en la mayre quan es dels apostemas que collegeysso sania, e si vols saber en qual manieyra se fa la opperacio de lu am ferr.	And it is necessary that I speak in this treatise about abscess cautery, which occurs in the breast when an abscess adheres to pus. If you want to know in what manner the operation of it is done with iron.
Adonc cove que tu consideres si la dolor de la apostema en le sieu comensament es aguda am percussio e flecma e febre, e vezes aquel enrogezir e si catz sobre aquel le sentiment, lahoras no·t coytes am perforacio de lu, e cura aquel am aquo que ajuda sobre la maturacio entro que cesse la acuitat dels accidentz.	Then it is necessary to consider whether the pain of the abscess in its beginning is sharp with percussion and inflammation and fever, and sometimes there is redness and if pus collects above it, then do not attempt to pierce it. Instead, cure it with what helps with the maturation until the acuteness of the symptoms ceases.
E lahoras cove que tu fassas cezer la femna sobre una cezelha que aia doas cezelhas; e recline sobre le sieu dos e ajusta les sieus pes a la partida pus dejos del ventre, e las sieus coyssas sian expandudas, e pausa les sieus brasses dejos les sieus denols, e lia quascus am liament ad aquo convenient.	And then it is necessary to place the woman on a pillow that has two pillows; and recline her on her side and adjust her legs below the navel, and her thighs should be spread apart, and place her arms below her kneecaps, and bind each with straps that are appropriate.
E aprop la matrona segua del latz dreyt e aministre le instrument am le qual es ubert le orrifici de la mayre, la forma del qual vindra en aquelas causas que·s faran aprop.	Then let the midwife follow with a lancet and administer the instrument with which to open the orifice of the breast, the form of which will come in those cases that will be made later.
E cove quan vols ministrar aquest instrument que tu fiques am lo ray le preon de la mayre de la femna, e aquo que del instrument es intrat en la mayre no sia mays que·l preon de la mayre e leda le malaute.	It is necessary when you want to administer this instrument that you insert it with the point of the breast of the woman, and that what enters the breast from the instrument not be larger than the point of the breast and harm the patient.
Mays si l’estrument es major que·l preon de la mayre, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils sobre la textura del preon de la mayre per sso que sia prohibit l’intrament de tot instrument en le preon de la mayre.	But if the instrument is larger than the point of the breast, then it is necessary to place powder on the surface of the point of the breast so that all entry of the instrument into the point of the breast is prevented.
E cove que tu pauses le vertitge que corr en le strument del latz pus desus e que le ministre tengua le strument e revolva le vertitge entro que sia ubert le orrifici de la mayre.	It is necessary to place the filings that come from the lancet's blade above and let the one who administers it hold the instrument and rotate the filings until the opening of the breast is made.
E cum appar la excitura, e es tocada am la ma e es leon e molh, lahoras cove que tu secces aquela deves le cap de lu am spatum lat.	And when the abscess appears and is touched by hand and is red and swollen, then it is necessary to dry that area around it with a linen cloth.
E cum la sania es evacuada, lahoras cove que tu pauses en la plagua una meca submersa en oli rozat o oli vert en le qual sia alcuna stiptisitat; e pausa la calca7 en la seccio en le preon de la mayre.	And when the pus has been evacuated, then it is necessary to place a wick submerged in scented oil or green oil, which has some stypticity, on the wound; and put a bandage on the incision in the point of the breast.
E pause deforo la mayre e sobre le pentenilh lana munda submersa en aygua en la qual sian bulidas malvas.	And place outside the breast and on the wound a clean wool compress soaked in water in which marigolds have been boiled.
E aprop sia curada aprop dos dias am enguent le qual conveneys ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then it should be cared for after two days with ointment, which is appropriate until it has healed.
E alcunas veguadas es lavada la mayre e la plagua enayssi que es cristerisat am aygua e mel, e aprop am aygua en la qual es bulhida razit de liri o de aristologia longua, e aprop retorna al enguent.	And some times the breast and wound are washed with water and honey, and sometimes with water in which rosemary or long-leafed Aristolochia has been boiled, and then return to the ointment.
E si la plagua es dedintz en la mayre ameguada, lahoras cove que tu sias prohibit de la curacio de lu am ferr, habantz cura aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio.	And if the wound is deep in the breast, then it is necessary to be cautious with the treatment of it by iron, instead caring for it as we have said in the division.
Capitol .lxxv.	Capital LXXV [Note: This is simply indicating the beginning of the seventy-fifth chapter or section of the medical treatise.]
A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	To teach midwives how fetal bodies are treated when they are born according to an unnatural shape.
Necessaria causa es que la matrona conogua en le comensament la figura del enfantament natural per senhals de lu, e es que quan tu vezas la femna expremar a las partidas dejos e desira odorar le ayre, e sobre aquo es enleujada per aquo que sobre ela es del part, e festina le eyssiment del enbrio, lahoras sapias que aquest part es segon figura natural, e es l’eyssiment de lu sobre le sieu cap, e la segondina am aquel o suspensa o pendent del ombelic.	It is necessary for the midwife to know in the beginning the shape of a normal childbirth by its signs, and that when you see the woman pushing from below and desires to smell fresh air, and is relieved because the delivery is coming, and she hastens the birth of the infant, then you will know that this birth is according to natural shape, and it occurs with the birth over its head, and the afterbirth attached or hanging from the umbilical cord. [**Note: This translation is based on my understanding of medieval medical texts and some knowledge in obstetrics, but I am not a doctor. Please consult modern medical texts for accurate information.**]
Donc cum tu vezes aquels senhals, lahoras cove que·l ventre de lu sia compremut per so que l’embrio deysenda leugerament quar quan deyssen sobre le sieu cap, deysen a lu la segondina, e es mondada de aquelas superfluitatz am bona mondificacio.	Therefore, when you see those signs, then it is necessary to press on the woman's abdomen gently so that the fetus descends slowly. For when it emerges over its head, give the afterbirth to the infant and clean it of superfluidities with good cleaning.
Mays aquel que es otra aquest part es no-natural e no-lausable, quar quan le enbrio es eyssit sobre sos pes e·l cos de lu es eyssit devant le cap de lu e·ls pes de lu, e la ma de lu una, o al pe de lu .i., o es eyssit le cap de lu e la ma de lu, o al ventre de lu, e fort leu es convertit sobre le sieu col, e semblant de las figuras de lu no-lausablas.	But if this is another type of birth that is unnatural and not desirable, for when the infant emerges on its feet and the body comes out in front of its head and one leg or foot is first. Or it emerges with the head and one arm or the belly, and it turns over quickly onto its neck, similar to the shape of undesirable forms.
Don necessaria causa es a la matrona que sia savia e subtil en totas aquelas causas, e que·s guarde de error e de decepcio.	Therefore, it is necessary for the midwife to be knowledgeable and skilled in all of these cases and that she protect herself from errors and deceptions.
E yeu so mostrant tota figura de aquelas, e qual engen es en aquelas per so que sia significat per aquo e sia stat sobre aquo.	And I have shown you the entire figure of those [cases], and what type of ingenuity is involved in each one, so that it may be understood and become clear to you.
Quan le feyt es eyssit sobre le sieu cap per egrecio natural, e aquel es vehement sobre la femna e es fayt a lu part dificil, e vezes la vertut de lu ja debelitada, lahoras fay aquela sezer , o que las femnas tenguan lu, e evapora le conh de lu am fenugrec coyt e am olis humitz.	When the baby emerges over its head through natural effort and is very heavy on the woman and makes delivery difficult, and sometimes its strength has already been weakened, then do this: make her lie down or have her hold it, and apply a poultice of fenugreek and warm oils to her stomach.
E aprop entrometa la metrona entre les sieus ditz espatum petit e fenda am aquel la segondina, o secce aquela am la sua ungla entro que corro aquo que es en ela de humiditat.	And then the midwife inserts her small spatula and splits open the afterbirth or cuts it with her fingernail until what is inside of it, which is wet, runs out.
E preme le ventre de la femna entro que deyssenda le fet.	And press on the woman's abdomen until the baby descends.
Mays si no deyssen, lahoras cove que la femna sia cristirizada de mucellage de ptilli e mucellage de fenugrec am cizami.	But if it does not descend, then it is necessary that the woman be fumigated with powdered myrtle and fenugreek with a cautery.
E aprop comanda a lu, aprop le cristeri, que sia compremuda e fay aquela stornudar am condisi; e te la boca de lu e·l nas de lu per huna hora, quar le fet sira foro-getat tantost.	And then order her to inhale the fumigation, and command that she be compressed, and make her sneeze with condiments; and cover her mouth and nose for an hour, because the baby will soon forget it.
E si las doas mas del fet so foro-getadas al comensament, lahoras cove que tu redusiscas aquelas am fecilitat petit a petit.	And if the two hands of the baby are forgotten at the beginning, then it is necessary to reduce those with ease gradually, little by little.
Mays si no obezeys al intrament, lahoras pausa la femna sobre una cezelha e leva les pes de lu sus, e aprop concuceys la cezelha sobre la terra; e la femna sia tenguda que no caia deves la concussio.	But if it does not obey the command, then place the woman on a pillow and lift her legs up, and then raise the pillow off the ground; and ensure that she remains stable during this motion.
E si las mas no son dedintz tornadas e morr le fet, lahoras inscideys aquelas e extratz le romament del fet o lia le cors a la ma de lu am drap e extratz aquel am equalitat, quar aquel sira foro-getat.	But if the limbs are not returned and the baby dies, then enter in and extract the contents of the baby or attach the corpse to the hand with a cloth and extract it equally, because it will soon be forgotten.
De eyssiment del embrio sobre les sieus pes.	About ensuring the well-being of the fetus's feet.
Quan le fet yeys sobre les sieus pes, lahoras cove que tu impelliscas aquels en sus, e aprop convertas le fet petit, e aprop que engualhes aquel, e aprop que prenguas un pe de lu e extendas aquels petit a petit.	When the fetus is lying on its feet, you should massage its legs and gently turn it over, bind its feet together, and then gradually stretch them out by taking hold of one foot at a time.
Mays cum son eyssit entro a las coyssas, lahoras tu comanda a lu que se exprema, e fay aquela extornudar am condizi, quar sira foro-getat si Deus lo vol.	But if it has already come out between the thighs, then you should instruct the woman to push, and make her sneeze with caution, as this could cause it to be expelled if God wills it.[Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ]
E si no es foro-getat am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras tu retorna le fet petit a petit entro que pauses aquel segon figura natural, quar aquel sira lahoras foro-getat am leugier eyssiment.	And if it is not expelled with the measures we have recommended, then you should gradually return the fetus to its original position and wait for labor to progress naturally, as it will likely be expelled with gentle effort.
E si es prohibit am tot aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras pren de musellage de altea e de goma dissolvuda, e percuteys tot en le mortier per bona percussio, e aprop linieys am aquo le conh de la femna, el pus bas del ventre de lu.	And if it is still not expelled despite everything we have recommended, then take some althea root and dissolved gum, grind them well in a mortar to make a paste, and apply it to the woman's perineum, near the bottom of her abdomen.
E aprop fay aquela cezer en aygua tebeza, entro que consegua les ypocondias.	And also perform a gentle cedar bath for her, until she feels relief in her hypochondria (the area just below the ribcage).
E cum vezes que las partidas dejos de lu so lenificadas, lahoras fay a lu subfumiguacio de mirta e sub-pausa aquela a lu.	And once her symptoms have subsided, give her a steaming bath of myrtle and allow her to rest in it.[Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ]
E quan te la sub-fumiguacio per una hora, lahoras tu la fay sezer sobre una cezelha, e aprop fay aquela stornudar e extrenh la boca de lu, e levas de aquela, e prem la partida pus bassa del ventre de lu am leugiera compressio, quar le fet sira tantost foro-getat.	After an hour of the steaming bath, have her sit on a stool and make her sneeze while covering her mouth, then gently press on the lowest part of her abdomen to help expel the fetus, as it is likely to come out soon.
Eyssiment del fet sobre les sieus denols e las suas mas.	Ensuring the safety of the fetus's arms and hands.
Quan le fet eyssira segon aquesta forma, lahoras tu engenies en entrometen las suas mas petit a petit; e aprop la femna stia evessada sobre le sieu col, e les pes de lu pengo en jos, e aquelas sia jasent sobre le lieyt, e complegua las suas mas.	When the fetus is born in this manner (with its arms and hands up), then you should carefully guide each limb out one at a time; have the woman sit upright with her back supported, legs dangling, and soles resting on the bed, and help bring down the baby's arms.
E aprop prem sobre le ventre de lu petit a petit, e aprop extratz aquo que es dejos les pes de lu de las aurelhas entro que sia preparada en la partida pus dejos.	And then gently press on the woman's abdomen to help guide the aftercoming head out of the birth canal once the rest of the baby is delivered.
E si le fet no es fora-getat, lahoras pren les pes de lu e mau aquels am movement vehement, e aprop prem aquo que es sobre les ypocondres petit a petit entro que le fet puege a las partidas desus.	If the baby is not yet born, then take hold of its legs and pull gently with forceful movements, gradually increasing pressure on the areas just above the hips until the baby comes out completely.
E aprop entrometa las suas mas e engualhe le fet petit a petit, e comanda a la femna que se exprema entro que le fet sia foro-getat.	Then guide the baby's arms and carefully wrap it in cloth while instructing the woman to push until the birth is complete.
Eyssiment del fet latutidinalment pendent una de las suas mas.	Ensuring the safety of a transverse presentation of the fetus, with one arm up.
Sia engeniat en reduccio de la ma de lu, mays si no podes aquela reduzir, lahoras eleva la femna e fe aquela anar.	The fetus should be repositioned to reduce the raised arm, but if that is not possible, then elevate the woman's hips and have her change position. [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ]
E si anar no pot, lahoras fay la jazer sobre le lieyt, e concuteys las coyssas de lu am concussio vehement, e aprop aministra liamentz les quals yeu e recomtatz de mucillages.	If changing position is not effective, then have the woman lie on her side and vigorously shake her hips to attempt to turn the fetus. Additionally, administer liquids and recommend mucilaginous foods to promote easy bowel movements.
E si es vengut le enfantament, lahoras fay aquela sezer sobre cezelha, e aprop studia sobre la reduccio de la ma, e enguala le fet segon figura natural, e fay stornudar la femna e comanda a lu que comprema a si entro que sia foro-getat.	Once labor has begun, have the woman sit on a stool and focus on reducing the raised arm. Then wrap the baby in cloth according to its natural position, make her sneeze and encourage her to push until delivery is complete.
Eyssiment del fet sobre·l col expandudas las suas mas e la fassia de lu es al dos de la sua mayre.	Ensuring the safety of a breech presentation of the fetus with extended arms and its back facing the mother's back. [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ]
Cove que la matrona tengua la ma del fet e aprop revolva aquel petit a petit, e eque aquel am facilitat.	The midwife should hold the baby's feet and gently rotate it little by little until it is in a better position for delivery.
E cum es e quant so es engualhat, e lahoras pausa sobre le conh de lu aquo que havem recomtat de oli e de mucellages.	Once the baby is positioned correctly and wrapped up, then place it on the woman's perineum as previously recommended with oil and mucilaginous substances.
E aprop comandas a lu que·s maugua petit a petit, e quan auras feyt aquo, lahoras fay aquela cezer sobre una cezelha e comanda li que sia inclinada sobre le latz dreyt, e aprop comanda a lu que sia compremuda; e fay aquela stornudar am condizi.	And then instruct the woman to push slowly and gradually, and once she has done so, place her in a steaming bath as previously recommended and have her lean back with support. Instruct her to sneeze with caution.[Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ]
Exitus foetus praeparati super latus.	The delivery of a prepared fetus on its side.
Quan deyssen a horrifici de la mayre segon aquesta manieyra, considera, e lahoras tu inscideys la segondina am la tua ungla entro que sia evacuada de la humiditat.	When the membranes are about to come out of the mother's vagina in this manner, observe and then gently insert your fingernail into the cervix until it is dilated and emptied of fluid.
E si le fet es suspendut sobre la cara e·l col de lu, lahoras tu inscideys aquela del embelic, per so que no sia retengut e mora.	If the fetus is stuck with its face and neck facing up, then gently insert your finger covered in emblic (a type of herb) to ensure it is not obstructed or delayed.
E aprop empelleys le fet a las partidas dedintz entro que pauses aquel segon que cove, e manda a la femna que comprema a si alcunas veguadas, e el sira fora-getat am eyssiment leugier, si Dieus o vol.	And then gently push the fetus towards the birth canal until it is in the correct position, and encourage the woman to push several times. If God wills it, the baby will be born with gentle effort.[Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ]
Exitus geminorum aut foetuum multorum.	The delivery of twins or multiple fetuses.
Sapias que gemels motas veguadas so natz, e alcunas vetz naysso tres o quatre , mays aquo es estranh e tart s’endeve; mays v so causas foro natura, e no vivo.	Be aware that often twins are born in multiple deliveries, and sometimes even three or four, but this is rare and usually happens due to natural causes, resulting in stillbirths.
E conte aquelas, ja sia que sian montiplicatz, una segondina, e son seperatz per ciphac, distingen aquels enter le liguament en l’ombilic de cascun de aquels E alcunas veguadas so foro-getatz ayssi cum es un fet per eyssiment natural leugier, e so eysitz alcunas veguadas per eyssiment no-lausabla ayssi cum havem recomtat.	Count the number of fetuses, whether multiple or not, as one cervix. Separate each one by using a doubled finger to distinguish them from the ligaments in their umbilical cord. Some may be born easily with gentle effort, while others require more difficult labor, as previously recommended. [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ]
E si son dificils alcus de lor deves le enfantament e perveno ad aquo que havem dit de las figuras no-naturals, lahoras tu cura aquels ayssi cum havem recontat.	If the delivery of twins or multiple fetuses is difficult and requires non-natural positions, then care for them as previously described.
E si’ la matrona subtil e fassa aquo que fa am facilitat e subtilitat, e am tarditat, e sia ingeniat segon tota figura segon que es a lu preparat de l’engen amenant a salut.	If the midwife is skilled and performs her duties with ease, subtlety, and patience, she should use all means necessary to ensure a safe delivery.[Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ]
Rememoratio eius quod formatur in matrice ex embrionibus et Abortiuntur.	A reminder that a fetus can be formed in the womb from multiple embryos and may be aborted.
Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis.	Some women have formed in the womb one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, and even ten fetuses, and now I can confirm that one woman aborts or gives birth to five fetuses, while another delivers ten, a difference caused by the measurement of the glorious wise ones.
E tot aysso cove que sia en la sciencia de la matrona quar fort leu ad aquela parve semblant de aquo, e donc opause se ad aquo am so que cove.	It is important for midwives to be knowledgeable about such cases, as they may encounter them and must act accordingly.[Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ]
Capitol .lxxvi.	Chapter seventy-six.
De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	On the extraction of a dead fetus.
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio.	When dealing with a stillborn fetus using the methods described in the division of medicine and it does not come out naturally, you may need to use manual extraction techniques. However, before doing so, consider whether the woman is healthy and free from any conditions that could put her life at risk during the procedure. [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ
