ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗʰ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] [Ⅰᶤˡʸ ᵗþ ᶜᵒ ᵈᶦᶜᵉ ᶜᵘᵖ-ˢ ˡᶦᶜʸ] ...]
Lahoras cove que la femna sia envessada sobre le lieyt sobre le sieu dos, e sia le cap de lu enclinat enjos e las coyssas de lu sian elevadas.	Now it is necessary that the woman be positioned lying on her side on the bed, with her head lowered and her buttocks raised.
E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	The assistant should hold her from both sides or be lying in the bed with her, so that her body does not extend during the delivery of the baby.
E aprop tu humecta la boca de la mayre de lu am olis humitz e am mucellage de altea e de fenugrec e de semensa de li.	And then you should moisten the mother's mouth with warm oil and marshmallow and fenugreek and linseed.
E aprop unte la matrona la sua ma am aquels olis e mucellages, e aprop entrometa la sua ma am fecilitat en la mayre, e aprop cerque am la ma loc en le qual fique les uncis en le fet.	And then anoint the midwife's hand with those oils and mucilages, and then insert her hand easily into the mother, and then search with your hand for the location where you can hook the fetus with your fingers.
E locs convenient en aquo: adonc tu considera si le fet es preparat que deysenda sobre le sieu cap, e lahoras tu fique les uncis en les huels de lu, o en le col, o en la boca, o en le palat, o dejos la barba, o en la furcula de lu, o en les locs propdas de las costas, o dejos les ypocondres.	And do this at the right spot: then you consider if the fetus is ready to come out by its head, and then hook it by the heels or the neck or the mouth or the palate or under the chin or on the shoulder blades or below the ribs.
Mays si le deysendiment es sobre les pes de lu, lahoras en le pentenilh, o en le mieg de las costas.	But if it is coming out by its feet, then hook it in the ankle or in the middle of the ribs.
E cove que tengua le unci am la ma dreyta, e pausa la curvitat de lu en aquel loc le qual es entre les ditz de la ma senestra, e entrometa la ma am facilitat e fique le unci en alcu de aquels locs les quals havem ditz, entro que pervengua a la causa boyda.	And it is necessary to bend the fingers of your right hand in a curve and place this curvature in the spot that is between the said fingers of your left hand, and then insert your hand easily and hook one of those spots I mentioned, until you reach the membrane.
E aprop pause e fique en la apposicio de lu un autre unci, o le tertz si es necessitat, per so que sia atraccio engual, e no sia extencio segon la sua rectetut tant solament.	And then place and insert another finger or the third one if necessary, in order to provide traction and not only extension according to its natural shape.
Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	But it should be done on all sides, in order for the extraction to be eased, just like it is done with a tooth during its extraction.
E cove en lu aquo que es entre lor que la extencio sia mollificada; e si alcuna partida de lu es retenguda, lahoras cove que la matrona unte alcus sieus ditz am oli e entrometa aquels espertament e revolva am aquels aquo que es retengut.	And it is necessary in this that the extension be softened; and if some part of it is retained, then the midwife should anoint her fingers with oil and insert them skillfully and rotate what is retained.
Donc si la partida del fet es fora-getada, lahoras les uncis sian permudatz entra loc le qual sia pus aut; e fay aysso entro que tot le fet sia fora-getat.	Therefore, if a part of the fetus is prolapsed, then the fingers should be inserted into another spot that is more accessible; and do this until the entire fetus is extracted.
Mays si la ma es eyssida denant l’autra, e no es possible reduzir aquela per la coartacio de lu, lahoras cove que drap sia envolopat sobre aquela; e aprop extratz aquela entro que tota sia fora-getada, e inscideys aquela o en la junctura de la ma o en le coyde.	But if one hand is in front of the other and it is not possible to reduce it due to its swelling, then a cloth should be wrapped around it; and then extract it until all of it is outside, and insert it into the wrist joint or the armpit.
E ayssi cove que fassas en l’autra ma e en les dos pes.	And you should do the same with the other hand and both feet.
Mays si le cap del fet es gran, o accideys a lu coartacio en le eyssiment, o es en le cap de lu aygua ajustada, lahoras cove que entrometa entre les ditz espatum spinos e fenda le cap e extragua la aygua, o que discroba aquel am un instrument le qual es nompnat “alundat”, la forma del qual vindra am las formas dels autres instruments en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	But if the fetus's head is large, or if it is swollen during delivery, or if there is water accumulated in its head, then you should insert your fingers between the said vertebrae and break open the head and extract the water, or you should make an incision with a tool called "alundat", whose form will be provided with the other tools in the chapter that comes next.
E semblantment fassa si·l fet es de gran cap per natura: e lahoras cove que inscida aquel am algematu, o que prengua aquel am alunda ayssi cum havem dit; e aprop extra les osses am les forceps.	And similarly do if the fetus has a large head naturally: and then insert it with forceps, or take it out with an "alundat" as we said before; and then extract the bones with forceps.
E si le cap es eyssit e es coartat deves la furcula, lahoras sia fendut entro que la humiditat la qual es en le pietz sia efunduda.	And if the head is out but stuck at the shoulders, then it should be broken open so that the fluid in the feet can be drained.
Mays si no es complicat, ni obezeys a eyssiment, lahoras tu inscideys le cap tantost segon que a tu sira possible.	But if it is not complicated or obstructed during delivery, then you should immediately insert your fingers into the head as much as possible.
E si le dejos del ventre es apostemat o es en lu ydropici, lahoras cove que tu perfores aquel entro que corro la humiditat que es en lu.	And if the left side of the abdomen is abscessed or hydropic, then you should pierce it in order to drain the fluid that is inside.
Mays si le fet es sobre les sieus pes, lahoras la atraccio de lu es leugiera e la direccio de lu a la boca de la mayre es leugiera.	But if the fetus is on its feet, then the traction of it is light and the direction to the mother's womb is easy.
Mays si es coartat deves le ventre e·l pietz, lahoras cove que tu extraguas aquel am drap le qual auras envolopat sobre la tua ma, e que fendes le ventre e·l pietz entro que corra aquo que es en aquels.	But if it is stuck between the belly and the feet, then you should extract it with a cloth that you have wrapped around your hand, and then break open the belly and the feet in order to drain what is inside.
Mays si les autres membres so ostatz e torna le cap, lahoras la metrona entrometa la ma senestra; mays si la boca de la mayre es huberta, lahoras intrometa la ma en le preon de layre, e cerque am aquela le cap, e atira aquel am les ditz entro a la boca de la mayre, e aprop entrometa en lu un unci, o dos uncis, e atire lu am aquels.	But if the other limbs are obstructed and the head turns back, then the midwife should insert her left hand; but if the mother's womb is opened, then she should insert her hand into the membrane and search for the head with it, and pull it towards the mother's womb using her fingers. Then she should insert one or two fingers into it and pull it with those.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas.	But if the mother's womb is obstructed by an abscess caused by a stone that forms in the uterus, then it should not be pressed on; instead, it is necessary to administer a flow of warm and fatty liquids.
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	And administer poultices; and follow the treatment with warm and moist baths.
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	And if the fetus is on its side, then if possible it should be turned over; and administer what we said in the case of a live fetus.
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	And if that is not possible, then insert your fingers into the vagina and extract it.
E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	And it is necessary that you do not leave any cause behind in the secondine (afterbirth).
E cum tu auras complida tota la tua opperacio, lahoras aministra aquo que havem dit de la curacio en les apostemas cautz les quals accideysso de la mayre.	And once you have completed your entire operation, then administer what we said about the treatment for abscesses that occur in the mother's uterus.
E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	And if there is a flow of blood, then immerse her in styptic waters and administer the other treatment.
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	And I have seen a woman in whose womb there was a dead fetus, and then another pregnancy occurred over it, and the second fetus was also dead.
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	It happened to a man that for a long time there was an abscess in his navel; and it became so swollen that it burst open, and he began to vomit bile.
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	And I was called upon to treat him, and I treated him for a long time, but the wound did not heal.
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	Then I applied strong-attraction plasters to him made of certain causes, and a bone came out of him, and after passing several days another bone came out; and I was greatly amazed that there could be bones in his belly.
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	And then I thought that they were bones from the dead fetus.
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	Then I explored the wound and extracted many bones from it, the woman being in her menstrual periods; and she lived for a long time afterwards, with only a small amount of bile coming up (vomiting).
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	And I did not think it strange, because in that there is knowledge and help for the physician who uses his hands to administer treatment.
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	The forms of the instruments that are necessary to extract the fetus.
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	The form of forceps with which the mother is opened.
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the form of "strenhedor" in which the loins are held, to which holding there are two forceps at the ends of two rods.
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	However, this forceps must be more subtle than the strictor, and it should be made of ivory or boxwood.
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	And the width of each rod is two fingers and the edge of each is one finger, and the length of each is a palm and a half; and in the middle of the two rods there are two fittings of that same rod which are already fastened, whose length is the majority of a palm and a little more, and the width of each is two fingers or slightly more.
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	And these two ingredients should be inserted in the mouth of the mother to keep it open when you turn the two prescribed screws.
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	Another similar form, but even more subtle and lighter:
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	Make it out of a wooden or boxwood handle, in the shape of forceps.
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	However, at the end of its two extensions, there should be as seen, and the length of these extensions should be about a palm's length, and the width of each one should be two fingers.
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	And when you want to use these to open the mouth of the patient, make her lean back on a bed with her legs hanging down and an opening between her thighs.
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	Then open your hand with the instrument as you would with forceps, according to how much of the opening of the patient's mouth you want to enter, until you achieve what you want.
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	The form of torture that the ancients called "vertigo":
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	A device for propelling or moving an object, which is used to move the abscess:
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	A device for containing or restraining, used to contain a large head:
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.	And it is made like forceps with teeth at the end, as seen, and sometimes it is made long like forceps of this type, as seen, with teeth like those of a saw, which are inserted and used to contain or restrain.
Forma de amesidat pauc:	A device for containing or supporting, in a small form:
Forma de unci havent una spina:	The form of a hook with a spine:
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	The form of a hook with two spines:
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	The form of forceps with iron teeth to contain or restrain the head of the abscess:
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	The form of a spatula with two ends, used to cut or remove the head:
Forma de dos espatums latz:	The form of two flat spatulas:
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	All of these instruments should be practiced with and once their species are multiplied and prepared by the craftsmen, they must be made as light as possible in their operation and as easy to use for people according to their size.
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	And you should not neglect using any of these instruments when it is necessary, because their necessity cannot be avoided.
De extraccio de la segondina.	On the extraction of the second teeth.
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the second tooth is impacted, you should command the patient to bite on their finger, and then make them sneeze with caution. Place your hand over their mouth and nose, and if it comes out as a result, that's good.
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	And if not, you should take a piece of cloth and make a hole in it, and place herbs that are soaked in the mouth of the mother, such as chamomile and rue and anise and camphor and Arabic gum and cinnamon bark and frankincense.
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	All of these herbs or some of them should be soaked in water in the cloth, and then placed over the fire.
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	Then place a reed cannula in the mouth of the mother, and keep it inside so that the vapor reaches the cavity of the mother.
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	Then make her sneeze as we mentioned before, and the second tooth will be extracted quickly.
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	But if this treatment is not successful and the tooth remains impacted, you should then command the midwife to submerge her left hand in olive oil or marshmallow mucilage, and then insert it into the cavity and near the second tooth, until she finds it. When she has found it, take hold of it gently, pulling it out little by little as directed, so that the mother does not feel pain from the violent attraction.
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	It is necessary that she be able to move her right and left sides with ease.
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	And it is necessary to adjust the amount of attraction, because she will obey and avoid adhesion.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	And if the mother's mouth is constricted, we have already recommended treatment with sneezing and herbal medicine applied with a cloth.
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	But if it is not extracted with all the causes we have recommended, you must be careful not to continue to extract from her in an iterative process of abstraction. Instead, what has come out of her should be brought to the thigh of the woman and covered with a mixture of egg white, honey, turpentine, and frankincense; because this will cause it to rot within a few days and dissolve and become extracted.
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	But when it is rotten, it causes great harm to the head and stomach of the patient, and this harms her. Therefore, it is necessary to administer sub-fumigations that are suitable for this.
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	But many of the Ancients used sub-fumigation with mustard seeds and dried figs.
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	The form of an instrument used for sub-fumigation of the woman to treat menstrual retention and impacted teeth:
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	It is made of iron or copper.
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	And the thin end should be placed in the cavity and the wide end over the fire, and the sub-fumigation should be directed towards the coals of the fire.
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	And keep that inside until the sub-fumigation is consumed, then repeat another one.
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	On the treatment of a non-perforated infant's buttocks.
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	The words of infants bite and their buttocks are not perforated, which appear thin and sunken.
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	Therefore, it is necessary for the midwife to pierce that sunken area with her finger; and if not, then pierce it with a sharp spatula, and make sure not to touch the vein.
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	And then place some wool soaked in wine and oil on it, and treat the area with an appropriate ointment until it is healed.
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	But if you are concerned that it may become sunken again, then place a reed in the hole for several days and remove it when the child no longer needs it.

De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	On the treatment of fistulas that form afterward.
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	Fistulas that form in the lower region are knotty and bulging, which form near or on the outside of the buttocks, in the area of one side.
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is a fistula or abscess.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	And when that knot becomes old and is filled with serous moisture or fine powder, sometimes such fistulas are found to have penetrated further.
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	And those that have penetrated further are known by what comes out of them through the opening and gas or wind; sometimes the patient uses the opening, and often it is easily expelled from the body.
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	And sometimes such fistulas have penetrated into the bladder and into the flesh of the penis, and sometimes they have penetrated into the joint of the thigh and into the bone marrow of the hip.
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	And the way to distinguish a penetrating fistula from a non-penetrating one is by inserting your finger into the anus and gently introducing a probe or piece of iron into the fistula, when there is no tortuousity.
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	But if there is tortuousity in that one, then gently introduce a thin piece of lead or horsehair into it until you feel the probe or hair with your finger.
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you do not feel any resistance or progress in the probe at all, due to any cause of discharge, such as pus, worms, or gas, then you know that it is non-penetrating, and so you should proceed with treatment.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula has penetrated into the bladder or the flesh of the penis, then its significance is the discharge of urine from that area and the prevention of it due to the location being treated with medicine.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	But if it has penetrated into the joint of the thigh or into the bone and causes pain in the area, then its sign is that the probe can enter easily into it without any curvature within the bone, and there will be pain in the region of that part; and it will always have pus coming out of it; and no medicine will work on it, nor will it heal with a plaster.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all cases of penetrating fistulas, there is no complete cure, and the treatment of such fistulas requires hard work and futility on the part of foolish physicians who persist in treating them.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But for those that are not penetrating and not old, cure with iron is hoped for, as I have recommended and proven to you.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And the patient should lie between your hands on their back, with their legs raised up and thighs inclined towards their belly, and then gently insert a probe or iron rod into the fistula until you can feel where it ends.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if you feel the patient's discomfort around their anus, then you should insert your finger into their anus.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel the probe with your finger already inserted as it penetrates on its own, or anything solid between your finger and the fistula opening, then you can be certain that it is a penetrating fistula. In this case, do not waste time trying to treat it, since it cannot be cured as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	However, they also mentioned ulcers that can heal in some men over time.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And the medication that is hoped to bring relief in it is that you ignite a thin cautery according to the size of the fistula, as previously mentioned, and insert the burning cautery into the fistula until it reaches around the anus; and then repeat this two or three times until you know that all the diseased flesh has been burned away and only healthy tissue remains, resembling a feather quill.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And treat that one with warm compresses wrapped in a cloth until all the burned flesh has been removed, and also treat it with medicines that promote tissue growth and consolidation. If it heals, then it is good; but if not, then it cannot be cured by any other means.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the probe enters but does not penetrate into your finger which is in the anus, and there is a thin layer of skin or membrane between them, and sometimes the fistula is dry on the surface of the coccyx, then dry out the coccyx from the beginning of the fistula with the probe, and you will see it drying as you proceed with the probe. The fistula should be kept open so that the drying reaches the location where the end of the probe is entering, and then it will be released and healed through the probe.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And keep clean the fistulated flesh which resembles the quill of a feather and do not leave any residue of it for any reason.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	But if bleeding occurs sometimes when you are operating on those tissues, then let it be and cauterize the pus with a light instrument using fire or acute medicine, because cautery with fire has two good habits: it burns the diseased flesh and removes excess blood through drying up the moisture.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And treat that one with warm compresses wrapped in a cloth or in a third case where the wound is discharging pus, and then treat the wound with hard flesh-generating and consolidating ointments.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And such medicines have astringent and drying properties; when this is achieved, the wound is healed and there is no fear of recurrence.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	But if the fistula has penetrated into the depth of the anus and is elongated from the surface of the body, then insert your finger into the anus and examine it with that.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And so if you feel that the probe is between a thin layer of membrane or skin and is close to penetration, then do not operate on it but instead rely on trust and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	The treatment for this can be administered in one of three ways: cauterizing the area as we have mentioned, drying it out until you achieve the concavity necessary to introduce remedies and promote healing, being careful not to cause too much dryness that could lead to injury to the muscle containing the coccyx and involuntary expulsion of pus, which would be detrimental to the patient. Another option is to lengthen the thin layer and clean out the pus inside by drying it out using a probe or other sharp instrument, and then cleaning the fistulated flesh in the section where you can perform a cruciate incision. Additionally, you can attempt to restore the entire wound with incisions, but if the orifice above is not consolidated and the fistula remains open in the area of the coccyx, it will be easier for the patient to experience further pus discharge.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes the fistula is finished in this way: when you insert the probe into the fistula, it is around the surface of the coccyx near the edge of the anus, and you take a probe with a perforated tip, similar to a needle used for preparing hearts in this shape:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert it into the cavity surrounded by five fields or around those, and then insert the probe with bile into the fistula until you achieve the concavity of it.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	But if it is penetrating into the edge of the anus close to the inside, then you should extract the bile from that tract, inserting your finger into the anus and pulling out the end of the bile until both ends are even, tightening each one, leaving it for a day or two. And when you reinsert the bile into the flesh, make sure to tighten it well so that the flesh between the two ends of the bile is cut, which will fall out.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And treat the wound until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	But if the opening of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it so by any means necessary, but without going too deep, as you do not want to injure the muscle. Once this is done, treat the wound until it heals.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of a pointed spatula that is used to split the fistula: the curvature of which is very sharp and the other side is not, so as not to injure what is not necessary, as sometimes happens.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	Of the suture of hemorrhoids in which blood runs in the incision of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are of two kinds: either they are inside the anus like charcoal, or those that resemble lumps of raisins.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And some are small and large, and blood constantly runs from them, they are one and many, they are outside the anus, and at their edges.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	However, those that protrude outside the anus are of two types, depending on the degree of moisture: one type constantly excretes yellow water or a small amount of blood with continuous flow, and it is of the same color as the body.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	The treatment for internal hemorrhoids is to instruct the patient to sit on a hard surface and express themselves until the anus relaxes and the hemorrhoids become visible to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then, you should prepare your instruments (such as forceps or suture needles) with hooks or attach them to your fingernail, and proceed to make an incision on the hemorrhoids along their ridges.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	However, if the forceps are not able to grasp the hemorrhoids due to their moisture and softness, then use a rough cloth or gauze or a piece of wool to dry and extract them with your fingers, and proceed to make an incision on them with sharp instruments, dusting some powdered medications onto the wound instead of cauterizing; or cauterize them as described in the chapter on cauterization.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then, treat the hemorrhoids with the other treatment until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	If the anus does not respond to evacuation, then administer an enema to the patient using a small bite stick and wash the anus with water from the anus that promotes gentle defecation when the patient strains.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	However, if the hemorrhoids are external and their cause is minor, then you can use your finger or forceps to grasp them, make an incision on them, and treat them with the other treatment until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And when making an incision, it is important to provide sutures as follows: take a ligature of gut and thread it through a needle, then grasp the hemorrhoids at their bases with forceps and pull them towards the wound edges, inserting the needle into the ridge on the opposite side. Next, wrap both ends of the ligature around the base of the hemorrhoid below the needle in a transverse manner, pulling it tight to constrict the hemorrhoid, and finally removing the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And do the same for all hemorrhoids, leaving one untied to allow excess blood to drain from it.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	Then place a cloth soaked in rose oil or wax on the anus, and apply it to the anus while instructing the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then leave it in place until the wound heals, and when it is healed, treat any remaining hemorrhoids with ointment or other treatments until they are fully healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	On the treatment of fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Many fissures occur due to injury from incisions or due to constriction of nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And if they are old and unresponsive to medical treatment, then it is necessary to cut the fissures using a scalpel or your fingernail until they become moist and the surrounding scab falls off, preventing consolidation; then continue treating them until they fully heal.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Now use as much force as is necessary to break up the pus and have the boil opened and drained, then cure the wound so that it heals.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	The treatment for abscess, the main point is:
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	Know that the formation of abscesses (almesamir) is common and it usually appears as a red swelling similar to the head of a clavicle, and they can form anywhere in the body but are more commonly found in the lower parts of the legs and feet. When dealing with such pain, treatment should be sought immediately.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	Then it is necessary to incise the area around the abscess and hold it open using forceps or hooks, and then remove the pus from the cavity, and finally cure the wound.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if desired, cauterize (the wound) as mentioned in the previous chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	A wart (veruca) is a small, rough, round, fistulated elevation on the surface of the body, and they are very common in children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	The treatment for warts is to either incise and cut it out, or apply a poultice of crushed garlic or animal fat on it until it falls off.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if desired, cauterize (the area) with fire or a caustic medicine, as mentioned earlier.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And inverted and non-inverted growths can be removed using the specified instrument (that I mentioned before).
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	A mole (formica) is a small, raised or fistulated, hard growth on the surface of the body that resembles a ant bite when touched, and it can be found anywhere on the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	The treatment for moles is to take a quill from a rooster or vulture feather, and make sure it is sturdy. Place the quill directly over the mole so that its circumference covers the entire growth. Then, rotate your hand around the quill while pressing down firmly, until you have incised the area around the mole. Next, press the quill into the flesh to remove the mole from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if desired, you can do this with an iron or steel quill/probe, in the following manner:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The upper part of the probe should be thin and blunt (non-sharpened), wrapped in a way that hides its sharp edges, allowing for a smooth glide over the skin with minimal resistance and without causing injury during rotation.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if desired, you can cauterize the mole as mentioned in the chapter on cautery for altheyl (athletes foot).
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	Here are some examples of medical instruments used in surgery:
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes surgery is performed using silver or lead or iron instruments, and sometimes other types of instruments are used depending on the procedure. The size of the instrument should be appropriate for the patient, especially when treating young children. Additionally, if the instrument has sharp edges or points, they should be small to minimize injury.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of large-scale surgery is as follows:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The top of the cannula should be wide enough to accommodate the attached pouch, and it should have a clear distinguishing mark where the pouch is attached.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the lower end of the probe, which enters into the wound, should be blunt and rounded, with a pointed tip that tapers gradually to a fine point. On one side of the probe, there should be two notches or indentations, and on the opposite side, there should be a single notch. The width of each notch should correspond to the thickness of the surrounding tissue, but they should be only slightly wider than the tip of the probe.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And the pouch that holds the medicines should be made from a bladder of an animal or sheepskin, and its size should be about the width of a handspan.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be pierced with many holes, as it is rolled up; and the spaces between the holes should be about the width of a finger.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	Then insert strong, raw garlic (made from ten cloves) or something similar into those holes and attach the pouch to it. When the pouch is placed on the wound, make sure it fits snugly around the top of the surgical instrument with strong compression, and cauterize each hole using that instrument. However, the method for cauterizing with that instrument is to fill the pouch with heated medicine according to the patient's tolerance, making sure it is not too hot or too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	Then have the patient lie down on their back with their legs elevated and place a heavy object, such as a stone or a large book, under their hips to keep them in that position. Apply oil, egg white, fenugreek mucilage or similar substances to the tip of the cautery instrument before inserting it gently into the wound. Have an assistant hold the pouch and squeeze it firmly with both hands to expel all the contents from the cannula into the intestines. After that, remove the cautery instrument and have the patient get up slowly while keeping their legs elevated.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces you to urinate, then do so as much as possible. If you can sleep with it for a whole night, it will be more beneficial.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you are using cauterization to treat abdominal ailments and the patient is experiencing frequent urination, then you should repeat the procedure until the wound heals.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if there are hemorrhoids or abscesses in the anus, then the cautery should be very fine and rounded like those used for treating children.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Treatment of wounds/sores.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	I have already mentioned in the classification of wound treatment what is necessary for this book, and now I will say how to treat wounds with my methods and medications according to their severity.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	I say that wounds are classified according to what causes them and where they are located on the body.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes by which wounds are often made include: striking with a stone, cutting with a sword or knife, piercing with a spear, stick, arrow, or similar objects from many other causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But wounds that occur in different parts of the body, such as a wound on the head, neck, chest, abdomen, groin, and similar areas on other limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	I am only recommending the treatment for some wounds as a guideline for treating other wounds.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	I will begin with simple wounds of the head, as the memory of compound wounds will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	I say that when a simple wound occurs on the head and it is not a fracture, then consider: if it was caused by striking with a stone or something similar, and the skull has only been cracked slightly and is a large wound, and you fear that an abscess may form in it, then you should quickly perform a venesection (phlebotomy) on the cephalic vein, and do not delay. And extract blood from the patient according to their vitality, but no more than necessary, especially if the blood that has come out of the wound is scanty.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And the venesection should be on the opposite side of the wound, and care must be taken to avoid overfilling (repletion), eating and drinking alcohol or heavy foods for the patient.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if there is any reason for caution due to the patient's weak condition, then their diet should be reduced and they should avoid eating meat or drinking alcohol.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And place a compress on the wound, if it happens to be an abscess, make a plaster infused with roasted oil or vinegar in which has been steeped a styptic.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if you are sure that the abscess has come to a head, then place a compress on the wound, if it is fresh and the discharge is still bloody, and sprinkle a little of the recommended powder on it once the air has not changed.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed, then apply some ointment until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the wound is large or deep due to a penetrating injury, and the lips of it are not properly approximated by pus, then approximate them with sutures as I have recommended in my instructions on suturing.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the wound has exposed bone and tendon, and is not retaining them but rather just a small piece of tissue, then cut it out and cure the wound with medicines and restore the flesh in place of that which is missing, and instruct the patient to abstain from foods that cause gas such as beans, cabbage, and similar foods until it has healed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find necrotic tissue in the wound that is not adhering to the bone, then cut it all out and remove it, and then cure the wound.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which blood can flow and it has not been cut by medicines, then search for the artery and if you find it uncut, then cut it with a scalpel or tie it off; and if the situation requires that what I have said does not work, then cauterize it until the blood flow is stopped.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is light, in which case you should powder over them this powder before the air changes, so that it consolidates before the air changes.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the method of the powder is as follows: take one part oil of lilies, two parts dragon's blood, and three parts unburnt alum; grind all of it to a very fine powder, and fill the wound with it, then constrict it well with a bandage until it adheres to it, and allow it to be coagulated by the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then strengthen it above with bandages and leave it alone, do not unbind it while it is not yet abscessed, because the medicine is not rendered ineffective until it has healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes do this alone with just oil of lilies when you do not have rose oil and dragon's blood available.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And perform this method of operation on large wounds when it is appropriate to place it over them and have them be tight, and on fresh wounds with their own blood that the air has not yet altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, especially in summertime, then do not attempt to use this powder, but rather cure them with what I have said, that is to say apply suitable ointments to them or place a poultice of barley flour with water and honey until it becomes putrid; and then cure them with the other treatment until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if a fracture occurs in the bone and it is small, then extract it with gentle force.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	I say the cure for fractures of the skull is what is deadly poisonous.
De las plaguas del col.	Of wounds to the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the wound occurs on the neck, then it is not different in treatment, and is similar to a simple wound of the head.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves or artery of the neck are cut, then if it is nerves, do not apply treatment that causes strong stypticity to them, such as zinc and copper which are verdigris and similar things because it will cause damage to the nerves and contract them.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not place any cause on the wound that is cold, because the substance of nerves is cold and its connection is with the brain, which is the source of all members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is treated with light medicines, such as washing the wound with warm water, sometimes infused in roasted or unroasted oil, and turpentine when it is washed with warm water and other similar remedies, and warm ointments.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the wound is large, then administer sutures or bring together the edges of it, and then cure it with bandages until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the wound is deep or there is putrid matter in the lower part of it, then pierce it in the most depressed location.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if an artery has been cut in the wound and blood flow has occurred, then separate or dry it out, or tie it off, or cauterize it if necessary.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the vertebrae of the neck have been cut and are saved, and the veins of the neck are intact, then bring together the edges of the wound with sutures on the ridge of the spine and do not touch it; lift it evenly and return it to its natural shape, and strengthen it with a suitable support, and leave it alone for several days; and then cure it with ointments that have stypticity and stimulation until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the wound has damaged the bone, then percuss it, and if there are fragments of bone in it, remove all that you can; and what is not removable, leave it alone until the wound heals and becomes less painful, and allow it to separate and the pressure on it is relieved.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the wound is recent, then powder it with the recommended powder.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	If a fistula is formed in the wound, then cure it with the method that will be described in its own chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	As for wounds of the neck or similar ones that are made between the shoulders by a sword or knife or spear or similar (objects).
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If the wound is caused by a lance or knife, and its depth is visible, then consider whether the wound is emitting foul-smelling breath; if so, know that the wound is deadly.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if the wound is not deep and it is fresh with its own blood, then you should place powder on it in the first hour, but do not press hard to prevent the blood from being retained in the depth of the wound and returning to the heart and making the patient worse. Instead, put a attractive ointment on it and loosen the two veins twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the ointment is not available, then you should cover the opening of the wound with wool to absorb any discharge from the humors; and make sure that the patient rests on the wound so that any accumulated fluid in it can drain out.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if three days or more have passed since the wound and the patient has not experienced convulsions, tremors of the heart, fainting spells, or other bad signs, then know that the wound is healing; and in that case, treat it with cupping glasses and other remedies until it is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if healing is delayed and the wound remains open at all times, then know that a fistula has formed; treat it with the method described in its own chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	If the wound is caused by a sword or knife and is simple on the surface of the arm or back, then treat it with stitches if it is large, or with powder if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if pus has already formed in the bone and you see that it is coming out of it, then turn the wound and try to extract those pieces, if they are separate (from the bone).
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separate, then leave them alone and allow the wound to heal, as extracting them will be easier once it has healed.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other wounds that occur on other parts of the body, the treatment in healing is the same as what has been said (before).
De las plaguas del ventre.	On wounds of the abdomen.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition that occurs in the abdomen is either great, small, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	When the indisposition in the abdomen is great, some of the intestines or nerves of the intestines may protrude, causing a need for more forceful and subtle suturing to take place.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	A small disruption is made difficult to correct in any other way; and I know that returning the protrusion to its proper place is more difficult if you do not attend to it immediately, as it quickly swells and becomes engorged, making it difficult to return it to its proper location.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore a moderate disruption is the best, as it is not difficult to return the intestine to its proper place in this case, unlike the two previous types of disruptions that are more difficult to correct.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that there are four ways to suture the abdomen, but two of them are common and similar to the suturing methods used for other wounds on the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other types of sutures are specific to abdominal wounds, but they are still used in the suturing of other wounds on the body as well.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	I recommend that you learn each one with its explanation and description.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	I say that when the wound is small and some part of the intestine protrudes from it, making it difficult to return it to its proper place, then it is in one of two conditions: either the disruption is small, as previously mentioned, or the intestine has become inflamed due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when this is the case, it is necessary to make an incision in that part and submerge a sponge or cloth soaked in warm water alone, or in a mixture of wine, cinquefoil, and pepper, and insert it into the intestine until the inflammation subsides.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes it is necessary to use a styptic in this process, as warm water alone may not be sufficient to resolve the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And once you have seen that the inflammation has subsided, then you should moisten the intestine with water that contains mallow and marshmallow, as this will alleviate the difficulty of returning it to its proper place with minimal effort.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if it is not necessary to return the intestine to its proper place, then you should make an incision along the disruption using a small instrument suitable for cutting hemorrhoids.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the primary treatment is best when it involves making an incision that does not extend too deep and does not cause unnecessary bleeding or weakening of the area.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Regarding the instrument, know its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	The instrument has one curved and sharp end, and the other end is not sharp; its tip should be fine but not as thin as a spatula, and it should be slightly blunt at the end.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the wound is large and part of the intestine protrudes from it, then it is necessary to return it to its proper place in its natural shape, if possible in its original location, as this is best.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the disruption is large and located in the lower part of the abdomen, then it is necessary for the patient to lie on their back with their hips raised higher than their head; and if it is located in the upper part of the abdomen, then you should place the patient's head and chest higher than their hips.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly, if the disruption is on either side of the abdomen, then you should always keep your attention and focus on that side so that the higher part of the abdomen can be used to return the intestine to its proper place.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And it is also necessary to use this method for both large and moderate wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And for small wounds, use whatever method you have prepared and make sure that the person assisting you holds the disruption open with their hand while adjusting its lips, revealing any other area that may require suturing.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	This is the common method of suturing: take a needle or a threaded needle according to the size of the wound; then place it at the edge of the disruption on your ring finger and tighten the needle once without piercing both ends of the thread with the needle, so that you can insert the two ends of the thread into the inner parts of the wound. Then you have connected the two ends of the thread to the two ends of the needle, and this has been done four times. [Note: There is a mistake in the original text, as it says "entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida" which means "until you make it penetrate that part", but it should say "entro que fassas aquela penetrar en aquella partida" which means "until you make it penetrate into that part".]
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then tighten the needle with double thread, and sometimes two parts at once, and then bring together the lips of the wound with proper alignment; and then leave space for your finger and insert another needle into it, and tie that needle with thread as you did with the first needle, and do not stop doing this with the needles until you have completed suturing the entire wound.
