E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be of moderate thickness between fine and thick, as very thin needles easily cut through the flesh and very thick ones are difficult to insert into the thread, so it is necessary for them to be moderate in terms of fineness and thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not necessary for the needle to be inserted too deeply into both ends of the thread, as this may cause the flesh to be cut slightly and the wound to open up before it has healed properly.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not use prolonged stitches in suturing, as this may prevent the wound from healing properly.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then blunt the ends of the needles so that they do not poke the patient while they sleep, and place powder around the sutures on all sides to keep the needle ends in place; leave them there until you are sure that the wound has healed properly.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this type of suturing with needles is more suitable for small wounds, as it only requires one or two stitches or around that amount.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	The second common method of suturing is to use a threaded needle to connect all four ends (the two ends of the thread and the two ends of the wound) in one go, with a needle that has fine and thick thread wrapped around it.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And when you have penetrated these four ends with the needle, return it to its starting point by withdrawing it from that deeper part of the wound, causing the thread to retract and rise up to the surface of the wound, similar to how fabric is sewn together with a stitch that holds it in place.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And leave a space between each stitch equal to the width of your smallest finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	This method is common among men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	I used this method to suture a wound on a man's abdomen, which he had received from being stabbed with a knife; the disruption of the wound was larger than a palm in size, and part of the intestines had protruded about two palms' width from the middle location of the intestine; the disruption was located in the middle of the abdomen. I returned his intestines to their proper place after they had been outside the wound for twenty-four hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	The wound healed within fifteen days or so, and I cured him and he recovered; and as far as I know, he lived for many years and continued to live his life in good health.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And other doctors had judged that he would not recover; it was a miracle that I cured him without using ointment, as there was no ointment or any medicine available in that location, but I applied clean cloths to the wound twice a day and bathed it regularly with honey water until it healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I will now describe two other types of suturing, as told in the book "Paraula".
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	The first type involves starting with the thread and inserting the needle from the outer part of the wound to the inner part.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And when the needle penetrates into the thread and into the deeper layer of flesh in a straight line and to the full length of the body, leave the end of the thread attached to the needle; then insert the needle from the inner part of the wound to the outer part at the other end of the incision. [Note: There is an error in the original text as it says "e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat" which means "and make it penetrate into the other end", but it should say "e aprop fay que la agulha penetre en la autra extremitat" which means "and then insert the needle into the other end".]
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And when you have inserted the needle in this manner, then insert it again into the same outer end of the incision, going from the outer part to the inner part; leave the end of the thread that is on this side and insert the needle into the other end of the deeper layer, going from the inner part to the outer part. [Note: There is a mistake in the original text as it says "e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz" which means "and leave the end of the thread that is on this side", but it should say "e leyssa la extremita del ciphac que es en aquel latz" which means "and leave the end of the thread that is on that side".]
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And then insert the needle again in the same manner, going from the outer part to the inner part of the wound, until it fully penetrates into the deeper layer. [Note: There is an error in the original text as it says "e fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio" which means "and make your insertion penetrate with that one", but it should say "e aprop fay que la agulha penetre am aquela la tua penetracio" which means "and then insert the needle again in the same manner as before".]
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then start from this same side and suture the outer end of the thread to the inner end on the other side, withdrawing the needle that was inserted; return it to its original position in the thread and suture the outer end of the thread to the inner end on the other side using the other needle. [Note: There is an error in the original text as it says "e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat" which means "and suture the outer end of the thread to the inner end on the other side with this same incision", but it should say "e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra latz am aquesta extramitat de la codena" which means "and suture the outer end of the thread to the inner end on the other side using this needle".] [Here is a diagram illustrating this type of suturing:
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do this once and another, and do this again and again until you heal everything that is outside based on that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this method of suturing is that you sew with suture of animal intestines, in such a way that you sew the skin, so that you sew the incision once from the side of the end of the arm, and leave the other part open until you have completed it.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second type of suturing, which I just now called "Galician," is as its name suggests and is done in this way: you sew that seam with the ligament, in such a way that the medicines heal that, connecting all parts to their corresponding part, naturally; and they apply one end of it and the other end of it to the other end of it, and this is done as I have told you.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	It is necessary that you insert the needle in the outside end of the wound, at your own side, and make it penetrate into the inside part of it in the same hole, and leave two ends of the ligament; and then turn the needle around and make it penetrate from the outside to the inside in the other two ends of the ligament.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then turn those knots and make each of them penetrate from the inside to the outside in the other two ends of the wound that are on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this method of suturing is better than the common light suturing, and it is the suturing of which I spoke earlier.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the meaning of "Galician" (the name given to the second type of suturing)
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And yet they called it "suture of the belly," which is corrected with two needles, that is, you insert in each one a filament, and begin with the insertion of needle from your side, and make it penetrate to the other side as in the suturing of those who cure equally.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when there is a rupture in the middle part of the belly, then the suture of it is more difficult than in other parts of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the remedy for this disease is a judgment for other diseases.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	This is because when you find the disease (plague) in its early stages with its own blood before it is altered by air, and you reduce the intestines and sew the wound and treat it appropriately, then place a powder for healing on top of it.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the disease, then place on top of it these powders that I have in my presence until they turn into hard flesh and push out the pus, and solidify the wound and incision; and treat it like this just as you would treat other diseases until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you are not present with the medicine, then place on it immediately, as soon as it begins to ooze pus, old skin, and change every two days, just as I have taught you, until it is healed, because in simple cases like this you will not need any other medication.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the disease may spread and cause injury to the main limbs, then it is necessary to soak a lion's wool in high-quality bath oil or rose oil, and place it on the affected area between the armpits and lower elbows.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if there is pain or putrefaction in the intestines, because it often happens that this occurs, then use a mixture of vinegar and black stiptic wax, especially if the pus has reached the intestine and caused an opening that penetrates into its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that infection in the large intestine heals more easily than infection in the small intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the intestine called "gunnu" does not receive healing from an infection that occurs in it entirely; this is due to the large number of veins in it and its size, as well as the delicate nature of its structure and its proximity to nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if what is produced by the disease is tissue, and you find it recently, reduce it according to your expertise as you would with intestines.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has already spread and turned green or black, then you should strengthen it with a filament over the discolored area, so that blood flows from it, because there are veins and arteries in tissue.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	And then insert what is other than the ligament and place both ends of the filament below the outside part of the wound, so that it is relieved of the attraction to it from the skin tension and emission of the arm of the wound.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Recollection of diseases when they occur in the intestines.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When there is a rupture in the intestines and it is small, then it may be possible to restore it in some patients, because I have seen someone who was wounded in the stomach with a lance and had a wound on the right side of the stomach. The wound was old and had become a fistula, causing excretion and flatulence.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Therefore I continued the treatment of it, knowing that it was not possible to heal it completely, but rather to reduce its severity and promote healing in the affected area until it was consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And I, having seen that the area was consolidated, feared for the patient that they might experience another injury to their stomach, but they did not suffer any harm and continued with their daily habits of eating and drinking, and even bathed and exercised as usual.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced practitioners have said that when a wound occurs in the intestines and it is small, then it is necessary to bind it in this way: take large-headed garlic cloves; and then bring together the two lips of the wound and place one clove of those with the mouth open on top of the two lips of the wound. When you press down on that and strengthen its mouth, cut off its head because it adheres and does not dissolve.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	And then place another garlic clove next to the first one, and do not stop doing this with garlic cloves one after the other according to the length of the entire wound.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	And then reduce it and sew the wound; and leave those attached heads in the intestines until the intestine heals; and do not harm the patient in any way.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible to bind the intestines with thin filament made from animal gut, which is done by sewing it into the intestine. To do this, take the end of this fine thread and strip off its flesh, then tie it to the end of the filament and wrap it around. Then insert the filament through a needle and sew it into the intestine, reducing the rupture as you go.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this method of binding with garlic is only done by trust and hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	But if the wound is large and wide, especially if it is in one of the small intestines, then it is not a matter of binding but rather of reducing its severity, and not completely healing it.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	On the treatment of abscesses and fistulas.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that every wound and abscess that becomes inflamed and old, and turns into an ulcer, which is not consolidated and excretes constantly without being cut off, then regardless of where it is located, it is universally called a fistula and we call it "azukem".
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And in truth, fistula is a hardened nodule, white and painless, with a hollow cavity just like the cavity of a bird's feather. Because of this, it is called "alcus rizatus," that is, "feathered wound."
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And it is in some people moist, which excretes constantly; and soon the moisture is cut off in some hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this moisture is abundant, and sometimes it is scarce, and sometimes it is thick, and sometimes it is thin.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.
