Then open the skin with hooks and scrape out the vein from all sides until you can feel it in your sense of touch, and this should be done until the appearance of the vein turns dark, indicating that it has been completely removed.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And when you remove it (the vein) from the skin, you will see a white band which is the cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Then place the ligature below the vein to lift it up and keep it separated from the skin, and suspend it with a golden ounce weight.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	Then dry another section above the vein and scrape the skin there until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then lift that (part) and make an incision in the back of the heel, and then extract that and lift it so that it comes out through the second section, and then extract that from the section that is above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Do this until you extract it from the highest or deepest section of all the sections, so that it is completely removed; and then make an incision there.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if it does not obey in being extracted and lifted, then insert a needle with strong double gall and tie it there and extract it, or insert it below the root and rotate your hand around until it is removed.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful not to cut it; because if it is broken, it becomes difficult for you to lift it and it will harm the patient through that injury.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when all of it has been completely removed, then place a woolen cloth soaked in wine and roasted oil and unroasted oil on the wound and cure it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vein is contracted with twists and turns which envelop its parts, and it is not straight as we have said, then you must make an incision on all the twists of it and on the enveloping areas, and then suspend it with hooks until you lift it completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful not to cut your section and not to injure the vein, because it will be difficult for you to lift it; and use your prudence in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Shape of the incision made on the cut vein:
Forma de unci orp:	Shape of hooks:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not as sharp as hooks and does not have a pointed tip so that it does not injure the vein; and it is of thick flexibility, because if it were thin, it would cut the vein with its thinness; it has excessive thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	On the extraction of a leg vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in hot lands, such as Al-Ategi in the land of Arabs and in the lands of India, which are hot and dry with little vegetation and where there is no grass or herbs.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is easily generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the generation of it is due to putrefaction that comes from below the kidney, just as venom comes out of serpents and worms and scarids and worms that are generated between the kidney and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of its conception and appearance is that this vein becomes inflamed in the leg, with intense heat; and then a swelling appears on the spot; and soon after the vein begins to emerge from the area of that swelling which looks like a plant root.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when the limb appears, then it is necessary to wrap around that a lead weight of one or two drachmas, and tie it there, leaving the lead suspended from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as some cause comes out of it to its parts outside, wrap that in lead and bind it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it becomes too long, then you incise a part of it and wrap the remaining part; and do not cut it at the root until it has come out, because if you cut it there, it will contract and enter the flesh, causing an abscess and inflammation in the area, as well as an ulcer.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Therefore, it is necessary to treat it gently and extract it slowly, until it has been completely removed from the end of it, so that no part of it remains in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And this vein comes out in some men that is of five palms in length and it has reached me that one has come out of twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is cut during its treatment, then insert the root into the hole of it and pierce it with a long probe in the body, until all of it has been evacuated from the matter, and administer putrefaction to the area for several days with medicines; and soon cure it through the treatment of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has many branches and it is more common when it appears at the ankle joint or in the foot, and many wounds come to it, and each wound has a branch.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore cure it as we have said in the division and with what is said above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	On the incision of worms generated under the skin, called "bovine disease".
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This illness is called "bovine disease" in some lands because it often affects cattle and is a worm that is born between the kidney and the flesh, and it travels through the whole body going up and down, and it is noticeable by its movement from one part of the body to another until it breaks the kidney and emerges.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is due to the putrefaction of some humors, just like the worms and snakes and earthworms and ascariasis that are generated in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared for its malice, because when it travels through the body and rises to the head, and reaches the brain, then it quickly enters and destroys the brain, and this happens often.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And so when you want to cure it and extract it, then you must wait for its movement and appearance to the feeling, and then you should strengthen what is above it and what is below it with gentle pressure and strong constriction, and soon dry it out and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is embedded in the flesh and you cannot find it, then you should place a cautery with fire on the area until it dies, because the most feared thing is its corruption which corrupts the area as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	But if you see that it has reached the head near the brain, then strengthen above the eyebrow with strong constriction, and soon dry it out and extract it; and the patient must use purification of their body with medicines that evacuate bad humors, and avoid foods that generate putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On the incision of "nafir" disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This illness is called "nafir" in our land, it is pain which appears in some members and moves from one member to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	I have seen that as I will tell you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to a sick woman in a village, and I uncovered her arm and saw a small inflammation on the saphenous vein of the arm, and after an hour had passed, I saw that inflammation move like a worm crawling upwards, but more slowly than it would be if it were alive, similar to silver flowing from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then the pain moves to that place and settles in the muscle, and therefore stay here for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then heal the other body until it reaches the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then he told me to turn around and let him examine my whole body as he saw fit; it was quite remarkable the transformation in him and the speed with which he moved from one member to the next.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen before in my own heels in that manner, but I have also seen many [people] who experience pain being transferred from one member to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see that with the heels in the same way as in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think it was that, but rather because the woman was old, and had dry skin and visible veins, and in this case it appeared to be the sensation of gas being transferred.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that this reverse treatment not appear in those who are delicate and have warm bodies with narrow veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you want to treat the patient and they feel the pain, then do not appear to them as we have said, but rather strengthen yourself over that area and lightly press down on it, and cauterize the spot where the trapped gas is released.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it with your own eyes, then treat it with a laxative of the body and with that which expels gas, and singe those areas with stinking pills and Serapian pills and similar ones.
De extraccio de sagetas.	On the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diverse in terms of their species and the locations on the body where they become lodged, for their diversity consists of those with large tips, small ones, concave ones, blunt ones, and sharp ones; and of those with three points, and those that have tongues; and of those that have feathers.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and the parts of the body where it becomes lodged is according to two manners: for the members are either principal causes, such as the brain, the heart, the liver, the lungs, the kidneys, the intestines, the bladder, and their like; and therefore when an arrow catches in one of these members and you see signs of death in it, which I will recount below, then it is appropriate to avoid extracting that arrow from those where death is already present in them. And when you do not see such signs, and the arrow is not hidden deep within the member, then you should extract it and cure the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the signs of death is when an arrow catches in it and passes through bone, and exits the skull which is above the brain, for this causes sudden violence, loss of vision, vertigo, numbness in the feet, inflammation and numbness of the tongue, spasms and confusion of thought, vomiting of bile, and quickly the voice becomes hoarse and words are difficult to articulate, and white fluid like dust is emitted from the wound, and there is a similar discharge of liquid from the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore if you see these signs, then you should refrain from treating or extracting the arrow, unless it is necessary to do so.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of an arrow that catches in the heart, when it is close to the left breast, and feels as if it is embedded in a hard cause, and is not visible; and quickly the movement of the arrow resembles the pulse, and there is dark blood flowing from the wound, and the extremities become cold, and there is chills and fainting; and therefore know that death approaches swiftly.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when an arrow has wounded a lung are foamy blood flowing from the wound, and swelling near the neck, and the patient's complexion changes, and they exhale great amounts of air and ask for fresh air to be brought.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if an arrow catches in the fascia that is in the feet, then the pain becomes located near the small ribs, and a great and intense pain occurs with deep breathing and sighing, and not all of the limbs' muscles are affected.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if an arrow catches in the stomach, then quickly there is discharge from the wound of undigested food.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if an arrow catches in the belly and is embedded in it, there will be a tear or rent in the wound or membrane or intestine that has been ruptured, and there is no hope for the cure of the patient through the extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow catches in the bladder and urine flows from it, and there is some cause that comes out of it externally, and quickly there is pain over the patient, then know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	But the other members such as the face, neck, and shoulders, the shoulder blades, the vertebrae of the back, the collarbone, the hip, the thigh, and similar parts of the limbs are saved according to the greater circumstances when the arrow does not strike a vein or artery and is not poisonous.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I advise you of what I have seen regarding the nature of these arrows so that you may understand it in terms of light treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is that a arrow has lodged in the lacrimal gland of his eye near the nose root, and was extracted from him from the other side, below the ear's lobe, and he was healed, and no harm came to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And extracted another arrow from a man who had it lodged in his eye near the eyelid, below the lower eyelid, and the arrow was concealed and could not be seen except for a small extremity adhered to its shaft, and it was a large arrow of sharp arrows of the Turks, with a lion's iron without ears.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Senator was not harmed in his eye by this incident.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And extracted another arrow from a Christian man which had fallen into his throat and was an Arabic arrow with ears; and then he inserted his fingers on both sides of it, as it was already submerged in the man's throat; and then he gently removed it and the Christian man was healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And extracted another arrow from a man which had fallen into his belly, and he thought that he would die because of it; and so, after 30 days had passed without any cause for concern regarding the man's condition, he inserted his fingers around the arrow and pulled it out gently, and the man was healed, and no harm came to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow fell at his backside, and the wound became infected, but after seven days the arrow came out through his thigh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman in whom an arrow had fallen into her belly, and the wound became infected inside of her, but it did not affect her condition or any of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow had fallen on his face and the wound became infected, but the arrowhead was broken off, yet he felt no significant pain, similar to these cases.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And extracted the arrow from the man of the king's nobles who had it fall in the middle of his nose and it had slightly turned to the right side, and the entire arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called upon for the treatment of this injury within three days of the arrow's lodging.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I examined the wound caused by the arrow and found it to be very tight; I then gently probed with a slender instrument but did not feel anything, yet he felt a pricking sensation below his right earlobe, leading me to suspect that this was due to the arrowhead's extremity.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	I applied a plaster with attracting and digestive properties to the area, trusting that an abscess would form there which would bring the location of the arrowhead to my attention, allowing me to dry it out.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And no significant harm occurred in the location where the arrow had been, and I continued to apply the plaster for many days without incident; meanwhile, the wound healed, and the patient felt better after several days until one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and reported this to me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	I then applied a sharp and corrosive medicine to the wound for several days until it became open, and with gentle probing, I found the arrowhead's subtle extremity which was adhered to its shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	I continued to apply the sharp medicine to the wound until the arrowhead became visible, and I spent several months doing so.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And as the wound grew larger, I was able to introduce forceps into it and extract the arrowhead. However, it did not come out easily, so I continued to gently manipulate and try various techniques until one day I managed to extract it with a pair of specially designed forceps, which will be described later in this text. Afterwards, I treated the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some physicians believed that the cartilage of the nose could not be restored, but I was able to heal and restore it, and the wound healed completely without any negative effects on the patient's health.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I tell you about the method of extracting certain arrows as a rule and significance for what I have not said, because the parts of this art and definitions of it are not understood through narration or encompassed by this book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And wise craftsmen compare little to much, and what is present to what is absent, and find new operations and new instruments for strange causes in the case of accidents.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And so I say that arrows are not easily removed from the limbs in which they are embedded, but rather in two ways: either by attraction to the location where it has entered, or by force from the opposite side.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And when an arrow is drawn out of the location where it entered, or if it is a blunt arrow that has lodged in a fleshy part, it can be easily extracted.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if it does not come out easily at the time it entered, then you must leave it alone for a few days until the surrounding flesh softens and the attraction of it is relieved, making its removal easier.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	Similarly, if an arrow is embedded in bone and does not come out easily, then you must leave it alone for a few days and use attraction and movement on it every day until it comes loose.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it still does not come out after several days, then you must drill around the arrow in the bone from all sides with a fine tool until the wound is enlarged and you can extract the arrow.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if an arrow is embedded in the skull bone and has entered one of the ventricles of the brain, and the patient shows signs of those symptoms I mentioned earlier, then you must not attempt to extract the arrow and should leave it alone for several days until their condition stabilizes; because if the arrow reaches the cyphecum (a part of the brain), death can be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is only lodged in the outer layer of the bone and does not enter the cyphecum, and the patient remains stable for several days without any symptoms, then you can attempt to extract the arrow by using attraction techniques.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if the arrow is deeply embedded and does not come out easily despite your efforts, then you can drill around it with fine tools as I mentioned earlier, and take care of the wound until it heals.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow is hidden within the body and not easily felt, then you should gently probe with an instrument suitable for extracting it. If you can feel it, then you should use appropriate instruments to attract and remove it.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	But if the wound is too tight and deep to extract the arrow due to its length, and there are no bones, nerves, or veins in the way, then you should widen the wound until it's possible to safely remove the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	But if the arrowhead is still attached and embedded in flesh, then you must carefully separate the surrounding tissue from it as much as possible. If you cannot remove the arrow by pulling it out directly, consider breaking the arrowhead off or twisting it until it comes loose.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when extracting an arrow from any location, you should use twisting motions with your hand and forceps in all directions until it begins to come loose. Use subtlety to avoid breaking the arrowhead and make the removal as easy as possible.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	But if you are unable to extract the arrow at that time, then you should wait for several days until the surrounding tissue softens and becomes easier to manipulate before attempting again.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if extracting the arrow causes bleeding, then follow the instructions for managing bleeding as outlined in that section of this text.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And be cautious when extracting arrows near veins, nerves, or tendons. Use all available methods to safely remove the arrow, and do so with ease, calmness, patience, and firmness as recommended by me.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore, you should try to extract the arrow in such a way that the patient is returned to their original position before being injured by the arrow, as this would be more beneficial for them.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if that is not possible, then you should do what is possible to restore the patient's position and condition as much as possible.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But if the arrow has moved in the opposite direction or some part of it has protruded outside the body, or if there is swelling at the end of the arrow due to a sensation from the area above the affected knee and the end of the arrow is prominent, then you should dry it by placing something on top of it; the drying should be according to the amount that the forceps can grasp. Then, pull the arrow out as it is easy to extract in this condition.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	But if the arrow is stuck in bone, then you should twist it in the opposite direction until it moves freely in the bone, increasing its movement until you can extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	If that is not possible, then leave the arrow in place for several days and attempt to extract it again once it has become loose.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is still inside the wound, then you should press on it to push it out.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the shaft has fallen out and you still want to push it further in order to extract it, then use a concave instrument to insert it inside and apply force against the back of the arrow to push it out.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is concave, then you should use a strong instrument to push it in further as this will make it easier to extract.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	If the arrowhead is poisoned, then it's necessary to remove all of the flesh around the wound if possible and treat it with appropriate methods.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the arrow has entered the foot or the belly or the bladder or the side and is close enough to be touched with an instrument, and it's possible to dry the area around the wound, then do so carefully while avoiding veins and nerves. Extract the arrow slowly, take care of the wound as needed, and treat it until healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Shape of forceps used for extracting arrows:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	The tips of the forceps are shaped like bird's beaks and have serrated edges that grip the arrow when applied, preventing it from slipping out.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And there are many types of forceps, large, small, medium-sized, depending on the size and thickness of the arrow, its slenderness, and the width of the wound, as well as its constriction.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	The shape of the concave pushing instrument is like a bird's beak and it is inserted into the wound cavity to facilitate the insertion of the arrow and push it out if it is stuck.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Shape of dull-tipped pushing instrument:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	Shape of pushing instrument for a concave arrow:
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On bloodletting from veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins that are commonly used in phlebotomy are typically the following: There are 16 major veins in the head, including: two pulsatile veins which are close to the ears, they are called temporal veins; two herbs that are in the two temples apparent; and two veins that are in the two lacrimal areas of the eyes, which are called cephalic veins; and the prepared vein in the middle of the forehead, and the vein that is at the end of the nose; and two jugular veins that are in the neck; and two veins that are in the upper lip; and two veins that are in the lower lip; and these are the veins that are called facial veins; and two veins that are below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	But the veins that are punctured in the arms are six. Four of those are cephalic veins, and one is the wild lettuce; and the common people call it "the head vein", and it is dull, and it is a minor vein, and it is made up of a branch of the basilic vein, and another branch of the cephalic vein; and the common people call that one "the vein of the whole body", and the basilic vein is the vein which is punctured in the inner elbow, and is called "cephalic", and the common people call it "vein of the belly"; and the cubital vein, which is punctured above the wrist crease, and it is that one that is punctured for bloodletting, and it is the one that appears above the pulse for a clear appearance; and the cephalic vein, which is between the above-mentioned auricular and the little finger, and has two branches.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and leg there are three veins; one of those is below the curvature of the ankle bone of the wild lettuce; and the second one is saphenous, and its location is below the knee of the domestic ankle; and the sciatic vein, and its location is below the knee of the wild lettuce; and in the leg there are other similar veins to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The benefit of puncturing the veins near the ears is for treating ancient catarrhal, migraine, safflower and old ulcers of the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the method of bloodletting from those veins is as I recommend to you: that is, shave the patient's head and then wash the patient's head in the occipital region where both veins are located with a wide cloth and good friction; then make the patient bend their neck with a bandage so that both veins appear near the ears in two depressed areas of the head; and look for it with your finger, and if you feel the pulse of those with your finger, here is the sign to proceed.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then you take the scalpel, which is sharp, and insert it below the vein in the elbow until the blood-letter touches the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	Then raise your hand with the vein and elbow upwards, and make an incision in the vein with sharp incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision be the size of two fingers or around that, and let as much blood flow out as you desire.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then strengthen with poultices and leave it in until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And it has already been mentioned at the beginning of this book about the incision of those and their cauterization.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	But the benefit of puncturing the two arteries in the temples is for treating ancient migraine, chronic evil eye, persistent otitis and acute cases of fluid retention in the legs.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the method of puncturing those veins is as I recommend to you: constrict the patient's neck so that both veins appear clearly and can be felt with your finger, and make sure their pulse can be felt below your finger; and then proceed.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Then you raise the elbow above the vein upwards with your index finger pointing to it, insert the sharp blood-letter below it and raise the vein; make an incision in it as you have done with the other two veins, and let the blood flow according to the amount that is necessary.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then loosen the patient's bandage, place your finger over the vein for an hour, and then apply a compress and poultices to strengthen it with firm pressure, and leave it in place until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And a reminder about them, their incision, and their cauterization has been made at the beginning of this book.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And therefore, the benefit of bloodletting from the vein in the forehead is similar to that of puncturing the cephalic vein for ancient facial illnesses, chronic migraine, cough and fetid ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the method of bloodletting from it is as I recommend to you, that is, the patient constricts their neck with a bandage so that the vein appears; and then take the instrument called a fossor, which has this form:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Place the pointed end of the fossor, which is at the top of the instrument, on the vein and strike it with force using the handle or another object in the manner described, and let the blood flow according to the amount that you desire; and then loosen the bandage of the patient and strengthen the area until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And sometimes the space is opened with a broad blood-letter, but it is not necessary that the blood-letter have a sharp point like the other blood-letters. Instead, it should be blunt, and you should puncture it transversely, because the bone is close and easily broken by the blood-letter when it is fine.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	But the benefit of the two veins that are in the lacrimal areas of both eyes is for scabies of the hands, cough and boils on the hands, as well as for facial illnesses.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the method of bloodletting is that the patient constricts their neck with a bandage, and then you puncture those veins while standing over their head.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And the puncture is made in a transverse direction with a blunt blood-letter, because there is not much flesh in this location, and if the blood-letter is sharp, it can easily break the tip of it.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then let the blood flow according to your needs, place a compress on it and strengthen it for one night, and then loosen it.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	The practice of bloodletting from the nose vein is beneficial for acute fever and violent headache, and for facial and ophthalmic diseases and pain that occurs in the face, especially when it is old or chronic.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	The method of bloodletting is for the patient to bend their head and move it towards your left hand, while you take a thin lancet and place it in the middle of the bridge of the nose according to the correct position, as the vein is not visible there, so that blood starts flowing immediately.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	You must then gradually move your hand with the lancet and allow the blood to flow according to your need; and tie it off with a ligature, as this will quickly heal.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	However, the benefit of bloodletting from both jugular veins is that it relieves constriction and helps in the early stages of leprosy and many other diseases, as well as impetigo and corrosive ulcers, such as herpetic ones.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	The method of bloodletting from both jugular veins is for the patient to bend their neck backwards and stretch it out gently; while the practitioner stands over the patient's head and the patient lies down on a pillow.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	Then make an incision in the vein with a wide and shallow lancet, gradually and slowly; and extract blood in moderate quantity or as much as you see is necessary, and repeat the same procedure for the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	Then release the ligature and bind both veins gently with a mild compression to prevent excessive bleeding, and leave it overnight for the wound to heal.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	The benefit of bloodletting from the veins in the temples is that it relieves small abscesses and pustules in the mouth, as well as gum disease and bad ulcers; and also for bad ulcers and fissures on the nose and its surroundings.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident. E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this method of venesection is safe from excessive bleeding and nerve damage, and is more praiseworthy and safer than bloodletting according to length and width.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And if it is customary for someone to experience fainting during venesection, you should treat them beforehand with a piece of bread soaked in millet wine or simple oxymel that has been heated; and extract the blood in three or four stages.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if they have a cold and damp constitution, before the bloodletting they should take bread soaked in myrrh dissolved in vinegar or aromatic honey with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger, and similar substances, or in fragrant and strongly scented vinegar.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if fainting occurs during bloodletting due to the loss of a large amount of blood, it is necessary for them to drink meat water and fragrant vinegar, and use aromatics with aloe, and apply a linen cloth to their chest.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other remedies that we have mentioned in the section on fainting for evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And if someone wants to relieve their arm and thin their blood in stages, it is necessary for the venesection to be done on a vein that has strong evacuation power, and whose strength is weak; they should let the blood flow slowly, according to the amount of strength on consecutive days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But if someone wants to relieve their arm and thin their blood a second time, and their body is strong, they should do this seven or nine hours after the first venesection.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But if someone wants to draw the blood from their body in the opposite direction of its natural flow, it is necessary to perform this on the second or third day after venesection.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But if someone's body is filled with thick and rapidly flowing blood, causing a fever, it is necessary to draw a large amount of blood from them in one session, and widen the incision until fainting occurs; this should be done while taking care to follow all the proper procedures for venesection; and place your hand on their pulse to prevent death from occurring instead of fainting, as this often happens when the person performing the bloodletting is ignorant or negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And it is not necessary when you want to relieve the arm and thin the blood in stages, with the orifices of the vein already closed and the flow of blood slow, that you press hard on the area with force and bend and extend the limb slightly, as this is very harmful.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Allow it to remain closed until the vein can be opened again; or maintain the force of the bloodletting by applying pressure to the coagulated blood in the orifice of the vein; or place a piece of theriac or cautery over the area and apply gentle pressure until the blood has flowed out.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is swollen with an abscess, leave it alone and do not touch it until the abscess has been treated.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if necessity compels you to thin the blood again and there is no excuse not to do so, then perform venesection on that same area or in another vein in the other arm.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called "funis of the arm" is used for bloodletting instead of the cubital or basilic veins when they are not found or are obscured, as it is composed of those veins.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	The quality of the venesection is that the patient should place their hand in warm water until the vein appears clearly and the tip of the finger turns red.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	And then apply gentle pressure with the ligature around the area where the incision will be made, using a narrow band; and perform the venesection in a transverse direction, not lengthwise or broadly.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And make the incision wide and perform the venesection at the joint of the arm, using a small opening.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is prohibited, place your hand in warm water and allow the blood to flow into the water until you have achieved your desired result.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the summer months, you are excused from placing your hand in warm water; and during winter, the body should be placed in warm water for bloodletting.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And venesection of this vein is safer than all other veins, as there are no pulsating veins or nerves located below it.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And venesection of the cephalic vein in the right arm is beneficial for illnesses of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	The quality of the venesection is that you should tie the arm with a ligature or your hand, after placing it in warm water, until the vein is filled and clearly visible; then perform the venesection transversely; and even if the nerve is cut, this will not be harmful.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	Be careful not to tie the ligature too tightly during venesection, as the nerves in that area are exposed and lack protection from the skin.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And then place your hand in warm water and allow the blood to flow into it, as if you do not immerse the arm in warm water, the blood will coagulate in the orifice of the vein and will be unable to flow.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	After extracting the necessary amount of blood, apply oil and salt to the vein to prevent it from becoming clotted or sealed; similarly, it is necessary to close all other incisions tightly.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	But the benefit of venesection on the left arm is that it is beneficial for illnesses of the spleen.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And perform the venesection in the same way as you did on the other arm.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	The benefit of venesection on the saphenous vein is for illnesses in the lower part of the body, such as those affecting the bladder and uterus, and for retention of menstrual flow, and for illnesses of the kidneys and old ulcers of the thighs and hips, and similar ailments.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	The quality of the venesection is that the patient should place their foot in warm water and massage it until the veins become visible; then tie a band around the ankle; the location of the vein should be marked with your finger, and its branches can be seen on the surface of the foot.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And so perform the venesection on the widest branch of the vein located below the ankle, as this is better and safer.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you perform venesection on the surface of the foot, be careful not to cut the nerves that are located below the vein; and perform the incision using a transverse direction, as if you were going to make an incision along its length.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And be the phlebotomist you.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the issuing of blood is forbidden; then immerse the foot in warm water and let the blood flow in that place until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist errs in the first attempt, then try again with a small incision, for the place is sound; and do not fear infection, but rather be cautious of nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	Similarly, do the same with the saphenous vein on the other foot as well.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And the sciatic vein, as we have said, is located below the calf on the outside of the leg.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of bloodletting on him is for pain in the hip when it is due to an excess of blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of bloodletting on him is that the patient enters a bath, and quickly and strongly clenches his buttock with a thin, long band tied just above the heel on top of four fingers, so that it is not visible except for that.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And so when you see the vein, then perform bloodletting according to each case and as much as possible, and according to the transverse (vein direction), and that is better; or incise it with an incision or cut it with a section, for the location is sound.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is often quite narrow in male subjects; and if you find that, and it does not appear to be the entire vein, then perform bloodletting on a branch of it, which appears on the back of the foot towards the little finger and ring finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And be careful of the nerves, and let the blood flow in the amount that you desire.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then release the tension and place your hand over the site of the bloodletting, holding it firmly, for it heals quickly.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventosation (or bloodletting through cupping) and the qualities of its use.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventosations (or bloodletting through cupping) are used for corns, or for erysipelas (inflammation of the skin), or for abscesses.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Ventosation (or bloodletting through cupping) is performed in two ways: one method involves making an incision and extracting blood, while the other method involves ventosation without making an incision.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this method of ventosation (or bloodletting through cupping) that is without incision is performed in two ways: either with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the locations on the body where bloodletting through cupping with incision and extraction of blood are administered are fourteen in number, of which one is placed on the nape of the neck, and is called alnocrati; and another is at the back of the head, at the base of the skull; and bloodletting on the mandible below the jawbone, behind the mouth; and bloodletting with two spatulas; and bloodletting in the armpit, above the elbow; and bloodletting in the groin, at the top of the thigh; and bloodletting in two places, one on each calf; and bloodletting in two places, one on each knee.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And ventosation does not extract blood from the small veins spread throughout the flesh, but rather through them, and for this reason it does not diminish their virtue as is commonly done with phlebotomy; nor is it necessary that ventosation be performed with or without fire in any illness caused by repletion until the entire body has been evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if there is a need for ventosation due to illness or chronic conditions, administer it at any time during the beginning and end of each month, in the middle of the day and night, and at regular intervals.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause of this is that in some people there is an excess of blood multiplied within them, requiring extraction through ventosation and finding heaviness and swelling in their head; and in others, one finds repletion and redness in their face and head, as well as in their neck; and in others, one finds bruising on their face and forehead, along with darkness and dullness in their eyes; and in others, the location of their ventosation is wet or damp; and in others, there is an excess of laughter; and in others, one finds a taste of blood in their mouth, or their tongue is swollen and spits out blood; and in others, their sleep is excessive, and they experience nosebleeds, old age, illnesses, and other similar causes.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore, when you see any of these causes, and particularly during the third or middle part of the month, then we command that ventosation be performed more than two or three hours after passing midday.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of ventosation on the nape is that when it alleviates heaviness in the head and contributes to what has accumulated in the heels, but it is necessary that this be accompanied by evacuation of the entire body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventosation is at the location of phlebotomy in the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not permissible to use it (the cephalic vein) for those with a complexion that is prone to bleeding, or in cases of catarrh, because it can cause great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And therefore, it is not necessary to use this (the cephalic vein) in the elderly, and particularly in those who have frail health.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But for the one who is continuously lying above them, a forgetfulness is made; and therefore, it is necessary that you instruct the bleeder to place his hand a little below the blisters, in order to prevent the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	Cupping (or ventozation) on the back is a substitute for bloodletting from the dark-colored vein and the basilic vein: and therefore, it is beneficial for asthma, and for constriction of the windpipe and cleft of the windpipe instrument, and for cough, and for congestion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is necessary that the cupping cup be applied only slightly, because if it is placed too low, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And cupping with alhagdahan is beneficial for accidental pain in the head and for ophthalmia, migraine, dizziness, and toothache; and it is a substitute for bloodletting from the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is necessary that you instruct the one performing cupping (or bloodletting) not to press too hard with their hand during incision, so as not to cut into an artery and cause excessive bleeding.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And cupping below the chin is beneficial for bad breath in the mouth, and for decay of the gums, and for symptoms similar to various oral diseases, and it is a substitute for bloodletting from the alieric vein that is located on the two lips.
