Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But cupping that is performed on the two spatulas (or plates) is beneficial for flatulence, which is caused by an excess of heat in the body.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And cupping on the two sides of the temples is beneficial for the bloodletting of three veins, which are the basilic, dark-colored (or "fusca"), and cephalic veins. This is because that cupping draws blood from all those small veins that are found in the flesh, as well as from smaller branches of the larger veins, allowing the blood to flow into the three main veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And instruct the one performing cupping (or bloodletting) not to make too many incisions, because the area is stripped of flesh, and underneath it are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And there is also a type of cupping that is performed on the buttocks, which is beneficial for hemorrhoids of the anus and for ulcers that are located below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And it is necessary that you instruct the one performing cupping (or bloodletting) to use a large cup, and that it be made of iron, because the area requires strong suction; and lightweight and subtle cups should be used with incision, as they are more easily pierced.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But smaller cups should be used with more precision and care, because they draw blood from the entire body, and are beneficial for chronic pains in the ribs and abdomen, and in the bladder; and they promote menstruation, and are beneficial for bloating and indigestion. They are a substitute for bloodletting from the two saphenous veins (located on the legs), and from the jugular vein, and from the two clavicles.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, it can weaken the entire body and cause fainting spells in some men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And the benefit of cupping on the jugular vein is similar to that of cupping on two ribs (or "cambas").
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the positioning of cupping cups is that you should place the cup at the beginning with a gentle suction, and gradually increase it over time, and not prolong the placement of the cups, but rather remove them lightly, and leave them in place gently, and allow the humors to come to the area naturally.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not stop repeating this and continuing until you see the area become red and swollen, and the flow of blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you should make incisions and gradually increase the suction, and carefully consider the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because a person who has delicate flesh and is prone to scars, it is necessary that you make incisions only once, and not more than that, because the area may become ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And instruct the one performing cupping (or bloodletting) to increase the incision slightly and deepen it a little, and moderate the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then it is necessary that you make incisions twice, because in the first incision the pathway of subtle absorption for the blood and its wateriness is opened up.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second one, seek to acquire the extraction of thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very thick (or "feculent"), then it is necessary to make a third incision in order to achieve the desired effect.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And recently, when we want to extract blood little by little, a scratch/superficial incision is sufficient.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a large amount of blood, make a deep incision; and if we know that the blood is thick, then it is necessary to scarify with a heavy scratching.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the depth of the incision should only be that of a quill.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the quill of the person is thick, hard, dark and their pores are tight, then it is necessary to apply lozenges with a soothing, more open resolution; in summertime, use aloe oil or violet oil, or oils from hard-shelled nuts like walnuts, or cinnamon. And in winter, use narcissus oil, lily oil, chamomile oil, or blood-like oils, and similar ones.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is large and thick, then use oils like marjoram, balsamite, aloe, or dill, etc.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the cupping practitioner has wide pores and tender flesh, then it is necessary to prohibit them from using oil, and in this case, the places where the cups are applied must be washed with warm water or cold water infused with solstice herbs, walnut leaves, or Bordeaux broth, etc.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for a person with very moist blood, wash their cups with sour wine or water infused with myrtle and sumac, etc.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for those with large excess fluids, wash their cups with aged wine or water infused with wormwood (sansuc), which is majoram, or with a decoction of dill, chamomile, etc.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And it is necessary that cupping be done before bathing; one should administer cupping immediately after bathing for an hour or two, and one should sleep immediately after cupping.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	"What is it that the person receiving cupping or bloodletting should do before the procedure?"
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	It is necessary to consider the following at the beginning: if the cupping practitioner or the person who will perform bloodletting has a choleric temperament and causes sharp, inflamed blood, then it is necessary to take cooling measures such as acetic millet, endive in sour wine and lettuce, secano-bine, julep, etc.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And they should abstain from foods such as poultry and boiled meats, condiments with acidic flavors, and similar ones.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for those with a cold temperament, it is necessary to take in drinks such as barley water or barley water made from sesame seeds, sumac, and sweet-smelling herbs between wine and honey; and one should advise them to eat and drink sparingly, and abstain from boiled meats, capon, pork, mutton, small birds, and doves.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it is necessary that on the day of cupping or bloodletting, one should drink more than they eat.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And it is necessary to give some people theriac or medicines with musk, such as nutmeg or aloewood, before cupping or bloodletting, so that the main parts are comforted and the blood becomes refined; and they should not take those scalding ones.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the cups that are used for scratching should be placed on the liver, above the spleen and gout, above the navel, on the sides of the kidneys, and on the bladder's hip bone, because these parts cannot tolerate scratching over them.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not suitable for those parts but rather for attracting blood from the body, such as placing a cup on the breast in an illness with bleeding of blood from the nose; and they use this to dissolve cold viscous wind in the member, such as placing a cup on the belly and navel. For this reason, it rarefies the member and scalds it, removing pain and resolving viscous wind.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is placed on the wheals when there is an outbreak of hives or itching, because through its strong attractive force it can easily draw out the hives and eradicate itching from its location.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly, it works when the cup is placed on the liver and spleen to relieve congestion in those areas.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These cups are administered with suction only, while some are also administered with heat.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some are also administered full of boiling water in liver diseases.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is because the cup should be filled with hot water and expanded, so that it becomes larger, which can be achieved by adding boiling water or water in which suitable herbs have been steeped.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of cup administered with fire: the diameter of the orifice should be two fingers wide, as we have made it; and the amount of air inside should be as much as a palm; and the hole in it, which is in the side, should be small, proportionate to the size of the opening that can fit into it an awl.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of iron or copper, with wide rims, strong and smooth so that it does not damage the skin when placed on the body part.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of it there should be a transverse bar made of iron or metal, where a candle with fire is placed.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this cup should be larger than the one we have recommended before, and smaller than that depending on the illness and the condition of the person using it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cups for children and weak people are different from those used on young and healthy adults.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	The technique for placing this cup with fire on the body is to extend a piece of wood with a decent flame in front of a small candle made of wax, and then place it in the middle of the transverse bar in the middle of the cup, so that the fire is lit around the edge of the opening, preventing the patient's skin from being burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it should be placed on the affected area of the patient, with the finger over the hole we mentioned, until when we hold the cups and do not need to press the finger and there is steam coming out of the hole, at that point the cup will be quickly released.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then with the stick in a suitable manner, ignite it again if necessary.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in the case of a cup used for swelling, filled with water and without a transverse bar or hole, it should be placed on the affected area only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the shape of the cup: This type of cup is better when it is larger because it can hold more water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Capital Chapter 97.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not administered on large body parts but rather on small ones where there is no position for cupping due to their size, such as the mouth and gums or similar areas, or on denuded flesh, such as the tongue and nose or similar areas.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those [leeches] that you have found in the clear waters of moistened mud.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And they should be left in clean water day and night until they are hungry, ensuring that no impurities remain within them; and then the body should be evacuated at the beginning through bloodletting and cupping; and then the affected limbs of the patient should be rubbed until they become red; and then [the leeches] should be placed on [the patient].
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and detached.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to apply cupping to the area, it is more beneficial for healing.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the area with sour wine and then with warm water; and then rub and press it.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body's blood continues to flow after removing the leeches and there is a discharge, then take a piece of cloth and soak it in cold water, and place it over the area to absorb the discharge.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the bleeding is excessive, then sprinkle vitriol trisulphate or other stiptic agents like it on the area until the bleeding stops; or place dried bean pods over the location and leave them there until they adhere to the skin, at which point the bleeding will have stopped.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And cover, if necessary, with an iteration of leeches, when it is possible to replace them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the use of leeches is prohibited, then rub the area with fresh blood or prick the skin to make it bleed; and then place them [the stiptic agents], because leeches will immediately detach themselves when they sense any blood.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to detach, sprinkle a small amount of powdered aloe trisulphate, salt, or ash on them and they will soon detach.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the prologue of the third section: on restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very often necessary in the art of medicine and deals with the restoration of bone fractures and dislocations caused by accidents.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh son, be aware that this chapter is often boasted about by foolish doctors and quacks who have never studied the works of the ancient scholars or read a single letter of their texts.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And therefore this method of knowledge is kept private in our land; I have not forgotten it at any time and have never neglected to study it; and I have not used anything other than what I learned through extensive reading of the books of the ancients and studying their meanings, until I extracted the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I will continue to direct myself towards experimentation and study throughout my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have described in this chapter everything that my science contains and on which I have conducted experimentation; for here I have summarized it for you and relieved myself of the burden of prolongation; and I have summarized it in the end with summary; and demonstrated it in the end with declaration; and provided many forms of the instruments used in it, as is done with additional declaration, as I have done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter one.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summaries and collections on the nature of bone fractures, including those necessary premises before we begin the memory aid for each broken member and its various types.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us first discuss in this chapter's prologue the summaries of the discourse; and the chapters whose understanding is necessary at the beginning for practitioners, who must focus their attention on the truth of these chapters, as you and those who are eager to learn or master this noble art from you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And so I say that when a fracture or dislocation or sprain or swelling occurs, it is necessary for you to begin with bloodletting or applying leeches, or both, if no reason prohibits it, such as weakness of strength, or if the person is an infant, very old and decrepit, or during a time of intense heat or cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And let him be content with food made from fresh herbs and the meat of birds and crustaceans; and prohibit heavy meats and filling up on rich foods or any food that fills the veins with blood, until you are certain there is no danger of abscess or if you do not fear an effusion of matter in the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their usual routine and habits.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so when the broken bone begins to heal, it is necessary for the patient to eat nutritious foods that are rich and heavy with viscosity, such as those made from wheat cooked in water, rice, peas, cow's stomach, broths, fresh fish, thick wines, and similar foods. And with this diet, the coagulation of the fracture takes place more easily and quickly.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that bones that are fractured in men who are very young or very old cannot be continuously healed and consolidated according to their nature due to the dryness of their members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And bones are continuously and naturally healed by the dryness of their members at all times, and those that are in their final stages of softness are continuously and naturally healed, such as the bones of young children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature adjusts and adapts to the broken bone of every part in a way similar to glue, with a thickness that adheres and strengthens it together until they are consolidated, bound together, until they reach the end of their strength and firmness, just as fire at the beginning, until no cause prohibits it from its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary that you pause the patient's food, foods with heaviness and viscosity and thickness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many varieties of fracture according to the diversity of the member.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for a fracture of the bone in the leg is different from a fracture of the bone in the head; and a fracture of the bone in the foot is different from a fracture of the bone in the back; and similarly all other members are different from one another.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I will begin with a memory aid for each type of fracture, explained in its own separate chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	The diversity of fractures within itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the types of bone fractures are diverse; for there is one type of fracture that results in a bowing shape, and other times it occurs along the length of the bone. Furthermore, there are also fractures caused by splinters and fragments, both protruding and non-protruding, similar to how a wound appears when it's prepared to be written on. Additionally, there is a type of fracture with contusion and disruption in the skull, as well as a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And each type has its own particular challenge or difficulty in healing, according to the distinct memory that will come from its location.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Sign(s) of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And so a bone fracture is recognized by its deformity, as well as the prominence and sensation of it being apparent to touch, and also by how it feels when compressed with one's hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore, when there is no apparent deformity or prominence and it does not feel that way when touched, nor does the patient experience significant pain when pressing on it with agitation, then it is not a bone fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	However, it is possible that there may be deformity or a small fissure, and in such cases, it is not necessary to manipulate it with one's hand or apply compression on the entire area. Instead, place a medicine over it that recalls the appropriate remedy for that location, and make it tight with subtle constriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that when the location is bowed but not split into two or has some other condition like swelling, as with the entire part being compared, then it is necessary to begin immediately with the rectification of it, which may require surgical incision and removal of pus.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if there is surgical incision and removal of pus, then leave it for several days until the pus ceases to drain, and then dress it in any way that you can using lightness and gentleness.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the healing process and swelling of it is easier than in a bone where there is a splintered fracture.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And make it strong according to how it recovers.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone is splintered, then it is necessary to extend the broken limb with two parts, whether it's an arm or a leg, or with one hand if the limb is small, or using two ropes or one rope and a hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And your position should be such that you place the limb in its natural shape while extending the broken parts, and then make sure to adjust those pieces with gentleness and in any way that you can in their locations.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And be cautious with your strength, ensuring that you do not cause pain or injury to the patient through your operation, and make sure to use your skills to align each bone with its companion in the best possible way.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is essential that you touch the affected area with your hand at that time, and if there are any other reasons for deviation, correct it and adjust it according to the degree of your strength.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid excessive extension and compression, as many foolish doctors often cause pus-filled abscesses through their operations, or cause contracture in the limb, as we have seen happen through the operations of many such doctors.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And apply annexation, alignment, and proper operation with appropriate tension to the limb, along with rest and tranquility; advise the patient not to manipulate it during their waking hours or sleeping, and observe its movements, digestion, and all activities with full attention. Wait for the position of the limb to be one that provides relief from pain, which occurs when there is discomfort or injury in the limb's position; therefore, it is necessary to change the limb's position to a new one that does not cause pain. Also, ensure that the limb's position is straight and aligned so that no deformity occurs during healing.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the tension in the resting limb is as follows: for you should know that broken limbs are diverse in their smallness and bigness, and in the shape of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small, such as the arm, finger, and thumb, it is necessary to use a wrapping of soft fabric.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But for those that are large, such as the thigh or leg, it is necessary to use a hard and rigid wrapping because it connects the large and strong member in all parts with firm tension, ensuring that no dirt enters into it.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And begin with an appropriate and convenient evacuation of alignment, pause for a while on the location of that fracture using three or four layers of wrapping according to the size of the limb, and apply gentle pressure on the ligament using your hand.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then come to the upper part of the location of the fracture and apply less tension than the tightness you used to strengthen the location of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then gradually lengthen the wrapping of the location of the fracture, and gradually loosen the tension, until you can take a large portion of it.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap it around the other side of the fracture with wrapping, and bring the wraps to the lower part of the fracture; and let your operation in the tension of the wrapping and in the loosening of that according to what we have said in the first wrapping above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then place between the layers of soft wool or fabric that is evenly aligned with the twisted shape of the fracture, if there is twisting in it; and if not, do not place any cause in it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place another bandage over it, and align properly on these star-shaped layers just made, if there is no swelling or pus in the area. But if there is pus or swelling present, then place a dressing over it that will absorb the pus and reduce swelling; and leave it for several days; and then tighten the stars.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the stars be made of cane with straight and well-formed shape; or they can be made from pine wood; or from palm ribs, and the width of each star should be according to this form and figure.
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, it is necessary that the star that is placed on the fracture should be slightly larger and wider than the other stars, and the length of the star according to the size of the limb in magnitude and smallness; and then tighten the stars with another bandage following your first tension; and then tie above with a ligament properly according to what we have said about tension, that is, let your tension be according to the location of the fracture more so, and the further it is from the fracture, the less the tension.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And it is necessary that the threads be medium in thickness and fineness, and be of linen; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen with some foolish doctors using heavy ropes made of twisted linen, this is a great error because it prevents equal tension.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And also fine threads are not appropriate because you will not be able to obtain the desired tension with them, and it is not appropriate for there to be less than a finger-width between star and star.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is injured by the ends of the stars due to too much tension in certain locations, then place a layer of soft wool or red wool under it so that it does not cause injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some types of fracture involve a contusion and cause disruption in the skin, and this requires special attention as mentioned in that chapter concerning individual cases.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not all broken limbs can be made tight with stars on the first day; for when it is large, it is not appropriate to place stars on it but rather wait for several days or a week or more depending on your confidence in the absence of pus-filled abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the method of plasters that the Ancients used to restore, which were placed on fractures and dislocations and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of plaster commonly used for the restoration of fracture, suitable for many complexities and mostly for women and children, because it does not require heat or rubbing; and it is made from powdered flour, which is the soft inner part of grain ground between the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And when he is as if in a deep sleep, so that he shakes his body, and you make an incision with a blunt instrument and place the compression not thick or thin; and then use that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way of making a poultice to heal fractures, dislocations, and twists: take assafoetida, ladanum, acacia, elecampane, and marjoram (which is wild marjoram), all one drachma each; myrrh and aloe each half a drachma; and aloe juice two drachmas, all of which should be ground and sifted and mixed with oil or egg white if the patient's complexion is dry. Then apply this poultice, for it has a good composition and heals fractured bones lightly and strengthens many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another way of making a poultice to heal fractures and twists: take marjoram, meadow sweet, and white althea each one drachma; myrrh and aloe each half a drachma; acacia six drachmas; and Armenian bole twenty drachmas.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Let all the ingredients be crushed and ground in a mortar with a pestle, and then let them be mixed with water or egg white and administered (to the patient).
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Another way of making a poultice for dislocated joints and bones, which relieves pain in those areas and heals fissures and fractures: take clean wool, soak it in vinegar and olive oil, and place it on the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	But in this poultice, there is not the power of restoration, it only heals abscesses and draws out and eliminates pain properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another way of making a poultice that heals broken bones: take leaves from a wild fig tree and poppy plant, crush them all and make a poultice with them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Another way of making a quick-acting poultice to heal bone fractures and promote resolution of abscess residue: take equal parts of marshmallow root, chamomile, violet flowers, flour, all in equal quantities. Let all the ingredients be crushed and mixed with vinegar, if the member is not damaged.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is damaged, then use a poultice made with crushed barley water or plain water and apply it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another way of making a stronger poultice for the resolution of abscesses, when a severe abscess occurs and requires bone restoration: take equal parts of marshmallow root, flax seeds, wild oleander, melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, and chamomile. Let all the ingredients be crushed and mixed with pine resin or plain water or vinegar, depending on the affected member's condition and color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	However, Hippocrates says in his book that a poultice should not be placed on the broken member for its restoration, but rather a cerate made from wax and oil without any other ingredients; he also recommends that it be of medium consistency between thick and thin.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	However, Galen advises that poultices should be placed on the broken member for its restoration, and the causes of dryness with a small amount of heat should be similar to myrrh, resin, and substances like them from those we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Another way of making a poultice for injury and pain: take equal parts of crushed goat's milk cheese, wax from human hair or bird feathers, marshmallow root, and salt; crush, grind, and mix them to make the poultice.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	However, the amount of poultice that remains attached should be sufficient to keep the dressing in place, and it should not be loosened for many days if there is no pain, inflammation, or broken bone out of its location.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if pain, swelling, or inflammation occurs at the site, then you should consider loosening or removing the poultice immediately and removing it from the area.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a piece of linen and dampen it with seawater, then use that to wash the area where there is swelling and inflammation until the swelling subsides and pain is alleviated; let the member rest for an hour; then place clean wool soaked in vinegar or olive oil on the affected area, and wrap it with a bandage overnight until you are certain that the abscess has been drawn out and the inflammation has subsided, and the pain has been relieved.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And repeat that gentle stretching and apply a thin poultice without applying too much pressure from your initial bandaging, and continue to gently stretch the affected area until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess and redness and pain and inflammation and all the symptoms have completely healed, and you no longer need poultices or bandages, then repeat the same treatment as you did at the beginning in equal amounts.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if none of the symptoms we mentioned occur in the member, then you should not remove the poultice for three or four or five or seven days. And sometimes everything is left alone for twenty days, depending on the loosening of the member, as we said before, until the fracture heals and begins to form new tissue over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust the bandage so that it is tighter than your initial bandaging and also take into account the patient's nutritional needs and any other factors that may affect their recovery.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	However, if you see that the site of the fracture has become dry and shriveled more than necessary, then you should know that nutrition is not reaching it; in this case, soak it with mild salt water each time you change the dressing, for three days. Also loosen the bandage slightly to allow nutrients to reach the affected area and promote faster healing.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	However, foolish restorers of bone fractures sometimes cause further damage when the bone does not heal properly at first, and instead heal in a crooked manner. This is a mistake in their procedure, and they should be fearful of it. If they had acted correctly from the beginning, the ancients would have approved of their work.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen anyone among them do this, which is more reasonable that they should not do it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Two: On Fractures That Occur in the Head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	There are many types of fractures and their shapes vary, as do the causes, for some fractures are caused by blows from weapons that penetrate the skull, entering between the bone and skin, like a stick penetrating through it, and this type is called "ascial." Or a weapon cuts into the bone but does not penetrate deeply, only cutting through the flesh, in which case it is called "levatio absoluta."
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the severity of these two types of fractures can be great or small, and there is also the type of fracture that is caused by friction or scraping against stone or similar objects.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this type of fracture can be penetrating, reaching the periosteum, which is under the bone, or it can occur on the surface of the bone, and the severity of these two types of fractures can be great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And there is also the type of fracture that occurs in the fine hairs of bone tissue and is therefore called "fractura capillar."
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And there is also the type of fracture that is caused by blows or strikes from stones and similar objects, which causes a piece of bone to be pushed into deeper tissue layers, like what happens when roof tiles are broken and fragments penetrate inward.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this is usually done in bodies with hot bones, such as the heads of children.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these types of fractures and dislocations are like separate stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will come with remedies for all of this in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And we recognize all these types of fractures by detection on them and by investigation of their symptoms and examination of the rotten flesh that is on them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And the type of fracture known as "capillary" is recognized by this: there is exposed bone that appears clean and has a black mark on it where the fracture is.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	However, in the treatment of fractures, one must first consider the symptoms of the patient, and then, if one sees through these symptoms that it clearly indicates fear (such as vomiting from anger, dilation, loss of consciousness, loss of voice, fainting, acute fever, swelling of the hands and feet with pain in them, and similar symptoms in more severe cases), one should not expect healing.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you do not see unusual symptoms, then you can hope for a cure and begin the treatment.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	This is because if the patient comes to you in the beginning of the illness, as it is during the winter months, then it is necessary to wait for 14 days and observe the condition of the bone before beginning treatment.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is during the summer months, then it is necessary to wait 7 days before cutting into the bone, allowing for any tissue damage or decay below the skin (panniculus) to heal first and for any alarming symptoms to appear.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has reached the panniculus covering the brain and is broken into small pieces and shattered, then it is necessary to cut into the damaged, crushed bone as I will instruct you to do.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And you must examine the head of the patient and uncover the bone as is customary and according to your abilities based on the appearance of the injury, doing so gently with the patient's comfort in mind.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you are unable to identify the bone or observe signs of inflammation, such as swelling or pus, then it is necessary to take action by applying wet bandages soaked in vinegar and rose oil to the wound to calm the infection, allowing time for the patient to recover before performing surgery on the bone.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is to be done in one of two ways: methods of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the first method is to cut into the bone with a straight-edged scalpel, and this is how it should be done: first, administer one scalpel that is slightly narrower in width, and then use another scalpel, slightly wider than the first, like so.
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then apply a wider scalpel than the second one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And it is necessary to have a variety of scalpels with different widths, some wider than others and some narrower, and these should be sharpened on the ends so as to allow for precise cuts.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And make use of them as needed for percussion on the scalpel, making sure not to damage the skull or injure it further.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong and hard, then it is necessary to drill into its circumference before using the scalpels with their handles (known as non-penetrating trephines).
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And these are called non-penetrating trephines because they do not reach the base of the skull (the inner table) and instead have a rounded tip or edge that prevents them from being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is advisable to have many trephines available, each suited for the thickness of different bones, so that you always have one on hand with a sharp tip proportionate to the size of the skull's circumference.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the method for using three types of trephines: to drill into the circumference of a broken bone, place the trephine on the bone and rotate it with your fingers until you know that the bone has been penetrated, then remove the trephine and place it in another location. Repeat this process, leaving enough space between each hole for the width of a ray or thereabouts.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then use the scalpels to cut between each hole in the bone, making your incisions as fine as possible for ease of removal, either with your hand or through some other means using tools you have prepared for this purpose, such as tweezers and delicate forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And it is essential that you exercise extreme caution to ensure that the scalpel does not come into contact with any part of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And once you have drilled around the bone and separated it from the brain if it is attached, and extracted it, then it is necessary to smooth and shape the surface of the bone with another tool similar to a scalpel, but sharper and more delicate than the others.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any small, fragmented pieces of bone remain, then remove them with ease using the tools at your disposal, and then care for the wound with liniments and ointments as I have mentioned before.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other method of operation is less invasive and poses less risk, known as Galen's technique, which involves cutting along the length of the bone where the fracture is most severe and visible. The process for doing this is as follows: in the beginning, carefully uncover the area around the fractured bone until you reach the point where the break is most pronounced, then gently insert the end of this scalpel (whose shape is depicted here) beneath the surface of the bone.
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the lens-shaped portion of the scalpel should be blunt and not cut through anything, while the pointed end should extend two finger widths beyond the handle (as you can see), with the lens-shaped portion resting against the brain and the sharp edge cutting into the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then strike the scalpel gently with a small mallet until it is fully inserted into the bone in a smooth and easy motion, ensuring that the membrane (panniculus) remains unharmed and not damaged in any way. And if the patient is the most foolish and ignorant of all people, even if they are asleep, then do this without hesitation or fear.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	And if there are any attached pieces of the panniculus membrane still adhered to the bone in certain areas, use the round tip of the scalpel to gently cut through them and release them without causing harm or risk.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture does not penetrate into the membrane (panniculus) and instead only affects the surface of the bone, leaving behind jagged edges or fragments, then it is necessary to smooth out these rough areas and remove the small fragments using fine razors that you have prepared in advance. These razors should come in various sizes so that they can be used effectively in any situation and with precision based on your assessment of the broken bone and its shape.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And it is essential that you begin by using the largest of your razors to shape the bone, and then gradually move on to finer ones as needed, continuing this process until you have used the finest instruments available to complete the procedure.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	And for smaller, less severe capillary and fine fractures, provide care based on your assessment of the necessary treatment.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is because not everyone who studies this art has achieved mastery over all types of fractures.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And we have demonstrated this in cases of major fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the membrane (panniculus) retracts when you remove the bone fragments, then take a piece of it equivalent to the size of the wound and soak it in rose oil before applying it to the opening. Then place another folded or tripled cloth soaked in vinegar over this first layer, being as gentle as possible so as not to damage the brain. Finally, apply a broad bandage but do not pull it too tight, only enough to cover the wound.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave him to this treatment for one day or for two until you are sure of the abscess formation; and then release it and administer medicines which are excessively dry, such as linseed and flour of erbs, and powder of aloes and licorice, and similar to these.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And make a powder of these medicines which should be pulverized over the wound, as they are dry; and generally, administer all medicine with the property that it repels and does not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And take care, according to your ability, that the wound in your treatment is clean; and not be contaminated with pus or other things; nor allow any virulence to accumulate in it; for when it adheres to the dura mater of the brain, it corrupts it and then harms the patient, causing a malignant evil.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it occurs in the head, as when the bone is purified and mostly when the treatment of it is neglected, and there is blackness on the surface; and therefore consider at that time if such symptoms occur in the patient, know that he is in great danger.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is not blackness but from the medicine that is placed on top, and it is due to the power of that medicine that causes such blackness, therefore you should take one part of honey and three parts of rose oil. And soak linen in it and place the cloth on the head; and treat it with spices of healing until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that it is not broken if there are two pieces together at a higher level, or one of those in some places, because there are two bones in it, and the lower part is cartilaginous and not broken, but rather abrasion, curvature, and sinuosity.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts is broken, then you should insert the little finger into its nostril and press the fracture from inside with your index finger, and from outside with the thumb, until the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do so with ease, and take care that you do not cause pain to the patient during your operation.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the upper part of the nose and the little finger cannot reach it, then you should use a thin rod to reduce it.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if there are fractures in two parts, then you should do the same.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And strive for the restoration of it on the first day of the fracture, if possible; and if not, then wait for the seventh or tenth day after the abscess formation.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And insert into the tip of the nose a piece of linen cloth if the fracture is in one part, or place two cotton swabs if the fracture is in two parts, and make sure that their size is such that they fill the nostril.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	Some of the ancient restorers say that the swabs should be soaked in bread crumbs and changed every day, but I do not see it; it is necessary that the piece of cloth is soaked in egg white mixed with powdered alum; and then leave one swab inside until the bone is set and the cartilage hardens.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And sometimes insert pieces of linen instead of swabs, in order to avoid the accumulation of pus that is wrapped in a cloth of lion; and this should be done when the fracture of the nose is more severe and the patient cannot breathe through their nose.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this method is not necessary for you; and do as you please, whether it be inserting strips of linen or using swabs.
