But if an abscess forms, then you should delay the restoration of the fracture for nine days until the abscess has subsided, and do not approach it on the third or fourth day at all, for you will cause harm.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	But if the broken bone protrudes beyond the skin and is exposed, then it is appropriate to perform surgery to reduce it and align it with your hands with ease and minimal extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	But if extension is not prepared and alignment with the tissues is difficult, then you can reduce it with your hands using this instrument, which is made of iron, and its length should be seven or eight fingers wide and its width should correspond to the size of the wound. And for this reason, it is necessary for the doctor to take three or four of these in accordance with the quantity that is needed for treatment in all types of fractures.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And be round, and of moderate size, so that it is not doubled over during the compression in the hour of the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And let it have a sharp point at both ends, with a blunt, thickened section in the middle.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is its form:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is named in Greek "labre voluntatem telarum", which means "small spatula".
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	Therefore, it is necessary for the sharp end to be placed raised above the end of the prominent bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And press it into a groove so that it returns the bone, and let it be glued with some substance.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And therefore make sure to glue the ends of the fracture together, and if the broken end is small and does not take hold of the instrument well, then you must insert the end of that bone into the instrument so that it has the power to do so.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone with what we have recommended, then insert it with whatever instruments are necessary, which we have mentioned before; or saw it with one of the saws that is possible for you to use in some way.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And carefully remove any remaining roughness or small shavings from the bone.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone is reduced and the patient still feels intense pain when it is moved, then know that the bone has not returned to its natural position; and therefore do what will bring great relief to the patient.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When your restoration of the bone is complete, then submerge it in a bath of stiptic black wine, and particularly if it is summertime, and do not place any wax nor other substance that contains oil on the wound, so that no purulence or corruption can occur.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And when your restoration of the bone is complete, then administer styptic agents during this time, and leave the wound uncovered so that you can insert a probe with forceps and use bandages according to the size of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And be sure to exercise all caution so that you do not strain the wound with the fracture, for many foolish doctors have done this and caused their patients to suffer from death, corruption, or severe illness, which is to say, health.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if the ligament is slightly loose and flexible, different from the tightness of other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the wound is large or severe, and you fear that it may be prone to complications that we have mentioned before, and you find pain in the area, then it is not advisable to use styptic agents, but rather apply a bandage of hard cloth instead of styptic agents and strengthen it with those.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And when after one or two days the wound begins to heal and generate pus, then remove the cloth that you had placed over it with wine, and then administer warm compresses, and apply ointments such as those that we use for wounds, such as tetrafarmacon and similar things.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it is advisable for you to loosen the ligament and examine the wound every day in the morning and evening until it has healed and solidified, and it is necessary that the limb be prepared in such a way that pus can easily flow from it to the surrounding areas.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If several days have passed and the wound has not healed or separated from it the pus, then know that this is a symptom of stagnation, for which reason you must inquire about the wound with probing.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those stagnations that are separate and external, those that are not separated and putrefy the limb and cause pain, be sure to incise those if it is possible for you to do so.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if there comes to the wound an abscess or ulcer, that is to say, stymenia, or another type of corruption and putrefaction, then it is necessary to apply one of those things that are appropriate for its cure, which is described in its chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o .xxx.; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And in that matter where it is necessary for my words to remain and you present your own opinion: when the large bone breaks, protrudes over the limb like the bone of the thigh and the shinbone and similar bones of the large limbs, and do not attempt attraction or extraction of it, for many have died from this; leaving it inside as long as possible, for it will easily fall out by itself after twenty or thirty days. And then treat the wound if it is visible to you, and if not, leave it alone.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	Chapter 20: On the treatment of knots that occur at the site of a fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Many times this knot occurs at the site of healing from a fracture, especially near the joints, and it takes on the shape of the limb; and it easily prevents the limb from performing its natural function.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Consider whether the swelling is recent and administer medicines that have styptic properties, such as aloe, alum, myrrh, gum tragacanth, and similar ones; so take some of these or all of them, and mix them with styptic wine or albumen of egg white, or vinegar, and apply this mixture to the swelling on a piece of cloth, and bind it firmly in place.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And leave it bound so that it is not loosened for several days; and then loosen it and reapply a new one until the swelling has subsided; or apply a flat piece of lead to it, since lead has the property of strengthening everything that is inflamed in the limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if the swelling has become hard and tight and needs to be opened urgently, then incise it at its highest point, remove the excess or prominent part, or cut it with a sharp instrument until it subsides; and take care of the interior so that it heals.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	On the restoration of fractures when it is healed and the limb should be gradually restored to its normal function using splints.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a fracture has healed and the limb is gradually restored to its normal function with splints, this should only be done for several reasons: one of which is an excess of loosening of the ligament and its improper healing; or due to excessive tightness of the ligaments preventing nutrients from reaching the limb; or due to excessive application of ointments; or due to inappropriate movement at the wrong time; or due to insufficient strength in the patient's body and their weakness.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And the treatment for this is to feed the patient and make their heart tender until their blood is replenished, administer baths, and provide joy and happiness around them.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And then apply a plaster on the limb so that the plaster attracts nutrients to it, or continue applying a warm compress to it with water until the nutrients flow back and regain their natural shape.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	On the treatment of fractured bones when they have healed crookedly and it is necessary to avoid operating on them.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When a healed limb has an unevenness or prominence in the fractured bone and swelling, which disfigures the shape of the limb, but the limb is still able to perform its natural movements, then one should not believe the words of someone who claims that the limb has been newly fractured.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But there have been many foolish doctors and healers who have done this in our land, and this operation is highly reprehensible, causing great fear, and its mark is fatal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	But if the lameness and swelling are recent, then it is appropriate to apply warm water with soft herbs such as elder flowers, rose petals, melilot, and similar ones; and make a plaster with softening ingredients such as a good dough; or take a mucilage of marshmallow root and mix it with gum tragacanth or camphor oil, and apply this mixture as a plaster; or use ripe figs, crush them with dove dung, and similar remedies that are called softening consolidants.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And sometimes it is necessary to dissolve it with gentle and constant friction using moist hands, and to promote movement of the limb in all directions at all times.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	But if the crookedness has already progressed and become hard and turned into stone, requiring surgery, then it is necessary to cut off what is above it, dissolve the continuation of the bone, and remove the excess swelling from that area with fine incisors, and make an incision in it. The patient should be given ease and care during this time.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De sermo en dislocacio.	On Dislocation and Speech.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the displacement of one of the joints from its position, which prevents movement and disfigures the limb, causing great pain and injury to the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when a dislocation occurs, it is advisable to quickly restore it to its proper position and not delay, as if it is delayed, the location becomes infected and it becomes difficult to reduce the dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for this reason, it is not advisable to move or stretch the limb during the infection, as this can cause spasms and painful cramps.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when this occurs, it is best to perform bloodletting on the patient and let them rest until the infection subsides; meanwhile, apply warm water and oil compresses to the limb, and gently restore it to its proper position with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And take care of the entire limb in accordance with what is appropriate for its recovery, so that the memory of this injury will be healed.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have now organized the chapters on dislocation as previously discussed in relation to fractures, from the uppermost part of the body to the lowest part.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	On the treatment of dislocation of the lower jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	The two lower jaws can become dislocated if not treated quickly; and this can happen in one of two ways: either they are slightly loosened from their positions and become softened a little, or they become completely dislocated so that the jaw is loose at the joint where saliva flows from the patient's mouth and they cannot close it or speak clearly, and their tongue becomes wrapped up in their words.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when the dislocation is slight, it often returns to its proper position on its own with little cause in most cases.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	If the dislocation is complete, then gentle reduction should be administered immediately, and not delayed.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the assistant should hold the head of the patient, while the doctor inserts his finger of one hand into the socket of the dislocated jaw inside the mouth of the patient, if the dislocation is on one side; or he inserts both fingers together, if the dislocation is on both sides, and the other fingers of his hand should be placed outside to guide; and he tells the patient to stop moving their jaw and release it from either side; and he guides the jaw back into place until it returns to its proper location.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction is difficult, especially if both jaws are dislocated, then administer evaporation with hot water and oil, until the reduction of both becomes easy and not delayed, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And so when they return and are guided back into place, and the mouth of the patient is closed and not swollen, then place warm cloth compresses with cerote (a type of resin) on those jaw muscles, and do it gently with wax and oil; and then bind it lightly with soft bandages.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on their back, with their head resting between two pillows, to prevent it from tilting to either side; and do not force them to chew any food; but rather have their food be cut into small pieces until the pains are relieved and the jaws are no longer swollen, then let them eat what they want.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this should be done easily and without difficulty, without applying pressure on the opening of the mouth for food and drink and speaking, until the jaw is healed and no longer swollen.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of both jaws is difficult when they are dislocated for some time and not returned to their proper locations, often this results in fevers and constant swelling, and it is easy for the belly of the patient to become distended, and it is easy for them to vomit pure bile.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, then know that it is a dangerous situation; and often the patient dies within 10 days after experiencing such symptoms.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	Chapter 25: On the reduction of the dislocation of the collarbone and the end of the muscle (likely referring to the clavicle and the biceps or triceps muscle).
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The collarbone is not dislocated from its attachment to the ribs inside the body, but sometimes it is dislocated on the outside, and this can be felt.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the treatment for it is that the patient lies down on their back and extends their arms. (likely referring to placing the arm in a specific position or using traction to reduce the dislocation)
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And then you should press on the area with your palm with strong pressure, because it will return (to its proper position). (likely referring to manipulating the collarbone back into place)
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And then apply a compress and warm cloths to that area and strengthen it. (likely referring to immobilizing the area or applying a splint after reduction)
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the end of the muscle that is connected to the collarbone is not dislocated in any day, therefore it must be reduced and guided back into place as we have said, and as you are equipped for. (likely referring to using appropriate tools or assistive devices)
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a compress and warm cloths to that area, and immobilize it, and tell the patient to rest in tranquility and to remain still until they are healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And with this method, the end of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its proper location.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Chapter 26: On the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle (likely referring to dislocation of muscles attached to bones, such as shoulder or hip)
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, one of which is when it is dislocated from the bony prominence to below (likely referring to the greater tubercle or lesser tubercle of the humerus for shoulder dislocation)
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second way is when it is dislocated above the muscle, and this occurs late; and it is not dislocated at the back by the shoulder blade, nor is it dislocated at the front by the nerves. (likely referring to cases where the muscle is dislocated in a specific direction)
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And most often it is dislocated and protrudes towards the back side below the bony prominence, especially in those with little flesh, it is easily dislocated; but in those with a lot of flesh, it protrudes outwards with difficulty. (likely referring to cases where the muscle is dislocated based on body composition)
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And often in some men, a blow or fall causes the muscle to become abscessed with a putrid abscess, and it is consumed because it has been dislocated. (likely referring to cases where injury or trauma causes infection in the dislocated area)
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore, it is necessary that you first attend to this before attempting reduction, and then proceed with the treatment of it. (likely referring to the need to address any infection or abscess before attempting reduction)
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And the dislocation of it is recognized when it is towards the back side below the bony prominence; so that you may distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the normal muscle, because there is a clear difference between them; and you will find in the head of the muscle a concavity below the bony prominence near the touch of the head of the muscle, just like a hollow, and the patient cannot move their hand to their ear, nor can they feel it with any movement.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated towards the side or above, then you will find a clear touch of it and it is not hidden. (likely referring to cases where the muscle is dislocated in those directions)
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And this dislocation can be easily reduced when it is fresh and the patient is a child. (likely referring to cases where the muscle is dislocated in young patients)
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is done by having the assistant raise the patient's arm above their head, and then placing their fingers below the bony prominence, and raising the joint with strength to its proper location; and the assistant should continue to lift the arm while extending it outwards, and then place it down gently as it returns. (likely referring to a specific technique used for reduction of shoulder dislocation)
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if it does not return as we have said, and the dislocation has just occurred, many days ago; then it is necessary that the patient bathe in warm water and be administered a poultice that softens and loosens it, just like boiled roots of elder, fenugreek, and melilot in water, and this should be applied. (likely referring to the use of warm compresses or poultices to help reduce muscle tension, inflammation and swelling)
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient should be placed lying on their back and a woolen pad should be placed below the bony prominence that is covered in linen cloth that has moderate compression; and the doctor should place his knee on the pad, and lift the head of the muscle with strength, and pull the patient's arm to prevent it from being injured at the back side; and another assistant should hold the head of the patient to prevent injury at the back side, because it will quickly return to its proper location.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish to reduce it in this manner: have a person who is taller than the patient present and stand on the side of the affected area, then insert their muscle below the bony prominence of the patient and lift the bony prominence upwards until the patient is suspended in air; and another assistant should pull the patient's arm downwards from the lower part of their abdomen.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is lightweight, then it is better that they are suspended by something else, such as a rope or sling, to add weight and help return the dislocation quickly. (likely referring to using a device or apparatus to assist in reduction)
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is also reduced in another way: by placing a long rod on the ground with a round top, like a mortar pestle, that is neither thick nor thin; and have the patient sit on it; then place a linen cloth over the top of the rod, and the patient should stand along the length of the rod, and extend their arm downwards on one side, and pull the rest of their body strongly on the other side, so that the joint returns to its proper location quickly.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if the reduction is difficult for all the reasons we have mentioned, then use this treatment: take a rod that is two arm-lengths long, and four fingers wide, and its thickness should be adjusted to fit the bony prominence in this shape:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And place linen cloths over the round top of it, so that the rod does not harm the patient. (likely referring to protecting patient's skin and soft tissues from injury during reduction)
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And place it below the bony prominence of the patient and have their arm or hand extended over the rod towards the back side, and bind the rod to the patient's body, arm and hand. (likely referring to securing the rod in place with bandages or straps)
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	And have the patient's arm placed on a step of a ladder according to its width, and their hand extended towards the back side, and the rest of their body suspended from the other side, because then the joint will quickly return to its proper location. (likely referring to using a ladder or steps to apply traction force and elevation, which would help reduce dislocation)
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the insertion of it has been completed in any manner that is possible for you, then place a woolen pad below the bony prominence of moderate size; and apply a prepared plaster made from powdered molasses, wax, and egg white over the entire muscle, as if it were rolled over it; and press firmly below the bony prominence with appropriate compression; and wrap the bandage over the plaster; and bind the patient's arm to their neck, leaving it in this position for 7 days and take care not to injure the patient's arm.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And it is necessary that the patient's food intake be moderate until the affected limb has regained strength, because this facilitates healing. (likely referring to restricting patient's diet and caloric intake to prevent additional strain on muscles and joints)
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then the food should be given gradually more, after 7 or 5 days, and gentle exercise can be performed; and when it is firm and not swollen, then it is healed. (likely referring to gradual reintroduction of normal diet and physical activity as part of recovery process)
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	If the joint is dislocated due to an excess of humidity that happens to it or for another reason, then it is necessary to apply cautery to it in three strokes, as stated in the chapter on cautery.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all of this is done and after seven days the ligament is still loose and the joint is not closed, and the bandages and tightness have been applied several times but it is still not closed, and the catheter cannot be removed from that arm because it is too swollen and cannot be raised above the level of the other parts, then you should know that the nerves, which are at the head of the muscle, have either been cut or stretched or made weak, and you should also know that the joint will never be in its proper position again.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	In the case of a dislocation, you should place your foot and hand or the parts behind it in the correct position, and then use force and stretching with your hands to return it to its proper place.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And apply another bandage to that one, and take care of it until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if there is heaviness in the limb and slowness in its movement during the healing process, then the patient should take many baths until the heaviness is relieved and they return to their normal state.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the treatment of hip dislocation.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know that the joint of the hip is dislocated with difficulty and similarly returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated on all sides, but most commonly in the front part to the back part, and the dislocation of it is not hidden from you because it is noticeable when sitting down or lying down according to the way it is dislocated. And when you adjust the dislocated hip with your hand, this is clearly shown to you because the joint is concave and cannot bend its arm or touch its own muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And it is necessary to act quickly and reduce the dislocation before pus forms, because if pus does form, then reducing the dislocation becomes difficult and healing may not occur at all, especially when it occurs in the back parts, which is the worst of all types of dislocations, causing great pain and often leading to death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce it, is that the patient's hand should be extended with two hands, and their arms should be spread out, and the hands of the doctor should be on top of the hip pushing down, while using the pads of the fingers or the edge of the palm to push the joint back into place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is in the front, then it should be returned by bending the patient's hand towards their own hand until they strike the hip with the edge of their palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not respond to reduction, then apply strong force and extension.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is necessary that two assistants hold the patient's arms and two others maintain this extension during the stretching, to prevent any rebounding during the process.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then the arms should be rotated in all directions, as they are wrapped with long folded cloth or bandages over the hand.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with their hand, anoint it with some oil to facilitate the movement of the joint and make it easier; and then press down on the joint with strong force until it returns to its proper position.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And after reducing it, a plaster should be applied to the area with styptic and absorbent properties, made from egg white, and extracted with bandages that are not too tight, and the arm should be suspended from the neck and left in this state for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it should be loosened; and so if the joint is in its proper position, then release the ligament of it and leave it alone.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint is not strengthening, then reapply the plaster and ligament, and leave it for several days until it is extracted; and then release it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if there is heaviness in the reduction of the joint and its position is unstable, then administer moisture in the form of baths and gentle friction, along with compression, until it is relieved; or place a cushion of soft material under the joint, and bind it, leaving it on the bone day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then apply that (cushion), and put it in a bath; and when it dries, then rub the joint with moderate friction, and then reapply the cushion of soft material, which is round and movable, once, twice, three times.
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Decay has already spread within the interior of the tooth before it breaks open when it is being cleaned or scraped.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, place it (the affected limb) on a moist and scarified cow's split, smeared with butter and stretched over it; and do this several times, because the split is moist and helps to restore its proper position.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the treatment of dislocation of the wrist, which is the joint between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The wrist of the hand is often dislocated and the reduction of this dislocation is easy, unlike other joints. However, it is still necessary to act quickly in reducing the dislocation at the time when it occurs before it becomes inflamed or infected.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	The reduction of the dislocation of the wrist is done by placing the patient's hand on a table and having an assistant extend the arm of the affected individual, while placing their own hand or palm over the back of the wrist joint. Then, gentle pressure is applied to push the joint back into its proper position.[20]
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, it is important to consider whether the palm is facing down towards the patient's belly or up towards the ceiling. If the palm is facing down, then the patient should place the back of their hand on the table for the extension and reduction. On the other hand, if the dislocation is in front of the palm, then the patient's hand should be placed with the palm facing up on the table, allowing the doctor to apply pressure on top of the joint.[23]
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And therefore, if it returns to its proper position quickly, that is good. But if not, then strengthen it with a plaster that reduces inflammation and leave it on; and do not repeat this process, because otherwise, the swelling will only increase and make reduction more difficult in the following days.[26]
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However, the joint may remain dislocated due to its twisting shape, and the patient may not experience any noticeable symptoms other than weakness in the affected limb. In this case, it is important to recognize that the nerves may be damaged or stretched, and that strengthening the area with cauterization may be necessary to promote healing. This should only be done with caution, however, as excessive heat can cause further damage to the affected tissues.[29]
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore, when the dislocation has been reduced, place a plaster on it as we have recommended, and leave it on to heal for five days. Then, release the plaster and allow it to rest, while gradually beginning to exercise the affected limb.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	If the patient's movements are impeded and an accident causing gravity befalls him, then gently apply warm water and perform friction several times until he is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the treatment of dislocations of the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Fingers are often dislocated in various places.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when a finger on the side of the palm or its belly is dislocated, then stretch out the digit and push the dislocation back into place with your thumbs until it returns to normal.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the digit and suspend it on the side where it is dislocated and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend it and stretch it out until it becomes straight in its proper position on that day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is night, bind it with this bandage and do not cease to unbind it during the day and exercise it with movement, and bind it again at night; and do this for several days until it becomes straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same if it is dislocated in the belly of the hand, binding it to that side and performing this first operation until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do this when it is dislocated in other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of dislocations of the vertebrae in the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When there is a complete dislocation of one of the vertebrae in the back or neck and several vertebrae have moved from their places, then at this point it cannot be cured because death is imminent for the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And the sign of this is that the patient's excretion is expelled involuntarily and they cannot retain it; and often several members of their body or two sides of them or both arms are paralyzed, or one of these; or a vertebra has moved from its place, because many have moved and much movement has occurred in all directions.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Then it has moved to the sides and is called "gelbozitat".
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But the treatment for it is that then you should consider if this lumbago has occurred in childhood, because then there is no cure nor can it be healed completely.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But for those who have it from chance or injury or similar causes, the ancients have described methods of cure in a lengthy discourse, the greatest part of which I will abbreviate here so as to avoid excess verbiage and instead provide a more concise explanation that aligns with my intent, which is what I have presented and set forth through various instruments, which I will show and expand upon.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in lumbago that occurs in the front of the foot, there is neither cure nor healing for it; and similarly in those that are made on both sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those, only the one that occurs in the back can be cured with what I have recommended.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the patient lies face-down on a hard surface close to a wall and stretches out their body with the instrument placed beneath them so as not to hurt their feet.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then place a straight rod firmly in the ground at the edge of the bed near the patient's head and another rod on the other side of the bed at their feet.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And let the assistant hold the rods, not being fixed in place; and let another assistant hold the other rod in the same manner.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then wrap the patient's head with a soft cloth and tie it tightly around their chin; stretch the end of the cloth to the rod that is by the patient's head and tie it there; and then strengthen the other cloth around their hips, knees, and legs, and adjust all the cloth strips and tie them to the other rod that is by the patient's feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then each assistant should stretch the cloth strips to their respective rods and ensure that both rods and the cloth strips are in their correct places where they have been fastened, but not fixed in place as previously mentioned.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And then the doctor places their palms on the vertebra with force until it returns to its place, or they place a board on it and adjust their feet on top of the board until it returns to its place.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return through this method, then take a table that is three cubits in length or width and carve out a space in the wall near the patient where the edge of the table can fit.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And place the majority of the table over the vertebrae, and the doctor places his feet on the other end, and pulls strongly so that the vertebra is constricted and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open (the patient) with a turning motion using your hand; and that is, place two sticks of wood on the ground beside the patient's head, the length of each stick being one arm's length, and the distance between the two sticks should be the width of a palm, and make a hole in the middle of each stick, and securely fasten each stick to the ground so that they do not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And place a round piece of wood in the hole, and it should turn in the holes of the two sticks.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of it is a hole in which the stick fits, its length being one palm's width so that it can turn, and there are similar holes in the other two sticks as well.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And pull the ligaments that you tightened on the patient's feet in the hole that is beside their head, and the ligaments that you tightened on the patient's thighs in the hole that is beside their feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And you should turn each handle and place a minister who twists the handle with his hand, and they insert the vertebra as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the shape of the device:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And when the vertebra has returned to its place and the area is cleaned, then it is necessary to apply a dry plaster with egg white, and cotton; and place over the plaster a piece of wooden board with a width of three fingers or thereabouts, and its length should be sufficient to cover the inflamed area, and place it over the affected vertebra.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And tie it with the ligament that we mentioned earlier, and feed the patient a light diet until they are healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if any residual danger remains in the area at the end of the healing process, then it is necessary to administer medicines that soften and clean with frequent administration of the device mentioned earlier, which has been recommended; and a sheet of lead should be applied to the affected area.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes it happens that danger is present in the lower vertebrae of the back, and this is due to dislocation; and this bone is at risk, so it is important that no pressure is applied to it with this medicine, as even a small amount can lead to death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Capital XXxi. (This would be the title of the next section or chapter)
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle only become dislocated, and do not have the same symptoms as other joints with small displacement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip can become dislocated in four ways: it can become dislocated towards the inside, or outside, or front, or back.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And most often, it becomes dislocated towards the inside, and less frequently towards the front or back.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of a dislocation towards the inside is that when you align the healthy leg of the patient with the affected leg, the affected leg appears longer and more prominent than the healthy leg, and the patient cannot bend their knee as much as the healthy leg, and this is the location of an abscess or boil that causes pain when touched, because the head of the thigh bone has moved forward.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of a dislocation towards the outside is that the symptoms are opposite to those mentioned above.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of a dislocation towards the front is that the leg appears to be extended according to its normal length, but it cannot be bent due to pain in the knee joint, and if they try to walk, they are unable to move their legs forward; and their urine becomes retained and the area around the bladder becomes inflamed, and their movement should be limited to a horizontal position. [
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of a dislocation towards the back is that the knee does not extend, and cannot be bent further than the bend in the thigh, and the leg appears shorter than the other leg, and the area around the hip joint becomes soft, and the head of the thigh bone has moved backwards.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	However, in the treatment of this dislocation, if the dislocation is old and chronic, you should consider whether it has become fixed due to long-standing immobility, and if so, then you can attempt reduction while being mindful of its position; but if not, then it is important that no force is applied during the treatment.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in the case of a recent dislocation that is one of the four types mentioned earlier, it is necessary to manipulate the joint and extend it towards the inside and outside, while also moving it from side to side, as this will allow it to easily return to its normal position without requiring further treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	However, if the joint does not return to its normal position through manipulation alone, then it is necessary to prepare a strong assistant who will extend the leg downwards at the lower end, or upwards towards the thigh, or with a ligament tied above the knee; and another assistant should extend their hand over the patient's abdomen in such a way as to place their fingers on the hip bone, while pulling on the ligament that is tied around the thigh bone; and then pull strongly on the ligament near the hip joint, while holding the end of the ligament with another assistant.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And this extension involves pulling the affected area towards the groin or towards the back to align it with the spine.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And this extension should be done in one motion, so that the patient is raised from the ground with their body suspended in the air.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of extension is common to all four types of dislocation.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns through the method described, it will be good; but if not, then it is necessary for each type of dislocation to proceed with its own treatment as I have described earlier.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the treatment of a dislocation towards the inside, it is necessary for the patient to lie on their good side, and then you should place ligaments over the hip joint in the area between the head of the thigh bone and the point just below the knee; and then pull upwards on the ligament starting from the groin area and extending towards the highest point of the pelvic bone. [
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And have another strong assistant take hold of the patient's arms and press firmly on the large muscle of the affected hip while extending it outwards forcefully, as this will help the dislocation return to its proper position.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this type of treatment is easier than the others for reducing this limb.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if the patient resists and does not follow your instructions with this type of treatment, then it is necessary to tie both of their legs together securely with a ligament at the ankles and knees.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let each ligament be four fingers wide, and the affected leg should be extended more than the healthy leg by two fingers width.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And have the patient suspended by their head over the end of the table or bench, so that they are lying face down, and make sure there is a distance of two arm's length between them and the ground. [
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And order a strong young man to press down on the head of the thigh bone while another strong young man pulls up on the thigh, as this will help the joint return to its proper position quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	However, in the treatment of a dislocation towards the outside, it is necessary for the patient to lie on their back with their knee bent as described earlier, and then pull strongly on the ligaments over the affected leg and foot.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And place two sticks, one under the patient's feet and the other behind their head, and place another stick adjusted to the middle of the back so that warm cloths can be wrapped around it, in order to prevent the stick from causing discomfort to the patient, especially during the extension movement.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And have each assistant pull on their respective side, while the doctor uses their hand to guide the reduction according to their skill and expertise.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if the patient follows these instructions, it will be good for them; but if not, then apply gentle pressure and follow the steps I have described earlier to guide the reduction carefully.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	And it is necessary that the patient lies calmly on their side.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is towards the front, then it is necessary to slightly extend the leg and place it on a mound as described earlier; and place the palm of your right hand over the affected knee and use your other hand to push downwards on the thigh, while pushing up on the calf with the same hand. [
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is towards the back, then it is not necessary to extend the leg downwards and the patient should be raised off the ground; instead, place the patient on a firm surface as described earlier when discussing how to position the patient when the hip joint is dislocated towards the outside, with their face facing upwards and the ligaments extended as previously described.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it is necessary to apply pressure with a board on the area where the joint has become dislocated.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	And when the reduction is completed as necessary, and you see that the patient's legs are of equal length and the patient can extend their leg without resistance or pain, then you know that the limb has returned to its proper position; and in this case, align the hips and apply a plaster with bandages to hold them in place, taking care not to damage the joint in any way. Then instruct the patient to rest for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then remove the bandages and plaster and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	And if you see that the legs are equal in appearance, then you know that the dislocation has been successfully reduced and can allow the patient to move freely again.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you notice any signs of swelling or inflammation, then reapply the bandages and plaster, and immobilize the joint again, taking care to maintain the correct alignment, and leave it in place for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then remove the bandages and allow the patient to move slowly after several days, once they have regained strength in the affected limb.
Capitol .xxxii.	Capital XXXII. (This would be the title of the next section or chapter)
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the treatment of a dislocated knee.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The knee joint can become dislocated in three ways: towards the front, towards the back, and towards the sides (but not towards the front).
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of a dislocated knee is that when you command the patient to bend their leg at the knee, you will know that it is dislocated.
